She sews aprons, blouses, fustanes [skirts], and centros [short dresses made of flannel typically worn by indigenous women].  She sells her wares in the Ayacucho, Huanta, Sachabamba, Matará, and Seccelambras markets.  She learned how to sew as a child with her mother.  Her husband is also a tailor and together they opened a tailor's shop where they make uniforms, three-piece suits, aprons, blouses, and fustanes.

The money from the loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, organza, lace and thread.

Working with Finca has changed her life, because her business has grown so much.  What she likes most about her communal bank is that she can save money and access credit.  She has also learned a lot in the family, marriage, and domestic violence trainings.

Her biggest dreams are that her business grows and her children become business professionals.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, organza, lace, and thread

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, posee una pupuseria, tiene 49 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, vive con su padre y sus tres hijos, el negocio lo comenzó hace 5 años, siendo primeramente de su mamá pero enfermo y Rosa se quedo al frente para administrarlo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería que utiliza en la pupuseria, esta inversión le ayudara a tener mejores ventas y a brindar un mejor servicio, ella comprara productos como pollo, chicharrón, quesillo, repollo y otros que son parte de los preparativos para hacer las pupusas.
Su principal objetivo es administrar bien el dinero de este préstamo y que sus ganancias le permitan pagar puntualmente las cuotas del préstamo para crear un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Rosa owns a pupuseria [a shop selling the typical Salvadorian dish of meat, cheese, and or beans inside a corn tortilla pocket], is 49, and lives in Jiquilisco, Usulatan department. She lives with her father and three children. The business was started 5 years ago. It was primarily her mother’s, but when she got sick, Rosa stayed and ran the business. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to use in the pupuseria. This investment will help her have better sales and provide better service. She will purchase products necessary for making pupusas such as chicken, chicharrón [fried pork skin], quesillo [soft cheese], and cabbage.
Her main objectives are to budget the money from this loan well and to earn enough to make her loan payments on time to build a good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase chicharron, cheese, chicken, and cabbage

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man with four children who are in school.  He farms for a living.  He has managed to educate his children and buy a piece of land through Faulu Kenya.  He has been running his business for twenty years and employs two people.  He has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pipes.  He hopes to be a farm produce exporter in the future and has a five-year plan to own a truck.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pipes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora Xachatryan is married and lives with her in-laws and daughter-in-law. Flora’s son has gone to Russia to make money to buy an apartment back at home. Every member of Flora’s family plays an important role in their family’s household economy.  Flora is a teacher, her husband works in a factory. The family keeps cattle and cultivates the land as additional and main income. By now Flora’s son has been able to save some money to come back to the motherland and purchase an apartment to live separately with his wife. Flora and her husband would like to help the young family stand on their feet. Flora has applied for the loan to sow a special wheat that yields a rich crop, thus extending the family business and income.

loans.use: To purchase wheat to sow

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward M’atheru is a farmer residing in the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya.  He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years.  He produces beans, maize, millet, passion fruit, bananas, and milk that he sells to the local market.

Edward has a monthly pension, as he used to work as a veterinarian.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes to improve the dairy-farming aspect of his business and buy 3 more dairy cows.  The extra income from the loan will improve his family's living standards.  His main challenge is the high cost of dairy feed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tamales, pan y tostadas de plátano, su esposo se llama Andrés Abelino Amaya y sus dos hijos Glenda Patricia de 8 años, Brenda Beatriz de 10 años de edad, ella sale a ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulante tiene un día especial para ofrecer cada producto, por ejemplo un día vende ropa, el siguiente tamales, el próximo pan y así sucesivamente  realiza sus ventas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en ropa, con esta compra ella espera ofrece a los clientes más prendas de vestir, de distintos colores y para todos los gustos. 
Su objetivo es contar siempre con una fuente de ingreso para dar a sus hijos un sano crecimiento sin faltarles la alimentación y la educación  para que se puedan preparar y mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Ana lives in San Carlos, in the Morazán department.  She has a business selling clothing, tamales, bread and banana tostadas. She has a husband, named Andres Abelino Amaya, and two children: Glenda Patricia, 8, and Brenda Beatriz, 10.  She goes out to offer her merchandise for sale in the streets.  She has allocates one day a week to sell each product.  For example, one day it will be clothing, the next tamales, the next bread, and so on.  She is requesting a loan to invest in clothing; with these purchases she hopes to offer her customers more garments in different colors for every taste.

Her goal is to always have a source of income so that she can provide her children with conditions that will lead to healthy growth, and so that they will not lack for food or an education that will prepare them for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Burisika

texts.en:
Burisika is 52 years old and is from the Khiwesero area.  She is married to David, a businessman. They have four children who are between 22 years and 12 years old.

Burisika is a tailor and has been in this business for the past 2 years. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 6,500. She is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy clothing materials to add to her stock. She has received quite a number of orders from her clients and wants to meet their demands. The profits made from this business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to be able to open up a tailoring college in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for tailor shop

loans.name: Ologolimot Ole

texts.en:
Ologoikot Ole K. is 23 years old. He is married to Nadupoi K. and is a father of eight children aged between three to twelve years. Ologoikot is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last twenty eight years.
  
Ologoikot learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan and he is planning to prepare land for the next planting season and buy more farm supplies. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Ologoikot hopes to become a large scale farmer in wheat and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To prepare land for next planting season and buy more farm supplies

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Raquilina es socia del bancomunal Unidas, que inicia su sexto ciclo con 14 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios.
Raquilina es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 12,11 y 9 años D. edasd, D. los caules 2 son mujeres y 1 varoncito.
Raquilina, antes trabajaba  fuera D. su casa, un día acordó con su esposo abrir una tienda en su casa porque quería estar más cerca D. sus hijos, tenían unos ahorros con eso comenzaron, ahora en su tienda venD. abarrotes surtidos como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, detergente, jabón, verduras surtidas y frutas.
Está en Finca hace dos ciclos, le gusta porque pueD. ahorrar les hablan mucho D. los valores, la familia y del negocio.
Raquilina solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio con la compra D. mercadería como son verduras, papa, frutas, arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El sueño D. Raquilina es ahcer crecer su negocio y que su familia se mantenga unida.
texts.en:
Raquilina is a member of the "Unidas" [United Women] communal bank. It is starting its sixth loan cycle, with 14 members who operate a range of businesses. 

Raquilina is married and has 3 children, two girls and a boy, aged 12, 11 and 9. 

Earlier, Raquilina worked outsiD. the home, but one day she and her husband decided that she would open a store in her home, because she wanted to be closer to her children. They had saved some money, which they used to get started. Now, she sells assorted groceries in her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, detergent, soap, and assorted fruits and vegetables. 

She has been working with FINCA for two loan cycles, and she likes it because she can save money, and people talk to the members about values, family and business. 

Raquilina is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing merchandise such as vegetables, potatoes, fruits, rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Raquilina's dream is to expand her business and to keep her family united.

loans.use: Buying vegetables, potatoes, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en: Valya O. lives with her 2 daugheters, one of whom is a student and the other one helps her mother run the clothing business. Valya has been trading clothes and coats since 1995.  She is a successful businesswoman, always meeting her clients’ demands and maintaining very good relationships with them. Valya needs to acquire winter coats for the coming season. With a good credit history behind her, Valya has applied for the loan to cover the purchasing expenses.

loans.use: To purchase coats for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items and catering materials

loans.name: Adelaida Olimpia

texts.es:
Adelaida Olimpia C. H. tiene 69 anos. Es viuda  vive con un sobrino, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Adelaida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz trigo y papas además a los quehaceres domésticos, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es trabajar hasta que dios le permita.

Le gusta ir de visita a donde sus hijos por que ellos viven en la ciudad ademas le guata festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Adelaida Olimpia C. H. is 69 years old. She is widowed and lives with a nephew in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. She has eight children who are all adults.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group work in agriculture and the group is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. The group consists of approximately ten members, all of whom live in the same area and the majority work growing corn, wheat and potatoes.

Adelaida works in agriculture growing corn, wheat and potatoes, in addition to doing the household chores. She makes her purchases in the San Pablo parish and makes her sales at the San Pablo market.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to work until God allows her.

She likes to go visit her children because they live in the city, and she also likes to participate in the area celebrations.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Cpk Ii Plus Group

texts.en:
John B., aged 41 and married, was elected as the president of the Community Bank named “CPK II Plus”, which consists of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

John sells iron bars, pipes, etc. at the market located west of Kinshasa. He started his business in 1990 by selling duplicating paper. John is happy right now as he is going to be able to buy iron bars and water pipes with the loan, have a greater range of stock, and be able to meet his customers' demand. 

John makes a profit of US$100 per week. With the money he earns, he hopes to provide financial support for his family. His dream is to someday open a hardware and a clothing store. John has four children aged between 3 and 11 years. Three of them go to school. He also takes care of five children left by his relatives.

loans.use: To buy iron bars, pipes, etc. for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “San Francisco”,  están en el Primer Ciclo con  10 integrantes y sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Lucina quien se dedica a la producción de leche, y mediante esta actividad ella obtiene su ingreso para ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que se encuentra muy contenta con el grupo y desean continuar, e incluir a otras señoras para que pueden recibir tambien las
capacitaciones y los créditos.
Ella quiere continuar con el comité e ir aumentando los montos de los créditos de  manera que los   mismos puedan ayudar mejorar la produccion que cada una tiene.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para algunos gasto familiares que cuenta.
texts.en:
This is the San Francisco communal bank’s first loan cycle. The group consists of ten members, each with their respective business. They are very close, responsible, and supportive with one another.

One of the group members is Lucina, who works producing milk to earn money to help her family. She comments that she is very happy with the group and that they want to continue and include more women in the group who can receive the training and loans. She wants the group to continue increasing the loan amounts so that each member can help to improve their business.

Lucina is currently requesting a loan for some of the family expenses that she has.

loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Grace Nayianoi Ene

texts.en:
Grace Nayianoi Ene L. is 32 years old. She is married to Tonou L. and is a mother of four school-going children. Grace is a farmer and does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for the last fourteen years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend to prepare land for maize planting.  Maize is a plant that does well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to complete her house and expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Grace's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land for maize planting

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José  O. P. tiene 70 años. Es casado  vive la esposa, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el campo y comprar un terreno.

Le gusta salir a ver el ganado vacuno, y festejar las fiestas del pueblo.
texts.en:
José O. P. is 70 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. He has five children who are all adults.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group work in agriculture and the group is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. The group consists of approximately 10 members, all of whom live in the same area and the majority work growing corn, wheat and potatoes.

José works in agriculture growing corn, wheat and potatoes. He makes his purchases in the San Pablo parish and makes his sales at the San Pablo market.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. His dream is to continue working in the fields and to purchase a piece of land.

He likes to go see cattle and also likes to participate in the area celebrations.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence K.  is a resident and farmer in Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He produces French beans, cabbages, potatoes and carrots, which he sells at the local market.

He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years.  He also gets extra income from teaching.  He has two employees on a temporary basis.

He has requested this loan of KES 35,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to  buy a dairy cow. He expects  to buy three  dairy cows in the future.

Lawrence’s main challenges are diseases, crop failure due to unpredictable weather conditions, and poor market for the products.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joseph M.

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old, married to Susan, and their children are all grown up. He lives in Kaliini, Emali, which is along one of the major highways in the country. He has been farming for the last thirteen years. He plants crops like bananas, pawpaw, among other food crops.

He found out about KADET through a community awareness program organized by the local authorities. This is his second loan with KADET and he has not borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, Joseph plans to buy fertilizers and seeds to prepare for the planting season. The rest of the money will be used for labour on the farm.

He is determined to make his farm more productive by employing new methods of agriculture so that he can maximize his returns.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds (Kshs 13,000); labour to cultivate the farm (Kshs 7,000)

loans.name: Carlos Elias

texts.es:
Carlos Elias  M. M. tiene 24 años. Es casado  vive la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable y comprar un  terreno para hacer la casa para la familia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales del recinto y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Elias M. M. is 24 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group work in agriculture and the group is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. The group consists of approximately 10 members, all of whom live in the same area and the majority work growing corn, wheat and potatoes.

Carlos works in agriculture growing corn, beans, wheat and potatoes. He makes his purchases in the San Pablo parish and makes his sales at the San Pablo market.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. His dream is to have a stable job and to purchase a piece of land to make a house for his family.

He likes to participate in the community celebrations and spend time with his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 35 years old and is married with four children. He does dairy farming in Kiambu. To earn extra income, James is employed as a matatu (public service vehicle) driver in Kiambu. He is hardworking and God fearing and hopes to be self-employed in the future. In five years, James plans to be a prosperous dairy farmer. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow to add to his already existing livestock.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Teresa Eloina

texts.es:
Teresa de 47 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) y ropa. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal ya que no tenia oportunidad de trabajar en otra actividad. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes vendiendo los productos a sus vecinos y conocidos vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u, cremas, desodorantes, bisutería etc. Una de las estrategias para vender mas rápido es dar a crédito a sus clientes los productos.  
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, bisutería. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y variar sus ventas con ropa, sabanas para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old and sells products from Yanbal (a business that offers enterprising women the opportunity to begin independent sales) and clothing. She lives in a periurban area in the Perimetral of Guayaquil, an area surrounding by a marsh, and has all of the basic utilities.

She began to work selling Yanbal products because she did not have the opportunity to work in another business. Little by little, she expanded her list of clients, selling the products to her neighbors and acquaintances. She sells perfumes for $25-75 each, creams, deodorants, jewelry, etc. One of her strategies to sell faster is to give the products to her customers on credit.

With the loan, she wants to purchase Yanbal products such as perfumes, creams, and jewelry. In the future, she wants to make housing improvements and diversify her clothing and sheets sales to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, jewelry

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Nancy. She is a widow and has 2 children ages 29 and 26. She has another child who lives with her who is part of her extended family. In 2004, Nancy established her drinks business because she wanted to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 2809680 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3000000 to buy additional drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 561936. In the future, Nancy plans to complete construction work on her home from the proceeds of the loan and would also like to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional drinks

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane M. lives in Masis town, Armenia.  She has been selling fruit and vegetables since 1995.  Gayane is a sole proprietor and has achieved success in business thanks to her tolerant nature, good business skills, and competitive prices. 

She is trading at the back of the Armenian Market, where the renting prices are lower and the fruit and vegetable prices are correspondingly lower.  In addition to having market clients, Gayane also supplies restaurants. Her son and husband help her by delivering the orders. Autumn is a high season for fruits and vegetables in Armenia. Gayane is planning to increase her working capital, and therefore she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock up fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anna M.

texts.en:
Anna is a woman of 54 years, married to G., who is a farmer. She stays in Kalii, Emali which is a peri-urban area.  She operates a general shop where she sells food items like flour, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. This is her primary business which she has been running for the last six years. Her secondary business is farming which she does on the family farm and later selling the produce at a profit.
 
She came to know about KADET through a community awareness event, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to add more stock with the following items: sugar, bales of flour, rice, salt, and others for Kshs 10,000, and also she wants to invest the rest in farming.

She hopes to give her family a better life.

loans.use: To invest in farm & to restock her retail shop

loans.name: Jorge Ovidio

texts.es:
Jorge Ovidio F. tiene 58 años. Es viudo  vive con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo. 
 
Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para dejar a los hijos que sigan trabajando.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales del recinto y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Ovidio F. is 58 years old. He is a widower and lives with his children. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar province. He has 5 children. 

The members of the "Unidos Somos Mas" ["Together We Are More"] communal bank work in agriculture. This rural cooperative is located 45 minutes from San Miguel, in Ríos a la Costa. All of the members live in the same area. Most of them work growing corn, wheat and potatoes. The communal bank has about 10 members. 

Jorge works in agriculture, growing corn, beans, wheat and potatoes. He makes his purchases in San Pablo parish and sells his goods at the San Pablo market. 
 
He is requesting the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan will help him economically so he can cover his needs. His dream is to buy land to leave to his children who will continue to work in this area. 

He enjoys celebrating at local religious festivals and spending time with his family.

loans.use: Buying supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Anda Yolanda

texts.es: Anda Yolanda tiene 33 años, su actividad es una pulpería hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y le gusta relacionarse con sus clientes, por lo que siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos es una persona muy responsable y busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Inicio como un medio de vida necesario para su negocio, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, detergentes entre otras cosas importantes, por lo que tiene que surtir por que se acerca la temporada navideña.
texts.en: Anda Yolanda is 33 years old. Her business is a general store. She has run this business for more than 12 years. She is a very determined woman, and she enjoys interacting with her customers, who are always asking her for a wide range of products. She is a very responsible person who is seeking a way to increase her income. She started her business to support herself, and she is always attentive to her customers' requests. The loan is to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, juices, and detergents, among other important items, since she has to stock her store in anticipation of the Christmas season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es productor lechero, cuya producción es  comercializada a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de productos lácteos). Vive en la casa de sus padres, en la comunidad Ticuyo, a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene tres vacas lecheras, cuya leche es enviada al módulo que existe en su comunidad para su venta a la planta industrilizadora de leche; de esta manera genera ingresos para su manutención.
El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Fernando produces milk.  He sells his milk to the PIL (industrial milk processing plant.)  He lives in his parent's house in the community of Ticuyo, which is 3 hours from the city of La Paz.  He has 3 milk cows, whose milk is sent to the milk processing plant in his community.  In this way he generates income to support himself.  He now requests a loan to purchase another dairy cow, so that in this way he can increase his earnings.

This is his second loan with IMPRO, and his first loan funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase his production of milk.

loans.name: Ricardo Daniel

texts.es:
Ricardo Daniel R. Q. tiene 45 años. Es casado  vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.
Ricardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo. 
 
Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir en el trabajo. 

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales del recinto y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo Daniel R. Q. is 45 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children.  He lives in the canton of San Miguel in the Bolivar province.  He has 6 children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Unidos Somos Mas" are farmers.  This communal bank is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa.  All of the members live in the same rural district, and the majority of them work cultivating corn, wheat and potatoes.  This communal bank has 10 members.

Ricardo is a farmer who cultivates corn, beans, wheat and potatoes.  He makes his purchases in the San Pablo parish, and sells his products in the San Pablo market.

He requests a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to buy the supplies he needs.  The farmers in this area face challenges such as pests and diseases that affect their crops.  His dream is to buy land so that he can continue to work.

He enjoys celebrating the patron saint festivities in his area, and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy dairy goats

loans.name: Banungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean-Pierre is the leader of the Community Bank named “Banungi Plus”, which consists of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Jean-Pierre sells pairs of shoes, slippers, etc. for women at the market located east of Kinshasa. He started his business in 2009. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. He has already received six MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. The loans he has received have helped him support his family.   He makes $80 profit each week. 

Jean-Pierre intends with the next loan to purchase more pairs of shoes needed by his customers and generate additional profits. His ambition is to someday open a shoe shop in his area. He is 52 years old, married, and is the father of six children whose ages vary between 8 and 16. Three of them attend school. He also takes care of his nephew.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Henry Ngugi

texts.en:
Henry is 25 years old and married to Irene, who runs another business. He has been selling clothes for the past five years with an income of 10,000 Kenya shillings.

He is taking the second loan with KADET after serving the previous one without any difficulty. He has never borrowed from another MFI. He hopes to become a leading boutique owner in the area, which will see his family living a happy life.

loans.use: To buy variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Pedrino

texts.es:
Don Pedrino, tiene una tienda donde ofrece distintas cosas, él comercializa hamacas, ropa y calzado, vive en El Divisadero, departamento de Morazán, en su vivienda solo lo acompaña su esposa y un nieto.
El negocio de don Pedrino es una tienda que la ubica en su casa de habitación, cultiva maíz y maicillo, además de forma ambulante ofrece a las personas de la zona  hamacas, ropa y calzado, es una persona emprendedora y siempre busca la manera para recibir ingresos para su hogar, hoy día el solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, jabón y otros productos para la tienda, con esta ayuda el estará incrementando sus productos del inventario y tener a disponibilidad para los clientes.
Su propósito es mantenerse estable con los negocios y seguir viendo cualquier actividad como una oportunidad para aumentar su potencial económico, también desea vivir en tranquilidad con su familia preparados por cualquier imprevisto.
texts.en:
Pedrino has a store where he offers his customers a variety of things.  He sells hammocks, clothing and shoes.  He lives in El Divisadero, in the Morazan department.  In his house he is accompanied by his wife and grandson.

Pedrino's business is a store that is set up in his house, and he also cultivates corn and sorghum.  In addition, he sells hammocks, clothing and shoes door-to-door to people in his neighborhood.  He is an enterprising person who is always on the lookout for ways to generate income for his household.  Today, he requests a loan to buy rice, beans, soap and other products for his store.  With the help of this loan, he will increase his inventory of products and have more products available for his customers.

His goal is to keep his businesses stable, and to continue to look for any opportunity to increase his economic potential.  In addition, he desires to lives in tranquility with his family and be prepared for any unexpected expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional food items

loans.name: Las Alpaquitas Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Las Alpaquitas” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha reunido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.    La banca comunal está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son:  venta de trajes en sastrería, tienda de artefactos electrónicos, tejido en tienda, servicio de café, papas fritas, costura de pantalones, venta de ají, venta de juguetes, venta de carne de cordero y chuño.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Elena Santa,  está casada, es madre de 2 hijos.  La señora Elena Santa tiene como negocio una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, la misma es atendida desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las diez y media de la noche, debido al horario de atención recibe la colaboración de su esposo y de sus hijos.
El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de mercadería para la tienda, en particular para abarrotes.

Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la atención en crédito por que es rápida.  Con respecto a la atención en  salud indica que ha sido muy bien orientada con respecto a su embarazo.
texts.en:
The 'Las Alpaquitas' community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  This is a new group which has come together to receive loan services, training and health services.  The bank has eight members.  The members' businesses are: selling clothes in a tailor's shop, electronic goods store, knitting store, café service, selling french fries, sewing pants, selling chili peppers, selling toys, selling lamb and selling potato flour.

The community bank's president is Elena Santa.  She is married and has 2 children.  Elena Santa has a neighborhood store in her home.  She serves in her store from 6.30 in the morning until 10.30 at night.  Owing to the hours she works in the store, she receives help from her husband and her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her store, in particular for groceries.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she comments that she likes the loan service because it is quick.  Regarding the health services, she says that she has been very well advised with respect to her pregnancy.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. is 38 years old and married to Kennedy Lukale. They have two children, aged 13 years and 9 years. They live in the Khiwisero area in Kakamega.

Judith has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend. She wants to use the money to buy several bales of clothes to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: Buy several bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Sandra Rosibel

texts.es:
Sandra reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de pan francés, es una señora de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y su único hijo tiene 16 años y vive junto a ella.
Sandra tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de venta, y la realiza de 5:00am hasta las 11:00am; esta es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para alimentar a su hijo, y cubrir los gastos del hogar. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para dedicarse al mismo tiempo a otra actividad como lo es vender panes con pollo y tamales, siempre viendo la forma de ganar más para que no les falte nada en su hogar y puedan ir saliendo de sus gastos diarios.
Ella sueña con algún día lograr tener su propia casa con el esfuerzo de su trabajo  y esperando en Dios que lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  She sells French bread.  She is 43 years old, a single mother and her only child is 16 years old and lives with her.

Sandra has been in this business for 6 years and she works from 5.00am to 11.00am.  This is her source of income which she relies on to feed her son and cover their household expenses.  She is requesting a loan so that she can also spend time on another business activity which is selling 'pan con pollo' (traditional Salvadorean chicken sandwiches with a tomato-based sauce) and tamales.  She is always looking for a way to make more money so that her household doesn't want for anything and so that they can continue covering their daily expenses.

Sandra dreams of some day owning her own home through the effort of her work and is hoping in God that she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy supplies for selling 'panes con pollo' and tamales

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro A. A. tiene 65 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y arreglar la fachada de mi casa.
Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro A. A. is 65 years old. He lives in a common law relationship with his partner and their children in San Miguel canton in Bolívar province. He has 4 children.

The members of V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas (United We Are More Cooperative Rural Bank) are engaged in agriculture. This cooperative is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. Most of the members work growing corn, wheat, and potatoes. There are approximately 10 members of this rural cooperative.

Pedro works in agriculture raising corn, beans, wheat, and potatoes. He carries out his purchases in San Pablo Parish and sells in the San Pablo market.

He is applying for this loan in order to purchase supplies and fertilizer for his crops. With the loan he will be helped economically to meet his needs. He confronts challenges such as pests and diseases. His dream is to purchase land and repair the façade of his house. He likes to take walks with his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old and is a single mother of two. For a living, she operates a general store where she stocks cereals and other food stuffs as well as household goods. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy cereals, sugar, flour, rice, soap, among other products. 

Her business is located in a busy and densely populated area, and the residents are her customers. She hopes to start a mini-supermarket in the future. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records through training offered by the company.

loans.use: To buy cereals, sugar, flour, rice, soap, etc. for resale

loans.name: Yenny Alexandra

texts.es:
Yenny de 31 años, vende comida rápida. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Poco a poco con algunos ahorros y la experiencia que tenía en vender comidas decidió tener su propio negocio de comida rápida. Ahora tiene su pequeño puesto de comida en donde trabaja todos los días con ayuda de sus hijos. Vende salchipapas (salchichas con papas, con pollo) bebidas. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una cocina industrial para hacer con mas volumen sus salchipapas.

En el futuro quiere amplia su local y compra mas utensilios para hacer mas comida rapidas.
texts.en:
Yenny, 31, sells fast food.  She lives in a periurban area in Guayaquil’s outskirts, called Duran, that is noted for its deteriorating environment.

Little by little using some savings and her experience selling food she decided to have her own fast food business.  Now she has a small stand where she works every day with her children’s help.  She sells salchipapas (sausages with potatoes, with chicken) and beverages.  She wants to stay in business so wants to buy an industrial stove with the loan so that she can make larger volumes of salchipapas.

In the future she’d like to expand her stand and buy more utensils to make more fast food.

loans.use: For an industrial stove.

loans.name: Mercedes Paola

texts.es:
Mercedes Paola B. F. tiene 22 años. Es casada  vive con el esposo y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.
  
Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia y leer la prensa.
texts.en:
Mercedes Paola B. F., 22, is married and lives with her husband and son in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.  She has one son.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Mas” (United We Are More) communal bank are farmers.  It is located forty five minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa.  All the members live in the same area and most farm corn, wheat and potatoes.  This communal bank has approximately 10 members.

Mercedes farms corn, broad bean, wheat and potatoes.  She makes her purchases in San Pablo parish and her sales in the San Pablo Market.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.  Support from the loan will help her meet her economic needs.  They face challenges like pest infestations and illnesses.  Her dream is to buy land and provide education for her children.

She enjoys going on family outings and reading the newspaper.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Progression Plus Group

texts.en:
Progression Plus is a Community Bank made up of 15 members whose chairwoman is Thérèse K.. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC. 

Thérèse makes and sells doughnuts. She began her business in 1993. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits and different loans she received from HOPE DRC. Thérèse is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of the inputs with her next loan by buying wheat flour, yeast and vegetable oil for making doughnuts and reselling them at a profit. Her business brings in US$40 of profit each week. Her dream is to someday open a drugstore in her environment. Thérèse is 38 years old, married and the mother of seven children whose ages range from 6 to 20 years old. All of them are pupils.

loans.use: To increase  the stock of wheat flour, yeast, and vegetable oil for making doughnuts to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto es un joven de 21 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es empleado de la agencia Alpina de Jiquilisco, el vive con su madre y sus hermanos, él es soltero, no tiene hijos; su madre vende refrescos en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco.
Gilberto quiere ayudar a su madre para reparar el piso de su casa pero no cuenta con los fondos suficientes para comprar los materiales, él quiere encementar el piso ya que es de tierra y de esta manera estará más bonita y en mejores condiciones.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación no duda en algún día lograrlo para cambiar así la apariencia del hogar y las condiciones actuales en las que viven.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a 21-year-old young man who lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department.  He’s employed by Alpina (bottled water firm) in Jiquilisco.  He lives with his mother and siblings.  He’s single and doesn’t have any children.  His mother sells refreshments in the Jiquilisco Municipal Market.

Gilberto wants to help his mother repair the floor in their house but lacks enough funds to buy the materials.  He wants to lay a cement floor because it’s currently dirt.  This way it will be prettier and in better conditions.

His dream is to gradually, with effort and dedication, improve his home.  He doesn’t doubt that someday he will accomplish this to change its appearance and the current conditions they live in.

loans.use: To repair the floor in his house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49 years old and a resident of Muranga Town in Central Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for 25 years, producing bananas and milk, both of which are sold within the local market.She has one farmhand on casual terms.

She has applied for this loan of 33,604 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank to secure water for the bananas as well as for domestic use. She says much time and money is spent on fetching water and the provision of the loan would be a great relief.

She reckons the future is bright with Juhudi Kilimo's loan services. She has successfully paid a loan of 10,000 KES.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa L. G. tiene 40 años. Es soltera  vive con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Teresa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar una casa para los hijos.
Le gusta tejer y festejar todas las fiestas del año.
texts.en:
Teresa L. Guamán, 40, is single and lives with her children in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province; she has four children.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Mas” (United We Are More) communal bank are farmers.  This communal bank is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa.  All the members live in the same area and most are corn, wheat and potato farmers.  The bank has approximately 10 members.

Teresa is a corn, broad bean, wheat and potato farmer.  She makes her purchases in San Pablo parish and her sales in San Pablo Market.

She is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.  Support from the loan will help her meet her economic needs.  They face challenges like pest infestations and illnesses.  Her dream is to buy a house for her children.

She enjoys knitting and participating in all the year’s festivals.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more synthetic hair and other hairdressing materials

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en: Misheck is a 35-year-old businessman. He operates "Mukurinu Juakali," where he manufactures chip warmers, Juakali jikos (locally manufactured cookers) and chip choppers, among other products. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine and metallic sheets. He describes himself as hardworking and honest and hopes to provide a good life for his family. Through Faulu loans, his business has grown.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and metallic sheets

loans.name: Ana Ersidia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 34 años D. edad, es empleada y además comercializa ganado, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, el mayor D. 15 años y el menor D. 6 años D. edad, residen en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, su negocio consiste en la compra y venta D. ganado su estrategia es comprar cuando esta barato el precio y los alimentan hasta que los precios suben para poder venderlos.
Ella quiere comprar más ganado para realizarlo solicita un préstamo y poder hacer la compra; con esta ayuda aumentara el número D. animales para alimentar y comercializar con la posibilidad D. obtener mejores ganancias.
El sueño D. Ana es ser una comerciante D. ganado en granD., estabilizar su condición económica y seguir con mucho entusiasmo progresando para mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, is employed; she also raises cattle.  She lives with her husband and four children.  The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 6.  They live in Jiquilisco, Usulután department.  Her business consists in buying and selling cattle.  Her strategy consists in buying when the price is low, fattening them up and then selling them when prices rise.

She wants to buy more cattle so requested a loan to do so.  This help will make it possible for her to increase herd size to raise leading to the possibility of better profits.

Ana’s dream is to be a large cattle merchant, to stabilize her economic situation and to continue making progress with much enthusiasm to improve daily.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Santiago Emiro

texts.es: Santiago L. es un hombre que vive en San Jacinto un municipio  ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar, él es un comerciante de hamacas, bolso y productos artesanales  que se producen en esa misma población. Su buena organización  y el gran apoyo de su esposa han sido los elementos claves para el buen desempeño de este negocio. Inicialmente Santiago se dedicaba a labores del campo,  pero las razones de inseguridad pasadas, hicieron que se trasladara a este municipio, donde ya su esposa tenía el negocio de artesanías posicionado.  Desde que inició con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su vida ha cambiado,  ahora  tiene clientes no solo en el pueblo, sino también en ciudades como  Cartagena y   Barranquilla, con su primer financiamiento a esta organización, aumentó su capacidad de suministrar a los clientes las artesanías que le piden y ahora puede ofrecer mejores opciones de pago;  sus incrementadas utilidades le han ayudado a arreglar su casa  y a que sus hijos estudien. Su sueño es tener un local propio donde venda todo lo relacionado con artesanías de su municipio, por eso se esfuerza para que día a día aumenten sus clientes y por tener un capital de trabajo adicional producto de crédito que pueda ayudarlo a comprar variadas artesanías y a tener siempre su negocio surtido. Su credikiva es su segundo crédito, con él comprará hamacas, bolsos, mochilas, telas para bolsos y correderas , que le generarán un 35%  de utilidad, esta inversión   justifica su éxito pues se aplica en una temporada de Diciembre, Enero y Febrero, donde las ventas de artesanías  repuntan, pues muchos turistas que están de vacaciones,  al pasar por esta población llegan a comprarlas en importantes cantidades  para venderlas, como suvenires, o para su propio uso y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago L. is a man living in San Jacinto, a municipality located in Bolívar department.  He is a merchant selling hammocks, purses and artisanal items that are manufactured here.  His good organization and help from his wife have been key elements in his business’ good development.

Initially Santiago was a farmer but past insecurity problems caused him to move to this town where his wife already had a crafts business in place. 

Since starting with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo his life has changed.  Now he has customers not only in town but also in cities like Cartagena and Barranquilla.

He used his first loan from this institution to increase his ability to supply his customers with the crafts they required and now he can offer better payment options.  Increased profits have helped him make home improvements and pay for his children’s education.

His dream is to have his own store where he can sell everything related to his town’s crafts.  This is why he makes the effort to increase his customer base daily and to have additional working capital through loans that will allow him to purchase assorted crafts to always have a wide selection of stock available.

The Kiva loan is his second loan.  He will use it to buy hammocks, purses, backpacks, fabric for purses and zippers that will generate a 35% profit. The investment is guaranteed success because it will be applied during December, January and February which is when crafts sales spike because many tourists are on vacation and when they pass through this town they stop to buy in quantity either to resell or to keep as souvenirs or for their and their families’ own use.

loans.use: To buy hammocks, purses, backpacks, fabric for purses and zippers that will produce a 35% profit.

loans.name: Vida Nueva Group

texts.es: VIDA NUEVA. Es un banco de emprendimiento formado en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, en la población de chijipata, por se una zona muy alejada no cuenta con servicio de movilidad constante tan solo ingresa a la zona una línea de minibuses los cuales son en muchos casos fuentes de trabajo para esa zona, esta compuesto por 8 socias las cuales en su mayoría se dedican al comercio, como la Sra. Alicia	 que es la presidenta del banco fue elegida por sus compañeras por su solidaridad y su responsabilidad, la Sra. Alicia vende pescado por muchas Zonas de la ciudad de La paz, ella tiene dos hijos quienes aun están en época escolar, también vive con el esposo quien se dedica al trabajo de albañil, ambos apoyan con el gasto del hogar ambos sueñan con tener su casita propia ya que en la actualidad viven como cuidadores en la misma zona, el préstamo será usado en el incremento de su capital, comprando Pescado por lata ya que tiene muchos pedidos ya que tiene muchos clientes en la Zona y tendrá muchos mas ingresos y de esta manera poder mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
VIDA NUEVA (New Life) is a communal bank located in the south of La Paz in an area called Chijipata.  Because it’s a distant area it doesn’t have reliable public transportation services.  There is only one minibus company that comes into the area and in many cases it’s the source of employment in the area.  It has 8 members who for the most part are merchants.

Alicia, group President, was elected by her fellow members because of her solidarity and responsibility.  Alicia sells fish in several sections of the city of La Paz.  She has two school age children and also lives with her husband who is a bricklayer.  Both contribute to household expenses and dream with having their own little house because they currently live as caretakers in the same area.

The loan will be used to increase working capital to buy canned fish because she has several pending orders and many customers in the area and she’ll have more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy canned fish in quantity.

loans.name: Elsa Tulmira

texts.es:
Elsa de 51 años, vende pescado en un puesto en la calle, vive con sus tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Hace año atrás ella quería independizarse para general ingresos en su casa por eso decidió comprar pescados y venderlos en un puesto de madera en la calle. Poco a poco la gente del sector la fue conociendo ya que ella trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 12h00 de lunes a domingo. En la actualidad vende la libra de pescados a $ 2.00. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene al vender pescado es el polvo que genera la calle al pasar las tricimoto. 

Para seguir con su negocio y diversificarlo más ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pescado. En el futuro quiere terminar de arreglar su casa y tener un local donde pueda vender mariscos.
texts.en: Elsa is 51 years old and sells fish at a stand on the side of the road.  She lives with her three children in an urban area called Guasmo, characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.  A year ago, she wanted to independently earn an income so she decided to purchase fish and sell them at a wooden stall on the street.  Little by little, people began to recognize her since she worked from 7:30 to 12, Monday through Friday.  Currently, she sells fish at $2.00/pound.  One of the inconveniences of selling fish is the dust that comes from the roads, produced from all the traffic.  In order to continue her business and broaden it more, she wants to use this loan to purchase more fish.  In the future, she would like to finish fixing her home and have her own shop where she can sell seafood.

loans.use: Fish.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 25 years old and single. He sells different products such as caps, flasks, bags, utensils and deodorants. He has been doing this business for three years. With this loan, he will add more merchandise to sell and with the profit he hopes to make, he will build a home. 

He says that his business succeeds because he manages to offer better customer care to his customers.  He would like to be a wholesaler to others in the future.

loans.use: To buy more utensils, flasks and deodorants to sell.

loans.name: Hermer Antonio

texts.es:
Hermer de 49 años de edad, reside en Cacaopera departamento de Morazán, vive con sus hijos Elmer Esteban de 8 años, Santos Francisco de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la reparación de televisores y equipos de sonido tiene su propio taller, Hermer estudio electrónica es por eso que se dedica a este oficio su horario de servicio es de 7:00am a 4:00pm, pero como todo negocio siempre existe una desventaja y en este caso es que los clientes cuando ya están reparados sus electrodomésticos no llegan a recogerlos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos usados y nuevos, ya que en momentos este es un obstáculo para realizar los trabajos que le llegan, con este préstamo el espera poder contar con distintas clases de repuestos que le permita dar un buen servicio a los clientes.
El sueño de él es cancelar puntualmente sin inconvenientes, en un futuro me gustaría comprar un vehículo para realizar reparaciones a domicilio de esta manera obtener ingresos para crecer y apoyar a sus hijos y poder financiarles una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Hermer is 49 years old and resides in Cacaopera, a Department of Morazan.  He lives with his sons: Elmer Esteban of 8 years old and Santos Francisco of 4 years old.  He repairs televisions and sound equipment and has his own workshop.  Hermer chose this profession because he studied electricity.  His hours of operation are from 7:00am to 4:00pm.  Like any business, there are always disadvantages and in his case, its that the customers don't always come to pick up their item once it has been repaired.  

Currently, he is applying for this loan in order to purchase used and new spare parts, which sometimes prevents him from completing the jobs given to him.  With this loan, he hopes to be able to obtain a variety of spare parts that would permit him to provide his clients with better service.  In the future, he would like to purchase a vehicle so that he can make home repairs and earn a better living to be able to support and raise his children and pay for their university studies.

loans.use: Purchase of used and new spare parts

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has three children aged 16, 12 and 7. She has two additional dependents who live with her. One is her niece and the other her sister-in-law.  They assist in the business.  In the year 2000, Hawa established her slippers and clothes for ladies business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about 1,682,000 SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. Hawa has a very good loan repayment history. She requires a loan in order to buy ladies slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 336,400 SLL. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business to the extent that she can build a house for herself and help her husband to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional ladies slippers

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy, es transportista publico de la linea de trufis inter-ciudad La Paz-El Alto. Comenzó como chofer asalariado y ahora ya cuenta con su propia movilidad.  Está casado y tiene dos hijos; vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado para el costo de conversión de su movilidad de gasolina a Gas Natural vehicular (GNV), pues exista una marcada diferencia da casi 60% entre el costo de la gasolina y el de gas natural vehicular, ahorro que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos netos.

 Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y el primer vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Eloy is a Trufi public transport driver (Trufis are taxi-like vehicles with a fixed route) between the cities of La Paz and El Alto.  He began as a salaried chauffeur but now owns his own vehicle.  He is married and has two children.  He lives in a rented home in the Tembladerani Area, in the city of La Paz.  This credit that he is applying for will be used toward converting his vehicle from using gasoline to utilizing Natural Gas.  There exists a substantial difference of almost 60% between the cost of a gasoline run vehicle and and a natural gas one.  These savings would allow him to increase his net earnings.

This is his first credit with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: Cost of converting his public transport vehicle from using gasoline to using natural gas.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 32 años, es una hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hija Karol de 2 años y lo que más desea es brindarle un mejor futuro y por ellos esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. Cuando era niño, sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres, ya que sus hermanos mayores decidieron dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensas tierras para sembrar cacao y hojas de coca, que luego de ser cosechados son vendidos en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, pues sabes que gracias a esta actividad puede sustentar a su familia. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Ahora su propósito es comprarse nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y hojas de coca, así también comprará fertilizantes para asegurar la productividad de sus frutos.
texts.en: Edgar is 32 years old and a simple and hard-working man.  He lives at his parents' house, along with his daughter, Karol, of 2 years old.  Above all, he wishes to offer her a better future and for that he is willing to working very hard.  When he was a child, his parents taught him everything he needed to know about their small farm and little by little with the passing of time, he began to become in charge of his parents' land, since his older siblings decided to dedicate themselves to other professions.  Nowadays, he has an extensive amount of land to plant cacao and coco leaves.  After they are harvested, they are sold in the city of San Francisco.  What he enjoys most about his job is the cultivation because he knows that, luckily, with this activity he can support his family.  He has spent the past 15 years working in agriculture and the most challenging part of it has been protecting his plants from pesticides.  His objective is to purchase new land to increase his cultivations.  This is his first credit with MFP and plans to be very punctual with his payments.  In his communal bank, he is a very supportive member of the rest of his group.  With the 1,000 Soles that he is applying for, he will purchase cacao seeds and coco leaves, in addition to fertilizers in order to assure the results of his hard work.

loans.use: Purchase cacao seeds, coco leaves, and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase toilet paper, chicken, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 23 years old and in business. His business consists of photocopy services; the repair, sales and service of mobile phones; and computer services. His business, Sweet Valley Computer Services, is in a busy location. Terry is also employed by a local organization for additional income. 

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a photocopy machine. He is married and a father to one. He describes himself as honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe de 58 años, tiene una panadería surtida con algunos víveres de primera necesidad. Vive son su esposa en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Inicialmente el era albañil pero en el momento que hubo la dolarización en Ecuador se quedo sin trabajo y tuvo que trabajar con su hermano haciendo panes. Se independizo alquilando un horno para hacer panes por lo que en la actualidad trabaja en su propia panadería. Hace panes y cada uno los vende a $ 0.10cv, también ha surtido su tienda con algunos víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, enlatados, bebidas. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo una amasadora para hacer con más rapidez lo panes ya que por ahora todo hace manual y harina. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Felipe is 58 years old.  He has a bakery stocked with some convenience store items.  He lives with his wife in an urban district called Guasmo which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are tradesmen and salespeople.

Initially, Felipe was a bricklayer but when dollarization occurred in Ecuador he no longer had a job and had to work with his brother baking bread.  He became independent, hiring an oven so that he could make bread.  Now he works in his own bakery.  He makes loaves of bread and sells them for $0.10.  He has also stocked his store with some convenience store items such as rice, canned goods and drinks.

He would like to use his loan to buy a kneading machine so that he can make his bread faster since right now he makes it all by hand.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and be able to  build his home a bit better.

loans.use: Kneading machine, flour, dairy products

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José David, de 38 años de edad, posee una tienda de granos básicos (café, maíz, arroz, frijol), vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, este negocio lo administra desde hace dos años ofreciendo a los vecinos y clientes todo lo relacionado a los granos básicos que son tan necesarios en cada hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio ya que quiere comprar granos por cantidades grandes y la única manera de hacerlo realidad es obteniendo un préstamo, ayudando así al negocio y ofreciendo a los clientes el mejor servicio.
Con respecto al préstamo él aspira que le funcione la inversión que realizara, que el negocio sea estable y le dé los ingresos para tener una vida cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
José David is 38 years old.  He owns a basic grains store where he sells coffee, corn, rice and beans.  He lives with his wife and two children aged 8 and 10.  He has been running this business for two years, offering his neighbors and customers all kinds of basic grains which are so necessary in every household.

He is requesting ta loan to invest in his business since he would like to buy grains in large quantities and the only way to achieve this is by obtaining a loan.  This will help his business and offer his customers a better service.

With regard to the loan, he hopes his investment will pay off, that his business will be stable and that it provides him with the necessary income to have a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To buy coffee, beans, corn and rice

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael, a 38-year-old businessman, operates "Mukulima shop", a retail shop in Nairobi. In his shop, Michael sells products like maize and wheat flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil among other household products. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy maize and wheat flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil among other products. Michael is also a mechanic. He is married and a father of three. He describes himself as hardworking and visionary and hopes to be financially independent in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize and wheat flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil among other products

loans.name: Abasolo San Juan Jicayan Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama  “Abasolo” y su representante se llama Edna B. M., el nombre del grupo se le atribuye en honor a la calle donD. habitan las integrantes del mismo, ubicado en la localidad D. San Juan Jicayan, es una población, ubicada a 45 minutos al norte D. Pinotepa nacional, Oaxaca, y su población es D. su totalidad indígena mixteco, la mayoría D. L. pobladores se dedican al trabajo artesanal y del campo, dentro D. L. trabajos artesanales se encuentran el tallado en jícara, la elaboración D. textiles, como la naguas y L. huipiles, que forman parte D. la indumentaria tradicional, la magia D. esta población radica en sus tradiciones y costumbres, pero desgraciadamente han estado sufriendo cambios D. modificación tal es el caso D. la patente D. la elaboración D. huipiles que fue desplazada por maquinas extranjeras y que les han robado el legado D. la simbología, en esta población impera la pobreza y el abandono por parte D. las autoridades, eso ha dado por consecuencia la emigración D. sus pobladores a L. estados unidos y otra parte lejos D. sus comunidades, la ignorancia y la falta D. educación son ingredientes que mezclan la desigualdad que se viven en la mayoría D. L. puebL. indígenas D. esa región. Al final D. la historia veremos el nombre D. cada una D. las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades productivas para la obtención D. recursos. 
En  esta ocasión hagamos un espacio para hablar un poco D. la vida  D. una miembro D. este grupo ella es la señora Julia Dionicio Hernández, tiene 32 años D. edad, esta casada con Félix  D. 36 años, quien toda su vida la ha dedicado al trabajo en el campo, la señora Julia, lleva 15 años D. casada, tiene 5 hijos, que actualmente están estudiando, elL. son: Miguel D. 15, estudia el tercero D. secundaria, Adelina D. 13 cursa el primero D. secundaria, Florentino D. 10, Juana D. 8 y Félix D. 7 años que cursan quinto, tercero y segundo año D. primaria, todos elL. hablan el mixteco y su madre apenas si habla un poco el español.
Julia desD. la edad D. 10 años, se ha dedicado a la elaboración D. prendas para la vestimenta tradicional mismos que actualmente se conocen como artesanías, como son; naguas, telares D. cintura, huipiles, servilletas y la elaboración D. hiL. artesanales, esto  ha sido parte D. un legado que ha trascendido D. generación en generación y que también aporta recursos al sustento familiar, como ya lo mencionamos lleva toda su vida en la elaboración D. textiles artesanales, denominado telar D. cintura, pero, ¿Qué es telar D. cintura y que se elabora con esa técnica?, hablemos un poco mas del telar D. cintura o conocido como “saahma tavi”, esta técnica es D. tiempos muy remotos podemos señalar que es D. épocas prehispánicas y tienen un gran valor y estilo propio, se utilizan materiales rústicos hechos D. madera únicas y bajo un acabado único, se elaboran prendas como las naguas en mixteco “chee”, huipiles  para cubrirse la espalda y telares para la elaboración D. huipiles en forma D. vestidos, llamados “shicu lestu”, en la elaboración D. estas prendas también el tintado son D. orígenes muy ancestrales , ya que se tintan a base D. caracol marino conocido como el caracol púrpura en el cual se obtienen colores como el guinda, morado y púrpura, así también se utiliza el añil, la grana cochinilla y el árbol D. caracol, en realidad estas prendas no comparan con las creaciones D. una maquina industrial.
 Julia se integro a un grupo D. crédito, por la necesidad D. un préstamo, mismo que utilizo para la adquisición D. material necesario para la elaboración D. sus trabajos, con este dinero ella  va poder comprar el siguiente material: hiL. D. algodón para el hilado D. huipiles, hiL. rústicos para telar D. cintura, hilo tintado D. caracol para la elaboración D. naguas, hiL. D. hiL. D. diferentes colores para la elaboración D. servilletas y manteles, hiL. para bordar, estambres y listones en varios colores. 
Uno D. L. más anhelados sueños D. Julia es tener una organización D. mujeres artesanas, en el cual preservar y enseñar las valiosas técnicas D. este arte, así como la difusión y promoción D. esta indumentaria, que ha estado siendo desplazada por tendencias modernistas D. la moda. Ella también quiere que las mujeres D. escasos recursos aprendan este oficio, para que puedan mejorar sus vidas y las D. su familia, demostrar que las mujeres indígenas pueden sobresalir y no nada más  estar detrás D. un rincón abandonadas y rezagadas, así también ella quiere ver a sus hijos superarse y que tengan una mejor vida, lejos D. la pobreza y la necesidad, que no tengan que emigrar a otro lado, que sean personas D. bien y D. trabajo.
Todas las personas que integran este grupo son mujeres trabajadoras, en su totalidad indígena, llenas D. ánimo y una esperanza infinita, que creen en L. sueños y creen en la bondad D. las demás personas. 
 Julia, esta totalmente agradecida con el gesto noble D. ayuda que demuestran las personas que apoyan a fundación realidad, a L. que alrededor del mundo han puesto su granito D. arena por medio D. kiva para mejoramiento D. las vidas D. L. más desprotegidos. A nombre D. sus compañeras que integran su grupo les envía un fuerte abrazo.
