A continuación aquí se dan a conocer L. nombres D. L. que integran el grupo D. “Abasolo” y sus actividades productivas: 

Lucia D. C.. – Elaboración D. antojitos
María Guadalupe Hernández D..- Venta D. comida
Luz D. L. S. L..- Venta D. antojitos
Elvira S. C..- Artesanías D. vestir 
Edna B. M..- Venta D. chiles y semillas
Gabriela Gómez Hernández.- Venta D. frutas y verduras
Hilaria D. Gómez.- Venta D. antojitos
Anatalia T. Hernández.- venta D. antojitos
Julia Dionicio Hernández.- Elaboración D. vestimenta artesanal
Lizbeth Hernández B..- Venta D. productos por catalogo
texts.en:
The following group is called “Abasolo” and their representative is called Edna B. M..  The group's name was chosen in honor of the street where the group's members live in the settlement of San Juan Jicayan which is located 45 minutes north of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.
The women's settlement is entirely maD. up of Mixtec indigenous people.  Most of the inhabitants work in crafts and in farming.  Amongst the hand-crafted items which they produce are 'jícaras' (traditional drinking bowls maD. from calabashes or gourds), textiles such as 'naguas' (skirts) and 'huipiles' (blouses or tunics).  These 'naguas' and 'huipiles' form part of their traditional dress.

The magic of this settlement lies in its traditions and customs but unfortunately its people have suffered great changes.  This is the case, for example, of the patenting of 'huipil' making.  They were displaced by foreign machines and have been robbed of the legacy of their symbology.  In this settlement, poverty prevails and they have been neglected by the authorities.  This means that its  inhabitants have emigrated to the United States and other places away from their communities.  Ignorance and a lack of education are ingredients which combine with the inequality which is found in the majority of the indigenous settlements in this region.  At the end of this story we will see the name of each one of the members of this group and the business activities which they pursue to make money.

On this occasion, let us make a space so that we can talk a little about the life of one of the members of this group.  Mrs Julia Dionicio Hernández is 32 years old.  She is married to 36 year-old Félix who has spent all his life working in the fields.  Julia has been married for 15 years and has 5 children who are currently studying.  Her children are: 15 year-old Miguel who is in the third year of high school, 13 year-old Adelina who is in her first year of high school, 10 year-old Florentino, 8 year-old Juana and 7 year-old Félix who are in their fifth, third and second years of elementary school.  They all speak Mixtec and their mother speaks only very little Spanish.

Since she was 10 years old, Julia has been making traditional garments which are now known as  handicrafts such as: 'naguas' (traditional skirts), backstrap loom weavings, 'huipiles' (traditional blouses or tunics), napkins and also hand-maD. threads.  This has been part of a legacy which has been passed down from generation to generation and which also provides money to support the family.  As we have already mentioned, Julia has spent her whole life making handmaD. textiles called 'backstrap loom weaving' but what is backstrap loom weaving and what do you make with it?

Let us talk a little more about backstrap loom weaving which is known as 'saahma tavi'.  This technique dates back to ancient times.  We can point out that it is from pre-hispanic times and has great value and its own style.  Rustic materials maD. from unique wood are used along with a unique finish.  Items of clothing are maD. such as 'naguas' (traditional skirts which are called 'chee' in Mixtec), 'huipiles' to cover the back and there are also backstrap loom weaving techniques for the making of 'huipiles' in the form of a dress which are called 'shicu lestu'.  In the making of these clothes, the dyes also have ancient origins since they are use dyes obtained from a sea shell known as 'caracol púrpura' (literally, 'purple shell') from which colors such as 'guinda' (a cherry color), 'morado' (a mulberry color) and purple are obtained.  They also use indigo, cochineal and 'árbol D. caracol' (another kind of shell-based dye).  In fact, these clothes just can't be compared to clothes created on an industrial machine.

Julia joined a loan group because she needed a loan to acquire the necessary material to make her crafts.  With this money she will be able to buy the following material: cotton threads for making 'huipiles', rustic threads for creating backstrap loom weavings, shell-dyed threads for making 'naguas', different colored threads for making napkins and tablecloths, embroidery threads and different colored worsted yarns and ribbons.

One of Julia's most longed-for dreams is to set up an organization of craftswomen where she can preserve and teach the valuable techniques of this art as well as promote these items of clothes which have been displaced by modernist fashion trends.  She would also like for women of few means to be able to learn this traD. so that they can improve their lives and those of their families, to show that indigenous women can shine and no longer need to be in a corner, abandoned and lagging behind.  She also wants to see her children be successful.  She wants them to have a better life, far from poverty and need, and for them not to have to emigrate.  She wants them to be good and hard-working people.

All the people who make up this group are hard-working women.  They are all indigenous women, full of vitality and an infinite hope, who believe in their dreams and believe in the goodness of other people.

Julia is totally grateful for this noble gesture of help which the people who are supporting Fundación Realidad are offering.  Those around the world who are putting in their grain of sand through Kiva to improve the lives of the most vulnerable.  In the name of her fellow group members, she sends you a big hug.

Below we give you the names of those who make up the “Abasolo” group and list their business activities:
Lucia D. C.. – making 'antojitos' (traditional Mexican snacks generally sold at street stands)
María Guadalupe Hernández D..- food sales
Luz D. L. S. L..- selling 'antojitos'
Elvira S. C..- hand making traditional clothes
Edna B. M..- selling chilis and seeds
Gabriela Gómez Hernández.- fruit and vegetable sales
Hilaria D. Gómez.- selling 'antojitos'
Anatalia T. Hernández.- selling 'antojitos'
Julia Dionicio Hernández.- making hand-crafted clothes
Lizbeth Hernández B..- selling catalog products

loans.use: To buy materials for making hand-crafted textiles; white cotton thread, natural cotton thread dyed with 'caracol púrpura' (a shell-based dye), mulberry- and cherry-colored threads for making 'naguas' (traditional skirts), different colored worsted yarns, ribbons, silk thread, thread skeins

loans.name: Alhaji M

texts.en:
This is 63-year-old Alhaji. He is married and has 10 children, ages 15, 10, 10, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, and 2. 

In 1980, Alhaji established his food and drinks business. Working five days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about 1,417,008 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month. 

He needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Alhaji requires a loan in order to buy more food items. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 560,000 SLL. In the future, Alhaji plans to educate his children and to open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks

loans.name: Elena Cecilia

texts.es:
Elena vende comida rápida para poder mantener a sus hijos. Vive en una casa de cemento  en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Poco a poco con algunos ahorros compro víveres para vender comida rápida y poder mantener a sus hijos. Ahora tiene su pequeño puesto de comida en donde trabaja todos los días con ayuda de sus hijos. Vende hot dog, salchipapas, (salchichas con papa) papipollos, hamburguesa. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una papas, abastos pero también quiere arreglar su casa comprando con una parte del préstamo cemento. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa para que sus hijos se sientas muy cómodos viviendo en su casa.
texts.en:
Elena sells fast food to support her children.  She lives in a cement house in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran which is characterized by its deteriorating ecosystem.

Little by little with some savings which she had, Elena bought supplies for selling fast food so that she could support her children.  Now she has a little food stall where she works every day with the help of her children.  She sells hot dogs, 'salchipapas' (a fast food made from thinly-sliced, pan-fried sausage or hot dog, french fries and condiments), 'papipollos' (a similar fast food but with chicken) and hamburgers.  She would like to continue with her business and for that reason she would like to use her loan to buy potatoes and provisions but she would also like to fix her house, using part of the loan to buy cement.

In the future, she would like to finish building her house so that her children feel comfortable living there.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cement

loans.name: Las Viñas Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama  “LAS VIÑAS” y su representante se llama Florina Vázquez Sánchez, el nombre del grupo se debe a que en el lugar donde se reúnen hay muchos árboles frutales, como el mango, el plátano, papaya, guanábanas y palmeras de coco, a ella se les ocurrió que al igual que las viñas también tenían sus viñedos solo que de frutas tropicales. Santa María Huazolotitlan se ubica a 30 minutos de Pinotepa, en la zona baja de la costa del pacífico, en esta localidad se hala el lenguaje indigena "mixteco" y la gran mayoría produce "pan de vida" que es un pan tradicional que se hace con yemas de huevos de gallinas de rancho, eso hace muy famosos y cotizado sus panes, al igual que se dedican a la producción de pan también se elaboran artesanías en bordados sobre listón y tela "manta", mismas que comercializan en las poblaciones de Pinotepa, Jamiltepec y la capital de Oaxaca.  
En ocasión especial hablaremos un poco de la vida de un miembro de este grupo ella es: la señora Ciria Gómez Hernández, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada con Julian  de 37 años, quien se dedica  a la albañilería, la señora Ciria, lleva 20 años de casada, tiene 5 hijos, ellos son: Georgina de 18, Mauricio de 17, Abigail de 14, Araceli de 12  y Ricardo de 8 años.
Ciria desde la edad de 13 años, se ha dedicado a la elaboración de prendas para la vestimenta tradicional mismos que actualmente se conocen como artesanías, como son; huipiles bordados a mano, blusas de manta, faldas y servilletas, esto ha sido parte de un legado que ha trascendido de generación en generación y que también aporta recursos al sustento familiar, como ya lo mencionamos lleva toda su vida en la elaboración de bordados artesanales, mismos que se utilizan para la vestimenta diaria de la gente, este bordado es de tiempos muy remotos podemos señalar que es parte de la indumentaria diaria que viste a la gente que habita en esta zona, y tienen un gran valor y estilo propio, se utilizan materiales únicos y una combinación de colores que distinguen a su propia comunidad y que diferencia a los demás bordados, ya que cada pueblo tiene características y colores propios de distinción.
 Ciria se integro a un grupo de crédito, por la necesidad de un préstamo, mismo que utilizará para la adquisición de material necesario para la elaboración de sus trabajos, con este dinero ella  va poder comprar el siguiente material: hilos de algodón en diferentes colores, como la madeja de hilo conocido como hilo vela, hilo tipo seda, listones doble satín y de una cara, manta tradicional, telar de cintura, agujas, aros para bordar. 
Ciria, esta totalmente agradecida con el gesto noble de ayuda que demuestran las personas que apoyan a Fundación Realidad, a los que alrededor del mundo han puesto su granito de arena por medio de KIVA para mejoramiento de las vidas de los más desprotegidos. A nombre de sus compañeras que integran su grupo les envía un fuerte abrazo.
A continuación aquí se dan a conocer los nombres de los que integran el grupo de “Las Viñas” y sus actividades productivas: 
Rosa M. Gutiérrez. –Bordado artesanal del vestir
Juana Sánchez M..- Venta de antojitos
María Ángela G..- Venta de antojitos
Florina Vázquez Sánchez.- Artesanías de vestir 
Delfina Leonarda C..- Artesanías de vestir
Maribel  Vázquez M..- Venta de ropa
Lucila Vázquez Gómez.- Venta de antojitos
Ciria Gómez Hernández.- elaboración de artesanías del vestir
Hilda M. Ruiz.- Alfarería
Beatriz Adriana M. Méndez.-Elaboración del artesanías de vestir
texts.en:
The following group is called “ LAS VIÑAS” (Vines) and their representative is called Florina Vázquez Sánchez.  The group received its name from the fact that in the place where they meet there are many fruit trees, such as mango trees, banana trees, papaya trees, guanábana trees and coconut trees.  They thought that in the same way as vines have their vineyards they do too, just vineyards of fruit trees.  Santa María Huazolititlan is 30 minutes from Pinotepa on the lower part of the coast.  In this place Mixtec is spoken and most of the inhabitants make bread with egg yolks from hens from the ranch.  This makes their breads famous and much valued.  They also make handicrafts, embroidering ribbons and blankets.  These are then sold in the towns of Pinotepa, Jamiltepec and the capital of Oaxaca.  At the end of this story we will see the name of each one of the group members and the business activities which they pursue to make money.

On this special occasion we will speak a little about the life of one of the group's members, Mrs Ciria Gómez Hernández.  She is 37 years old and married to Julian who is also 37 and a bricklayer.  Ciria has been married for 20 years and has 5 children: Georgina, 18; Mauricio, 17; Abigail, 14; Araceli, 12 and Richard who is 8.

Since she was 13, Ciria has been making traditional clothes which are currently known as handicrafts such as hand-embroidered 'huipiles' (a traditional blouse or tunic), 'blusas de manta' (a traditional blouse), skirts and napkins.  This has been part of a legacy which has been handed down from generation to generation which also provides money to support the family.  As we already mentioned, Ciria has spent her whole life making hand-crafted embroideries which are from ancient times.  They are part of the daily clothingof the people who live in this area and they have great value and their own style.  Unique materials are used and a combination of colors which distinguish their own own community from others and which are different from other embroideries since each town has their own characteristics and colors which sets them apart.

Ciria joined a loan group because she needed a loan to use to acquire the necessary material to make her handicrafts.  With this money she will buy the following material: different colored cotton threads, a thread called 'hilo vela', silk thread, double satin and one-sided satin ribbons, traditional calico, backstrap loom, needles and embroidery hoops..

All the people who make up this group are hard-working women.  They are all indigenous women, full of vitality and an infinite hope, who believe in their dreams and believe in the goodness of other people.

Ciria is totally grateful for this noble gesture of help which the people who are supporting Fundación Realidad are offering.  Those around the world who are putting in their grain of sand through Kiva to improve the lives of the most vulnerable.  In the name of her fellow group members, she sends you a big hug.

Below we give you the names of those who make up the “Las Viñas” group and list their business activities:
Rosa M. Gutiérrez. – making hand-embroidered clothes
Juana Sánchez M..- selling 'antojitos' (traditional Mexican snacks generally sold at street stands)
María Ángela G..- selling 'antojitos'
Florina Vázquez Sánchez.- making hand-crafted clothing
Delfina Leonarda C..- making hand-crafted clothing
Maribel Vázquez M..- clothes sales
Lucila Vázquez Gómez.- selling 'antiojitos'
Ciria Gómez Hernández.- making hand-crafted clothing
Hilda M. Ruiz.- pottery
Beatriz Adriana M. Méndez.-making hand-crafted clothing

loans.use: To buy green, blue, red, yellow, orange and mulberry-colored thread,  silk thread for embroidering, worsted yarn, skeins of cotton 'vela' thread, calico and backstrap loom

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es:
Clara se dedica a la venta de merienda y tortillas, ella es viuda y vive con su madre y sus dos hijos, reside en Usulután, este negocio nació hace 3 años cuando su esposo falleció, ya que ella seria desde ese momento la responsable del hogar y debía buscar una fuente de ingreso para poder darle la alimentación y el cuido necesario a sus hijos. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en los productos para preparar las meriendas, como los ingrediente para cada tipo de comida por ejemplo pollo, carnes rojas, condimentos, arroz, aceite, también maíz para las tortillas, este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda ya que ella solo cuenta con la buena voluntad de progresar con el negocio pero no tiene el dinero que se necesita para impulsarlo.
Su objetivo es estar siempre atenta a sus hijos, contar con una fuente de ingreso estable para poder alimentarlos y cubrir todas las necesidades que demanda un hogar.
texts.en:
Clara sells meals and tortillas.  She’s a widow living with her mother and two children in Usulután.  She started the business three years ago when her husband died because at that moment she became responsible for the home and had to find a source of income to feed and provide necessary care for her children.

She is asking for funds to buy ingredients to prepare each kind of meal like: chicken, red meats, spices, rice, cooking oil and corn for the tortillas.  The loan will be of great use for her since she has the will to progress with her business but lacks money to propel it.

Her goal is to always be watchful of her children and to have a stable source of income to be able to feed them and cover all the needs her home demands.

loans.use: To buy chicken, meats, spices, rice, cooking oil, corn.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Janneth   solicitó 600 $us.
Ella  se dedica a  la docencia en una escuela de la zona de Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto, donde vive junto a sus hijos, pues su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. 
Con el crédito comprará una computadora para los estudios de sus hijos. Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Janneth asked for $600 US.  

She is a teacher at a school in the Rio Seco section of El Alto where she resides just with her children because her husband works in the interior of the country.

She will use the loan to buy a computer for her children’s school work. 

This is her third Impro and first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer to facilitate her children's school work.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un señor de 45 años, es agricultor y le gusta sembrar hortalizas, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tiene casa propia ubicada en el Departamento de Usulután, el negocio de las hortalizas lo desempeña desde hace 3 años y fue enseñado por su padre, este es el ingreso que tiene para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tratamiento para plagas ya que teme que la siembra se vea afectada por plagas y puede perder toda la cosecha, este préstamo le ayudara a contar con esta herramienta para dar un buen cuido a la hortaliza y poder lograr una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es conseguir buenos frutos, tener una excelente venta que le genere buenas ganancias para pagar puntualmente este préstamo y ser calificación A.
texts.en:
Pedro, 45, is a farmer.  He likes growing vegetables.  He lives with his wife and children in his own house in Usulután department.  He has been in the vegetable growing business for three years.  His father taught him.  This is his source of income to support his home.

He is asking for funds to buy anti-pest supplies because he fears his crops will be affected by pests and he could lose the entire harvest.  The loan will help him have this tool which will permit good care for his orchard thus leading to a good harvest.

His goal is to get good fruits, to have an excellent sale that will generate good profits, and to repay the loan punctually to get a grade of A.

loans.use: To buy anti-pest supplies.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina C. es una mujer D. 64 años dedicada a la confección D. todo tipo D. ropa en su propio taller ubicado en su casa,  en el barrio Nuevo Bosque D. Cartagena, e iniciado desD. hace 20 años, para ayudar a su esposo en os gastos del hogar; ella inició fabricando ropas para damas sobre medidas,  promocionándola entre    familiares y amigas y gradualmente pasó a desarrollar otras líneas,  porque se dedicó a capacitarse en ello. Así fue como aprendió a trabajar la ropa interior  e  infantil y también la línea D. caballeros. Sus principales clientes son mujeres y su linea estrella es la ropa interior, basada en el modelo que  sus clientas  le  llevan, que ella patrona perfectamente, y envía hacia los municipios en importantes volúmenes, porque su hija la apoya fuertemente   en este proceso y tiene un salario básico. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, aspira a comprar mediante la linea CrediKIVA, telas variadas, adornos e insumos con los cuales fabricará pantaletas, brasieres, y ropa para las fiestas que se avecinan D. fin D. año y con ello planea aumentar su capital D. trabajo, aprovechando el repunte D. sus ventas  en ocasión D. la temporada naviD.ña y D. año nuevo.
Paulina cuenta que su negocio ha sido la fuente D. trabajo D. ella y D. su hija,  igualmente  dice que  con el ha podido hacer un aporte al hogar para que sus hijos, que son 3 en las edades D. 28 a 32,  hayan salido adelante. Ahora su gran sueño  apunta a crear un punto D. venta especializado en ropa interior donD. pueda generar puestos D. trabajo especialmente para mujeres jefas D. hogar, porque es un tema que la hace muy sensible y quiere darle una mano a ellas especialmente en los municipios. Y este es justamente su gran desafío porque requiere el cumplimiento D. esta meta D. generar y buscar los recursos necesarios para el logro D. este propósito.
texts.en:
Paulina C., 64, makes all kinds of clothes in a shop she has in her home in Cartagena’s Nuevo Bosque neighborhood.  She started the business 20 years ago to help her husband meet household expenses.  She started out making women’s clothing to order among family and friends and gradually started developing other lines because she dedicated herself to train for this.  This is how she learned how to make underwear and infant wear as well as men’s clothing.  Her main customers are women and her star line is underwear that based on the models her customers bring her, she patterns exactly.  She sends important amounts to the cities because her daughter is a great support in this process which earns her a basic salary.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she hopes to use a Kiva loan to buy assorted fabric, decorations and supplies to make panties, brassieres and party clothes for the approaching end of year festivities.  She plans to increase her working capital to take advantage of the sales spike that occurs during the Christmas and New Year seasons.

Paulina’s business is a source of employment for her and her daughter.  She says that she’s also been able to contribute through it to the success of her three children who are between the ages of 28 and 32.  Now her dream is to create a sales point specializing in underwear so that she can generate employment opportunities for female heads of household because this is a topic that is very dear to her and she wants to give them a hand, especially in the towns.  This is precisely her great challenge because she wants to reach the goal of generating and obtaining the necessary resources to reach this purpose.

loans.use: To buy assorted fabric and supplies to make panties, brassieres and party clothes for the approaching end of year festivities.

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui W. is 31 years old and married. He has four children who range in age from 10 to 8 years old and are all currently attending school.

He is from the town of Litein in western Kenya and has been in the farming business for 10 years. He has been selling pineapples, bananas, chicken, and milk.

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a dairy cow. This is his third loan through Juhudi, and with the expected profits, he hopes to be able to better support his family and to expand into various types of businesses.

In five years, he hopes to have bought various types of farm input and have at least three livestock animals.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucia Lorena

texts.es:
Lucia de 38 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.   

Escogio la actividad para poder ayuda con los gastos familiares y también porque no había tienda por el sector por donde vive y sus vecinos le insistieron para que la ubique en su casa. Decidió tener su tienda en su casa invirtiendo sus ahorros en víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas. Ahora trabaja con ayuda de su hijo mayor desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Uno de los inconvenientes al vender los víveres es el polvo que genera la calle. 

Para seguir con su negocio y que le genere más ingresos ella quiere surtir mas la tienda comprando con el préstamo bebidas, arroz, azúcar. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su tienda y que su casa tenga un segundo piso.
texts.en:
Lucia, thirty-eight, has a small store at the front of her house.  She lives with her husband and two children in a peri-urban area in the Fortín district of Guayaquil, characterized by it dirt roads.  

She picked this business so she could help out with the family expenses and because there weren't any stores in her area. Her neighbors insisted she have the store in her house, which she decided to do, investing her savings in everyday necessities like rice, sugar, canned goods, and drinks.  Now she gets help from her older son every day from 8AM to 8PM.  One inconvenience with selling everyday goods is the dust from the street.

In order to keep her business going and making money, Lucia wants to stock up some more, using her loan to buy drinks, rice, and sugar.  In the future she would like to expand the store and have a second floor in her house.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Clarisa Angelica

texts.es: Clarisa Angélica tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio pues inicio con este medio de vida por una compañera, que le mostro esta forma de vida Ella es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones, trajes para damas y caballeros. Sueña con llegar a tener una tienda de ropa en su hogar.
texts.en:
Clarisa Angélica is 38 years old and she sells clothes.  She has had this business for more than five years.  She started in this business because of a colleague, who showed her this mode of making a living.  She is very responsible and enjoys her business.  

The loan is for the purchase of skirts, shirts, pants and suits for women and men.  She dreams of having a clothing store in her home.

loans.use: Working capital for clothing store.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora; La socia tiene 44 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la venta de útiles escolares, ella aprovecha las campañas para comprar al por mayor los diferentes útiles y venderlos en la época adecuada. La socia es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, ella desea el crédito para comprar en esta campaña escolar y de este modo tener almacenado los útiles. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de útiles escolares.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This individual is part of the “Los Diamantes” [Diamonds] communal bank.  The communal bank is in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province in Cusco.  Her name is Dora and she is 44 years old.  She is single and has three children.  She sells school supplies, and takes advantage of sales campaigns to purchase different items wholesale, and then sell them in the appropriate period.  

Dora is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman who wants this loan for purchases during the school campaign period, so that she will have school supplies in storage.

She appreciates and values the loan and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of school supplies.

loans.name: Betty Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Betty A. A. es una emprendedora ama de casa que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el municipio de San Juan De Nepomuceno, un pintoresco pueblo enclavado en las serranías del departamento de Bolívar, al norte de Colombia y famoso por sus artesanías. En la actualidad ella se dedica a vender mercancías como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, jeans para hombres y mujeres, calzado, perfumes, aretes, pulseras y accesorios femeninos. El negocio comenzó hace dos años cuando a raíz del incremento en los gastos familiares, debido especialmente a la educación de los hijos, y a las dificultades del hogar para aumentar los ingresos, la microempresaria consiguió un pequeño préstamo con un familiar, viajó a Cartagena, la más importante ciudad turística de Colombia y compró algunos pocos productos que llevó a su pueblo natal. El éxito en las ventas fue total. Repartió la mercancía entre vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos a quienes le exigía una cuota inicial y les concedía un plazo de hasta 45 días para cancelar el saldo. La clientela y los pedidos empezaron a crecer. Hoy con satisfacción la señora Betty dice que le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares sin descuidar sus obligaciones de madre y esposa porque su negocio no le ocupa todo el tiempo. El margen promedio de utilidad que le genera su actividad es en promedio del 38%. Este es el primer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertirlo en la compra  de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, calzado, perfumes y accesorios femeninos. Por la proximidad de la temporada decembrina, los pedidos se han incrementado sustancialmente. Con el paso del tiempo, la microempresaria ha logrado consolidar una buena clientela y ha descartado aquellos que le quedaron morosos. Sueña en un futuro no muy lejano abrir un almacén en el que pueda ofrecer todos sus productos y atender más cómodamente a todo el que la visite.
texts.en:
Betty A. A. is an entrepreneurial homemaker that lives with her husband and three children in the San Juan de Nepomuceno municipality located in the hills of Bolivar in northern Colombia, , a picturesque village famous for its artisanal crafts.

Currently she sells merchandise like blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, jeans, footwear, perfume, earrings, bracelets and women’s accessories.  The business started years ago when, due to an increase in family expenditures, mainly because of the children’s education and other household difficulties.  This small business owner got a small loan from a family member, traveled to Cartagena, the most important tourist city in Colombia, and bought some products that she brought to her hometown.

She had total sales success.  She sold the merchandise to neighbors, friends, family and those that were referred to her.  She required a down payment and gave them up to 45 days to pay off the balance.  Clientele and orders began to increase.  With satisfaction, Betty says that today she helps her husband with family costs, without neglecting her duties as mother and wife because her business does not take up all of her time.  Her profit margin from this activity is 38%, on average.

This is Betty's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to be invested in the purchase of clothes for men, women, and children and for footwear, perfume and women’s accessories.  Because it is close to the December season, orders have increased substantially.  As time passes, this micro-entrepreneur has been able to establish a good client base and has separated from those that are delinquent.  In the not so distant future, she dreams of opening a store where she can offer all of her products and more comfortably attend to all that visit.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for men, women and children, footwear, perfumes and women's accessories.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 28 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rubén de 29 años y su querida hija Daysi de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy pequeña Edith aprendió ha trabajar en la chacra, ahí ayudaba a sus padres en las labores agrarias, es así que aprendió todo sobre esta labor. Con el tiempo ha logrado tener sus propias tierras, donde siembra y  cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que depende de ello para obtener una buena producción.  Los frutos que siembra son: cacao, café y hojas de coca, que una vez cosechados son llevados a la ciudad de San Francisco para comercializarlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, de esa manera ve todo el esfuerzo puesto en su trabajo, siendo la recompensa la cantidad de frutos que recolecta. Han transcurrido 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar su productividad. Su mayor deseo es comprar nuevas tierras para poder sembrar en más extensiones de tierra. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para fertilizar sus tierras, puesto que espera cosechar buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Edith, 28, is a very happy and hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Ruben, 29, and with her beloved daughter Daysi, who is seven.  They are the motivation behind all of her efforts.  When she was very small, she learned how to work on a farm, and would help her parents with agricultural work.  This is how she learned everything about this kind of work.

With time, she has come to have her own land that she cultivates and cares for with much dedication, since she depends on it for good yields.  She cultivates cacao, coffe and coca leaves that when harvested, are brought to San Francisco city to sell.

What she loves most about her work is the harvest, when she sees all of the effort that was put in her work rewarded in the amount of products that she collects.  Eight years have passed with her doing this work.  What she considers most difficult is protecting her crops from insects that can affect productivity.  Her biggest wish is to buy new stretches of land to cultivate.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She knows that she needs to make her payments on time and is willing to do so.  In her communal bank, she is a cheerful member and is always making the group laugh.  With the requested 3,000 soles, she will purchase manure to fertilize her land, in the hopes of reaping good fruit.

loans.use: For the purchase of sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Truck repair for delivery business.

loans.name: Aurelie

texts.en:
Aurelie is 49 years old. She is married and has nine children who are between 5 and 25 years old. All her children go to school and her husband works as a businessman as well. Aurelie sells a variety of commodities in her shop, such as sugar, beans, potatoes and maize flour, and has five years experience working in this business.

She says that her business is successful because it has allowed her to look after her family and pay her children's school fees. She has requested a loan to add more commodities for sale and hopes to buy livestock and rent a business house from the profits of this business. She dreams to own a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, potatoes and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa, vende pollos asados y víveres de primera necesidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Hace 8 años atrás empezó a vender legumbres para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares a su esposo. Pero como tenía la idea de vender su comida compro una máquina para asar y comenzó a vender pollos asados poco a poco las personas del sector la conocieron hasta que ella también ubico en su negocio la venta de víveres de primera necesidad para que los clientes tengan variedad al comprar. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h30pm vendiendo los pollos asados y víveres con ayuda de su esposo.    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar Bebidas, arroz, pollos para mantener su negocio. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y agrandar el local de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa sells roasted chickens and groceries.  She lives in an urban zone in Guayaquil, called Suburbio, notable because most of its residents are merchants.

Eight years ago she started out selling vegetables to help out her husband with family expenses.  But, since she had the notion to sell food she bought a roasting machine and started selling roasted chickens.  Gradually she became known by residents of the area and she then also set up a grocery store so that her customers would have variety available for purchase.  She is currently open for business from 6am until 10:30pm selling roasted chickens and groceries with her husband’s help.

She will use the loan to buy beverages, rice and chickens to supply her business.  In the future she’d like to make some home improvements and enlarge her business.

loans.use: For beverages, chickens and rice.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es: Eudoxia, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa junto a su esposo Abrahán de 33 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Giuliana de 12 y frans de 8 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Trabajando arduamente, Eudosia ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus campos, donde tiene sembrado cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que son comercializados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, pues sabe que es ahí donde uno pone todo su empeño y trabajo para que obtenga una producción. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras para poder ampliar la siembra e incrementar la producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas de cacao y café, asimismo desea comprar abono.
texts.en: Eudoxia, 30, is a hardworking and unassuming woman who lives in a house with her husband, Abrahan, who is 33, and their 2 beloved children: Guiliana, 12, and Frans, 8, who are the motivation for all of their efforts.  Working arduously, Euodoxia has made her fields produce the products needed to support her family.  Before seeing the sun's first rays, she leaves the house and walks for close to an hour to arrive at her fields, where she cultivates cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves, products that are sold in the city of San Francisco.  What she enjoys most about her work is to farm, because she knows that is where she puts all of her efforts and work to obtain a good harvest.  She has been farming for 10 years, and what she considers most difficult is to transport her products, since the sacks she carries are very heavy and it tires her out.  Over time, she wants to buy new land so that she can increase her cultivations and her production.  This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she is very happy to be able to access this credit and wants to thank all of the people who will make it possible for her to get the money she needs.  In her communal bank, she is a very well-respected member for the order that she brings to the meetings.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy new cocoa and coffee seeds, and also organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy coffee and cocoa seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: M. Lucie

texts.en:
M.Lucie is 44 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children who are between the ages of four and twenty. All her children attend school except the youngest. 

M.Lucie has a shop which is composed of different commodities such as sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and soaps. She has spent eleven years in her business and is requesting this loan to expand her inventory. She has done well from her business, having bought two plots of land, and she would like to have a large shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maizeflour, and wheatflour to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is from the village of Brgy. Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional pigs to raise. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Aime Gilbert

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt il y a de cela quatre ans, faisant preuve d'un bon remboursement et d'une irrégularité dans les épargnes , il n'a pas connu des difficultés durant tout le long de l'exercice de son activité.
Avec le second prêt , il veut élargir en achetant des polos, survêtements,blousons en Jeans, débardeur, gilets et tous ce dont les clients ont besoin.
Tres motive par son business, il a fait usage de beaucoup de stratégie, en vendant en crédit des tenues de cérémonie aux jeunes et dans les administrations.
texts.en: Mr Aime Gilbert S. is 41 years old and benefitted previously from a loan four years ago, which he reimbursed successfully and without difficulties in meeting deadlines. He is asking for a second loan in order to purchase greater quantities of polo shirts, tracksuits, jackets, jeans, t-shirts, vests and other articles of clothing depending on his customer's requests. He is very motivated by his business and has really thought through several business strategies including selling ceremonial outfits for credit to both young persons as well as in large organizations/administrations.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for men: pants, t-shirts, button down shirts, jeans, suits, vests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Cintia de16 y Maylin de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado Faustina, siempre le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus hijas, es así que siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que son llevados a la ciudad de San Francisco para su comercialización, pues es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar y lo hace con mucha paciencia, por otro lado debe tener cuidado de la plaga de insectos que atacan sus plantaciones ya que perjudica la producción de sus frutos. En adelante, espera poder ampliar sus tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de cacao y café, además comprará abono para proteger la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Faustina, 35, is a hard working, cheerful woman.  She lives in a rented house with her two beloved children, Cintia, 16, and Maylin, 14, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

The fields Faustina has always farmed with so much effort have always provided the necessary income to support her daughters.  She farms cocoa, coffee and coca leaves which are sold in the city of San Francisco because that’s where the best prices are available for her products.

What she enjoys most about her work is planting, something she does with much patience.  On the other hand, she must insure that her plants are safe from insect infestations that attack and damage fruit production. In the future she hopes to be able to expand her fields in order to plant more.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She’s aware that she must pay on time and is willing to do so.  She is a member of her communal bank very committed to her group’s development.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more cocoa and coffee seeds as well as manure to protect the upcoming planting.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans, coffee and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio nacido el 26 de agosto en Chuquisaca hace 10 años el llego a Jorochito, mediante el sindicato llego a obtener su parcela en la Planchada a 32 Km de El Torno, ahí es donde vive y trabaja en la misma parcela, el se dedica al plantado de Maíz todo lo que el produce lo saca al mercado de El Torno directo al consumidor, es un apersona muy responsable y dinámica  trabaja mucho ya que el desea muy pronto hacer construir su casita y asa dar comodidad a su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas y también contratara tractor para el arado de la tierra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sergio, born on August 26 in Chuquisaca, came to Jorochito ten years ago.  He was able to obtain via the syndicate (land distributing agency) his plot of land in La Planchada, 32 kilometers from El Torno, where he lives and farms corn.  What he harvests he sells directly to the consumer in El Torno’s market.

He is a responsible, dynamic person who works hard because he wants to be able to build his house soon to provide his family with more comfort.

He will use the loan to buy seed and to contract the services of a tractor to plow the land.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For the purchase of corn and to plow the fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For construction tools.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado muy duro, vive en su casa junto a su esposo Narciso de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calida de vida. La siembra de cacao, café y hojas de coca, es la actividad a la que se dedica Juana. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para que sus plantaciones sean fértiles y obtenga una buena producción. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos, puesto que perjudican y atrasan el desarrollo de las plantaciones. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, hasta el mercado, ya que tiene que llevarlos con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar la siembra de sus frutos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, también comprará abono para aplicar a sus tierras y asegurar la producción de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Juana, 45 years old, is a woman who has worked very hard all her life.  She lives with her husband Narciso, 45, and their three beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.

Juana grows cacao, coffee and coca leaves.  Every morning, starting very early, she works in her fields so her plants will be fertile and she will have a good crop.  What she likes most about her work is protecting the crop from insects because they are detrimental to the plants and harm their growth.  She has been doing this work for eight years, and she believes the most difficult part is transporting her products to market because she has to be very careful with them.  In the future she would like to buy more land so she can plant more.

This is Juana's seventh loan from MFP.  She knows she has to make her payments punctually, and she is ready to do so.  In her communal bank she is very committed to the group's development.  With the three thousand new soles she has requested, she will buy seeds for cacao and coffee.  She will also buy fertilizer to use on her land and assure a good crop.

loans.use: Buy seeds for cacao and coffee, and buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: July Magdalena

texts.es:
July de 48 años, tiene una farmacia frente a un hospital. Vive con su esposo y dos hijas en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Ella es obstétriz desde hace mucho tiempo por eso le intereso mucho tener una farmacia como negocio. Una de sus hermanas le enseño como trabajar en una farmacia y le prestó un local frente a un hospital- maternidad. Ya tiene 14 años con su farmacia frente a un hospital vendiendo pañales, antibióticos, antigripales etc. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 18h00pm los pañales los vende a $ 0.25 c/u, sueros a $ 1.50, antibióticos a $ 0.20 c/u.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas como antigripales, antibióticos, panales etc. En el futuro quiere surtir su farmacia con mas medicinas y que sus hijas que ahora están pequeñas se gradúen con éxito.
texts.en:
July, who is 48 years old, has a pharmacy in front of a hospital.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in Suburbio de Guayaquil, an urban area in which most of the residents are businesspeople.

She has been a midwife for a long time, and for that reason she was very interested in having a pharmacy as a business.  One of July's sisters taught her how to work in a pharmacy and lent her a shop in front of a maternity hospital.  She has been running the pharmacy in front of the hospital for fourteen years, and she sells diapers, antibiotics, flu remedies, etc.  She works from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm and sells the diapers for $0.25 each, serums at $1.50 and antibiotics at $0.20 per unit.

With the loan she wants to buy medicines like flu remedies and antibiotics as well as diapers, etc.  In the future July wants to stock her pharmacy with more medicines.  She also wants her daughters, who are small now, to graduate from school.

loans.use: Antibiotics, medicines, diapers

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a dairy farmer in Litein Town in the Rift Valley-Kenya, producing milk and selling locally.  He has employed 3 farmhands.

He has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He believes the income generated will subsidize the meager family income after the demise of his resourceful wife in a road accident.  He hopes to develop his own water source and quality feeds. 

He urges the field officers to enlighten farmers, as lack of information remains the main challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francisco Filadelfo

texts.es: Francisco Filadelfo tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este medio de vida, el es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo que vive con esposa pues el sale a vender todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, pues tiene ciertos clientes que visitar ya que siempre le están solicitando diferentes productos y el busca la manera de cómo complacerlos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, cosmeticos y calzado necesaria ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en:
Francisco Filadelfo, 23, sells general merchandise.  He’s had this means of support for 12 years.  He is a very hard working man and has a minor son in his care that lives with his wife because he goes out to sell every day from 5am until 10pm; he has customers to see who are always asking for different products and he seeks ways to satisfy them.

This loan will be used to buy needed merchandise like clothes, cosmetics and footwear because a good season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos Radica en la localidad de el Torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de santa cruz, vive actualmente con sus padres, su actividad es la compra y venta de aluminio, el destino del crédito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo así poder incrementar sus ingresos su deseo principal es el tener su vehículo propio para poder trabajar, por eso esta ahorrando para hacer realidad su sueño, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de Aluminio ya que le ofrecieron una buena cantidad de aluminio, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in El Torno, 39 kilometers from Santa Cruz, with his parents.  His business is buying and selling aluminum.

The loan will be used to increase capital thus increasing income.  His main wish is to own a vehicle for work and this is why he’s saving up to make this dream come true.

He will use the money from the loan to buy aluminum because he was offered a good amount of aluminum.  

He’s grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy aluminum.

loans.name: Nelson Jacinto

texts.es:
Nelson de 43 años, tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su mama en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. 

La esposa de Nelson comenzó con la idea de vender víveres por la ventana de su casa ya que no tenían local y querían tener ingresos para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos. Les favoreció mucho vender víveres ya que por el sector donde viven no había tienda porque estaba apartado de la ciudad ya que cruza un rio por ese sector. En la actualidad tienda ya su tienda ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa trabaja los dos desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Venden en la tienda arroz, azúcar, lácteos, bebidas, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere surtir mas su tienda comprando arroz, azúcar, harina etc. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda grande y que cubra con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelson, 43, has a shop in the front part of his home. He lives with his mother in the Playas canton, one of the tourists spots in Ecuador with a great supply of seafood. 

Nelson's wife began with the idea of selling provisions out of the window of their home as they did not have a local store and they wanted to have an income to be able to look after their four children. It worked well for them selling provisions as in the area where they lived there was no store because it was separate from the city as a river crosses through this area. Currently their store is located at the front of their home and they both work from 7.00am until 9.00pm. They sell rice, sugar, milk products, drinks, etc in their store. 

With this loan he wants to stock his store buying rice, sugar, flour etc. In the future he wants to have a big store and to fulfill the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, flour

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el señor Santos M. P. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero tiene a su cargo dos personas. Santos vive en Jicaro Galan desde hace unos 25 años, su negocio a sido siempre la venta de refrescos y agua.
actualmente tiene un pequeño deposito de refrescos donde vende al por mayor y al detalle.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cajas de refrescos al por mayor, ya se aproxima la navidad y es la epoca del año donde se venden mas refrescos.

su mayor deseo en esta ocasión es que las ventas mejoren ya que debido a la epoca muy lluviosa que a atravesado el pais las ventas han bajado.
texts.en:
Señor Santos M. P. is 48 years old, single, and is providing for two people.  He lives in Jicaro Galan and for the past 25 years he has owned a business which sells soft drinks and juices.  He has a small stand where he sells them both wholesale and retail.

The loan will be used to purchase cases of soft drinks, as they tend to sell more of these around Christmas.

At this point, his greatest desire is for his sales to increase, as they have recently gone down due to the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in various sizes: 12 OZ, 1/2 liter, 1 liter, 1.5 liters, 2 liters, 2.5 liters and 3 liters.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flavia; La socia tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada; y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa desde hace 10 años. Ella trabaja en la municipalidad y los días sábados y domingos la socia viaja a la comunidad de Ancahuasi y otras comunidades y pueblos para vender ropa, ella trae ropa de la ciudad de Lima, compra en las fábricas al por mayor. La socia se ayuda con este negocio para poder educar a sus hijos y que terminen sus estudios en la superior. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Flavia, is a member of the LOS DIAMANTES community bank.  The bank is in Huanchac, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  

Sra. Flavia, 40, is married and has 4 children.  She has operated a business buying and selling clothing for 10 years.  She sells in the town during the week and in Ancahuasi and other surrounding towns on weekends.  She buys bulk supplies of clothing in Lima.  The business helps to pay for her children's education and might bring enough to pay for college, as well.

Sra. Flavia is thankful that she can borrow money this way and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a sus 3 hijos menores y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El arduo trabajo que Justina realiza en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, como: el cacao, café y hojas de coca, son llevados a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde obtiene buenos precios por ellos, en ese lugar tiene clientes fijos que siempre le compran su producción al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar en el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Lleva 39 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso y caro. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda ampliar la siembra de sus frutos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, asimismo comprará abono para aplicar en sus tierras.
texts.en: Justina, 55, is a happy, uncomplicated woman.  She lives in her own house with her 3 children and what she most wants is a carefree retirement.  The work that she does in her fields is hard, but she does the work to ensure a good yield when she harvests the crops.  She grows cacao, coffee and coca leaves and sells the crops in the Peruvian city of San Francisco where she can get the best price.  There are always wholesale buyers there who will buy whatever she has to sell.  What Justina most likes about farming is protecting her crops from the plagues of insects that can destroy her crops.  She's been farming for 39 years and what she finds most difficult about farming is getting her crops to market because it's expensive to move the crops, even when a means of transporting them is available.  In the future, she wants to purchase more land so that she can sow fruit crops.  This is Justina's third MFP loan.  She knows that she has to repay the loan in the agreed-upon time and is committed to doing so.  She is a happy and loyal member of her community bank.  She will use the thousand new soles loan to buy cacao and coffee seeds. She will also buy manure to apply to her fields.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés E. E., tiene la edad de 21 años, soltero, no tiene hijos y vive solo actualmente. El quiere comprar los productos para la asistencia de su café como lo son el abono, plaguicidas y herbicidas. Tiene varios años que él se ha dedicado a la producción de café y quiere seguir creciendo como caficultor. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tiene problemas con su finca pero si quiere seguir aumentando la producción de café para las próximas cosechas provenientes y tener su propiedad en buenas condiciones. También el no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más bajas. El  también tiene el deseo de superación personal a su vez ir generando ingresos para seguir aumentando la cantidad de café en producción y llegar a generar ganancias para su mejor bienestar económico, y lo primordial crecer como un productor de café de buena calidad de la zona.
texts.en: Andrés E. E., 21, is single.  He has no children and lives alone.  He wants to buy supplies for his coffee farm: manure, insecticides and herbicides.  He has been a coffee farmer for several years and wants to continue developing the business.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  There are no problems with his farm but if he wants to continue expanding his coffee production, he has to ensure that his land is well cared for.  Andres has never borrowed before, but he likes FUDECOSUR because its process for borrowing is relatively simple and its lending rates are low.  He wants to get ahead and, at the same time, increase his income by expanding his coffee production.

loans.use: Supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Doris Francisca

texts.es:
la sra. Doris Francisca F. tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos personas que dependen de ella, vive en Jicaro Galan en el barrio Las Delicias desde hace 32 años, tiene casa propia.
Doris se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, desayunos, almuerzos, burritas de carne.
Hace unos ocho meses inicio con venta de abarroteria teniendo una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos basicos, refrescos, carne de res, cerdo y pollo, tortillas, verduras, condimentos, aceite, manteca, margarina, salsa de tomate, frijoles, queso, tortilla de harina, huevos, leña. 

el sueño de doña Doris es que su familia este nuevamente unida y que tengan salud.
texts.en: Sra. Doris Francisca F., 52, is single and has two people who depend on her.  She has lived in Jicaro Galan in the Las Delicias neighborhood for 32 years.  She owns her house.  Doris operates a business making and selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, tortillas, baleadas, breakfasts, lunches, burritos, etc.  She started a small grocery in her house eight months ago.  She will use the loan to buy basic commodities, soft drinks, beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, vegetables, condiments, cooking oil, butter, margarine, tomato sauce, beans, cheese, flour tortillas, eggs and firewood.  Sra. Doris' greatest wish is that her family be reunited and that they all enjoy good health.

loans.use: Buy supplies for catering business.

loans.name: Catalina Concepcion

texts.es: Catalina tiene 30 años su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general pues siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Ella es una mujer responsable, el mayor desafío que enfrenta es que algunos clientes no le han terminado de pagar, estas son las razones por las que ya no realiza este tipo de créditos. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran apoyo. El financiamiento que realiza es para la compra de materia prima como toallas, sabanas, ropa en general, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en: Catalina, 30, operates a business selling general merchandise.  She is always looking for a way to get ahead.  She is a responsible woman.  Her most difficult challenge is collecting payments from customers who fail to pay.  That's why she no longer extends credit.  This isn't the first time that she's borrowed funds and past loans have been a great help.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business: towels, sheets, clothing, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña, Luisa aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura, siendo esta labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y ahora tiene sus propios tierras, en donde siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, los cuales vende en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus campos, ya que así tendrá productos para vender dentro de 6 meses, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos ya que perjudican el desarrollo de sus plantas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café así como también abono para fertilizar la tierra.
texts.en: Luisa, 38 years old, is a very happy and humble woman.  She lives in her own house with her 3 beloved children.  What she most wants is to work very hard to improve her quality of life.  Since she was very young, Luisa learned to work in agriculture, since this work has been in her family for many years.  She learned this work from her parents, and now she has her own land, where she grows cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves, which she sells in the city of San Francisco.  What she likes most about her work is planting her fields, since she will have products to sell within 6 months.  She has been doing this work for 14 years, and for her the hardest thing is protecting her crops from plagues of insects, since they are detrimental to the growth of her plants.  In time, she would like to buy more land, in order to increase her crops.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels it will be very helpful to her and that little by little it will improve her life.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, and she is always current in her payments.  With the one thousand nuevos soles requested, she will buy cocoa beans and coffee as well as fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans, coffee, and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 41 años, vende frutas con su esposa. Vive en una casa de ladrillos con su esposa y tres hijos en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 
 
El papa de José quiso que sus hijos tengan la misma actividad económica que el realizaba por eso le enseño a José todo sobre el negocio. En la actualidad José lleva la misma actividad del papa vendiendo frutas de todo tipo con su esposa. Trabajan desde las 06h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Vende las manzanas a $ 0.30 c/u. la libra de uvas a $ 1.00, peras a $ 0.30 c/u, sandias etc.  

Para seguir con su negocio de frutas bien surtido él quiere comprar frutas y una parte del crédito dirigirla al mejoramiento de vivienda comprando cemento, bloques y asi para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener más puestos de frutas.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old. He works together with his wife selling fruit. He lives in a brick house with his wife and three children, in a peri-urban zone on the outskirts of Guayaquil, called Duran, which is characterized by a deteriorating ecosystem.
 
José's father wanted his sons to pursue the same economic activity that he did; for this reason, he taught José everything about the business. Currently, José does the same work as his father, selling fruits of all kinds together with his wife. They work from 6:00 a.m. 12:00 every day. He sells apples for $0.30 each, grapes for $1.00 a pound, pears for $0.30 each, watermelons, etc.  

To continue with his business and make sure it is well-stocked, he would like to buy fruit, and part of the loan will also be directed toward improving his home, by purchasing cement and blocks. This will provide a better life for his children. In the future, he would like to finish constructing his house and have more fruit stands.

loans.use: Fruit for his business and cement and blocks for his house

loans.name: G.s. Baltodano Group

texts.es: La señora Ivana Jamileth tiene 23 años, es madre soltera con un hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la hojalatería, es decir la elaboración de pailas, peroles, cucharones todo de aluminio, luego esta mercadería la traslada al mercado de Masaya en donde ya tiene los compradores a los cuales les entrega el producto. Este negocio surgió desde hace 4 años, con recursos propios muy limitados y luego fue incrementándolo. Este negocio lo aprendió de su papa.  Ella está solicitando este crédito con el propósito invertirlo en la compra de materiales para así producir más y obtener de esta manera mayores ganancias. Otro integrante de este grupo es Don Luis Guillermo, el cual tiene 55 años, vive con su familia que es de 3 personas, es decir el, su esposa y un hijo. El señor también se dedica a la elaboración de utensilios de cocina de aluminio, los cuales los elabora en su casa de habitación y luego los vende en el mercado. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio, cabe señalarse su familia fue quien le enseño este trabajo desde hace mas de 22 años. El señor solicito este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en materia prima para su negocio que sirva de fuente de ingresos para su familia en general.
texts.en: Señora Ivana Jamileth is 23 and is a single mother of a 5-year-old son.  She makes a living by making metal objects like pots, pans, and aluminum spoons.  She then takes her merchandise to the Masaya market where she has buyers to whom she sells her products.  She started this business 4 years ago with her own, very limited resources, and grew it from there.  She learned how to do this work from her father.  She is requesting this loan with the goal of investing in the purchase of materials to produce more and to obtain better profits.  Another member of this group is Don Luis Guillermo, who is 55.  He lives with his family, which is made up of 3 people:  himself, his wife, and his son.  He also makes aluminum kitchen materials, which he makes in his house and then sells at the market.  This business is located in his home.  He has had it for 8 years.  It's worth pointing out that his family taught him how to do this work more than 22 years ago.  He requested this loan with the objective of investing in raw materal for his business, which will serve as income for his family.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorena Rocia

texts.es:
Lorena Roció mujer de 44 años  muy conocida en el Municipio de San Jacinto,  por el carisma que imprime en cada uno de sus actos, especialmente cuando lo aplica a su negocio de vender ropa papelería y detalles para el hogar en una miscelánea que tiene en un local al lado de su vivienda. Ella es una estudiante de arquitectura que agrega a su negocio valor,  por su perfil de estudios y por su potencial natural relacionado con la proyección de la imagen del mismo y la estética,  que  hasta a una persona desapercibida impacta cuando pasa por este lugar. Su madre y sus hermanos siempre le han apoyado sus ideas emprendedoras, ella hace mucho empezó vendiendo carne, pero como  este negocio solo funciona en las horas de la mañana se inventó  el de vender mercancías  y lo ubicó en un lugar  al lado de su casa. Su vinculación a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo es desde hace seis años, durante ellos ha recibido ocho financiamientos, con sus créditos ha logrado adecuar su local para la venta de mercancías, sus utilidades se han visto reflejadas en la inversión locativa que hizo a su vivienda, compra de electrodomésticos  para facilitar y disfrutar de su vida doméstica.  Ahora sus sueños se dirigen a ampliar su negocio y hacer un apartamento al lado del local para ubicarlo en arriendo y que este genere a su familia otro nuevo ingreso.  Con su credikiva comprará ropa, papelería y detalles para el hogar, inversión con la que proyecta una utilidad bruta de un 40%, con alta probabilidad de éxito, pues su experiencia le indica que Diciembre, Enero y Febrero  son  las épocas  de mayor repunte en sus ventas.
Lorena está satisfecha  de que su negocio  esté ubicado en un corredor comercial en la avenida principal, porque permanentemente tiene la visita de muchos de sus clientes y de transeúntes, lo cual hace  que ella esté siempre pensando en término de invertirle un nuevo capital de trabajo y   en la búsqueda de un apalancamientos financieros con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en: Lorena Roció is 44 years old and very well-known in the municipality of San Jacinto for the charisma she brings to whatever she does, especially her job selling clothing, stationery supplies and household items in a general store that she runs on the side of her home. She is an architecture student, which adds value to her business by using its natural aesthetics to attract customers who otherwise wouldn't notice it. Her mother and siblings have always supported her entrepreneurial ideas. A long time ago she started out selling meat, but since that business only operated during the morning she decided to start selling merchandise out of the side of her home. She took out her first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo six years ago, and since then she has received a total of eight loan with which she has been able to stock her store with supplies. She has invested the profits into making improvements on her home. She bought household appliances to make her domestic life easier. Now her dreams are to expand her business and build an apartment on the side of her store and put it up for rent, and in this way generate a new source of income for her family. With her loan she plans to purchase clothing, stationery supplies and household items and investment that projects a gross profit of 40 percent with a high probability of success. In her experience, December, January and February are the months where she makes the most sales. Lorena is pleased that her business is located in a business corridor on the main avenue because she permanently has a view of many of her customers and passersby, which means she is always thinking of ways to invest new working capital and finding financial leverage with loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, stationery supplies and household items

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, de 60 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su esposa Maura de 56 años y su hijo menor Roberto de 30 años, quienes lo apoyan en la siembra y cosecha de sus frutos. Los extensos campos de cacao, café y hojas de coca que posee, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y de una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su fama de cosechar productos de calidad le ayuda a vender a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que atrasan el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra. Este es el séptimo crédito FP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo.
