En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para aplicar a sus tierras, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en: Modesto is a straightforward and friendly 60-year-old  man. He lives in his own home along with his wife Maura, 56, and his youngest son Roberto, 30, who both help him plant and harvest his crops. His extensive fields of cocoa, coffee and coca leaves are the fruits of his arduous labor and firm conviction to move up in life. His products are in high demand in the city of San Francisco since his reputation of harvesting quality products helps him sell the items at very good prices. What he most enjoys about his work is guarding his crops from insects that could slow their development. He has been doing this activity for 40 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products since they are very heavy and tire him out. In the future, he hopes to purchase new plots of land to expand his crops. This is his seventh loan with Kiva partner FP, and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to his work's progress. He is a very happy member of his community bank and he always keeps order at the meetings. With the 2,000 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase fertilizer to apply to his crops so they are more productive.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Ivan Antonio

texts.es: Iván Antonio Martínez M., tiene la edad de 36 años, está casado y vive solo. El quiere compra los materiales para la mejora del local para la producción de pizzas y la materia prima para hacerlas. Tiene varios años que se a dedicado a eso y no quiere que su negocio muera, por lo cual quiere  mejorar las instalaciones de su local. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes problemas con  su negocio, pero si quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus productos para las buenas ventas. También el no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más bajas. El quiere llegar a producir más con su local e ir generando ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida  y a su vez seguir invirtiendo  cada día más.
texts.en: Iván Antonio Martínez M., who is 36 years old, is married and lives alone. He wants to buy materials to improve the premises used for the production of pizzas and the raw materials to make them.  He has several years of experience doing this, and doesn't want his business to die. This is why he wants to improve the facilities of his business. It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had problems before with his business, but he wants to continue growing in his business and improving the quality of his products in order to have good sales. Also, he hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with greater facilities and a much lower interest rate. He wants to start producing more with his business. He wants to make progress toward a better quality of life and at the same time continue investing more each day.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the building and raw materials for making pizzas.

loans.name: Las Amigas Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Las Amigas Luchadoras esta formado por tres mujeres vecinas de la ciudad de Nacaome, se conocen muy bien. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Zonia Elizabeth M. P. vive en union libre con el señor Policarpo Moreno Cruz y se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda en donde vende telas, ropa de hombre y de mujer, utensilios de cocina, ventiladores, perfumes entre otra variedad de articulos de uso personal y para el hogar.
su negocio tiene el nombre de bodeguita LA GANGA.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
 
la señora Lidia Ester C. C. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de refrescos y jugos al por mayor, tiene un deposito de refrescos.
tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año y medio y tiene de vivir en esta ciudad hace 5 años. 
Su esposo vive y trabaja en los estados unidos y le manda remesas mensuales para apoyarla con los gastos de su familia.
Lidia utilizara el credito para la compra de refrescos y jugos al por mayor.

la señora Luz Estela M. D. esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, perfumes, tintes, carteras, sandalias, zapatos, mochilas escolares etc. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio y  de vivir en Nacaome 12 años.
texts.en:
The 'Las Amigas Luchadoras' communal bank is made up of three neighbors from the town of Nacaome who know each other very well.  Below we detail the different business activities that they carry out:

Mrs Zonia Elizabeth M. P. lives with her common-law husband Policarpo Moreno Cruz.  She has a store where she sells fabric, men's and women's clothes, cooking utensils, fans, perfumes and a variety of other personal use products and articles for the home.  Her business is called “La Ganga” (The Bargain).  She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Mrs Lidia Ester C. C. is married and sells soft drinks and juice wholesale.  She has a soft drink warehouse.  She has had her business for one and a half years and she has lived in the city for 5 years.  Her husband lives and works in the United States and sends her monthly remittances to support her with family expenses.  Lidia will use her loan to buy soft drinks and juice whole sale.

Mrs Luz Estela M. D. is married and has 2 children.  She sells new clothes, perfumes, dyes, purses, sandals, shoes, school backpacks, etc.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  She has been in this business for 3 years and has lived in Nacaome for 12 years.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juice, clothes, perfumes, fabrics, articles for the home, fans, purses, sandals and backpacks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sofía; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, viuda  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. panadería ella venD. desD. las 06:00am hasta las 08:00pm, la panadería se encuentra en su casa, ella desea implementar su panadería con la  compra D.  insumos para elaborar pasteles, panes, tortas y algunos postres mas.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mas insumos para su panadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the community bank "Vamos Juntos", which is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Sofia is 57 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She balances her daily activities with working at her bakery.  She works from 6:00am until 8:00pm.  The bakery is located in her home.  She would like to purchase ingredients to make cakes, breads, pies, and other desserts to sell in her bakery.

She is asking for this loan to purchase supplies for her bakery.

She is thankful to everyone who is part of making this dream come true, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge de 48 años, produce y vende lentes. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Para vender lentes él se inscribió en un curso de cómo hacer lentes según medidas ya que por donde vive no hay nadie que tenga este tipo de negocio. Una vez que termino el curso invirtió sus ahorros en materiales para hacer lentes y comenzó a vender a sus conocidos recorriendo las calles. Poco a poco consiguió una lista de clientes para distribuir a una mayor cantidad hasta ahora que trabaja en horarios variados visitando a sus clientes. Los lentes los vende según el aumento que tenga es decir un aproximado de $ 10.00 a $ 25.00.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar vidrio, plástico para hacer los armazones, liquidos para los lentes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña y ladrillos y tener un local para sus lentes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 48 years old.  He makes and sells lenses.  He lives in a peri-urban area in Fortín de Guayaquil which is an area noted for its dirt roads.

Jorge signed up for a course on how to make lenses since there was nobody with this type of business where he lived.  Once he finished the course he invested his savings in materials for making lenses and began to sell to his acquaintances in the street.  Little by little, he built up a list of customers and began to sell more.  He works varied hours, visiting his customers.  The price of the lenses which he sells varies according to their magnification.  They sell for approximately $10 - $25.

Jorge would like to use his loan to buy plastic to make frames and liquids for his lenses.  In the future he would like to finish building his house as it is currently made from cane and bricks.  He would also like to have premises from which he can sell his lenses.

loans.use: To buy glass, plastic and liquids

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
la señora Concepcion Y. U. es soltera y vive en la ciudad de Nacaome, Concepcion se dedica al comercio 
y tiene una bodega de abarroteria y granos basicos en el interior del mercado de Nacaome. Concepcion vive en la colonia Rotaria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y granos basicos para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la epoca de navidad y quiere ver su negocio fuerte y surtido para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
la señora Concepcion necesita comprar arroz, maiz, frijoles, refrescos, aceites, manteca, margarina, papel higienico entre otros productos de mayor venta en su negocio.
 
Concepcion es una mujer luchadora y con grandes pricipios morales y eticos, es capaz de lograr lo que se propone.
texts.en: Concepcion Y. U. is single and lives in the city of Nacaome.  She is a merchant who has a store in the Nacaome market where she sells groceries and staple grains.  Concepcion lives in the Rotaria neighborhood.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise and staple grains to restock her business, since the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to see her business strong and well-stocked so that she can meet all the needs of her customers.  Concepcion needs to buy rice, corn, beans, soft drinks, cooking oil, butter, margarine, toilet paper, and other products at wholesale to sell in her store.  Concepcion is a tenacious woman who has great moral and ethical principles, and she is capable of achieving what she proposes.

loans.use: to buy butter, cooking oil, soups, cereal, soaps, toilet paper, soft drinks, margarine, beans, corn, rice, sugar and coffee.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith Miriam

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de carne en el mercado de san Sebastián desde hace 8 años, la socia compra carne de  los proveedores a un precio mayorista, La socia desea comprar carne para aumentar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y D. mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the communal bank “LOS DIAMANTES."  This communal bank is located in the Huanchac district which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Edith is 45 years old, single, and has one child.  She has had a business buying and selling meat in the San Sebastian market for 8 years.  She buys meat from the suppliers at a wholesale price.  Edith wants to buy meat to increase her business.  She requests a loan to buy meat.

Edith appreciates and values the loan granted through these means, and so is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: She wants to buy meat to increase her business.

loans.name: Antonio Ciro

texts.es: El señor Antonio Ciro V. M. labora en el rubro de minería es perforista trabaja hace ocho años aproximadamente . Vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos su esposa también trabaja como obrera de campo ambos se ayudan en la canasta familiar. Actualmente esta solicitando crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda y tener mejor calidad de vida , se propone otorgarle crèdito por que tiene buena experiencia crediticia y tiene capacidad para asumir una nueva obligación.
texts.en:
Antonio Ciro V. M. has worked as a driller in a mine for about eight years.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their three young children.  His wife also works as a field worker to contribute to household expenses.

He is asking for this loan in order to make improvements to his home and have a better quality of life.  

He can be given this loan because he has a good credit history and he is able to take on a new obligation.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Nola

texts.es: Nola, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su esposo Telesforo  de 35 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Nola, es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca, en las chacras que heredó de sus padres. Desde entonces trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego llegado el momento adecuado, cosechar sus productos y venderlos en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir movilidad para llevar su producción. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra de sus productos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus grupos. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, así también invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Nola, 34 years old, is a straightforward and hardworking woman who lives in her own house along with her husband Telesforo, 35 years old, and her three dear children, the incentive for all her hard work.

Nola's occupation is the cultivation of cacao, coffee, and coca leaves on the farmland she inherited from her parents.  Since she got her inheritance, she has worked laboriously every day.  Then, at the right time, she harvests the produce and sells it in the city of San Francisco.

What she likes most about her employment is the freedom she has in performing her work, as it is she who decides what is best for her crops.  She has spent ten years in this occupation and considers the hardest part to be the transportation of produce, as most of the time it's very difficult for her to get a means to convey her harvest.  In future, she hopes to purchase new land in order to expand the sowing of her crops.  

This is her third loan with MFP; she knows she must be punctual with her payments, as she has been with her previous loans.  She is a very committed member of her communal bank, and is quite involved in the development of its groups.

With the 3,000 soles she is requesting, she will purchase cacao and coffee seeds, and will invest in the purchase of fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy cacao and coffee seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Vicente; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la venta de churros (es un dulce con reyeno de manjar),el lo vende en su carreta por las tardes de forma  ambulatoria  conjuntamente con su esposa , el socio es una persona muy emprendedora y con este su negocio saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como azúcar, harina, manjar entre otros más. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together).  The bank is located in the Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

This member is Vicente.  He is 36, has a wife and they have a son.  He sells churros (a pastry with caramel or dulce de leche filling).  He is a street merchant and together with his wife sells the churros from his cart in the afternoons. He is a very entrepreneurial member and this business is helping his family get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his business such as sugar, flour,manjar (caramel or dulce de leche) and more.

Victor thanks those who are part of his dream and he promises to make the payments in the established terms.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his business such as sugar, flour, manjar (caramel or dulce de leche), and more .

loans.name: Terciopelo De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Terciopelo de Santa Rosa. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Lima en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún.Maria Luisa García es integrante de este grupo. Tiene 47 años estudio hasta el cuarto año de primaria,  es ama de casa principalmente pero tambien se dedica al comercio y tiene en total 2 hijos (varones). Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de borregos que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar alimento y borregos. Sus clientes son sus propios vecinos de Santa Rosa de Lima.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta y comprometida con la responsabilidad que conlleva solicitar el credito. Quiere este prestamo para fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: This group is called Terciopelo de Santa Rosa (Velvet of Santa Rosa). It is located in the community of Santa Rosa de Lima in the state of México. The group consists of 11 members, and this is the first time that they have applied for a loan at CrediComún. Maria Luisa G. is one of the members. She is 47 years old, and she attended school up to the fourth year of primary school. She has two sons. She is mainly a housewife, but she also has a business. She buys and sells lambs, a business that she began two years ago. She is applying for the loan to buy feed and lambs. Her customers are her own neighbors in Santa Rosa de Lima. On applying for this loan, she felt happy and committed to the responsibility that goes with applying for the loan.She wants this loan to strengthen and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy feed and lambs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 55 años D. edad, casada  y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. maiz, papa,que despues luego lo venD. a los mercados donD. se encuentran sus clientes a la vez se dedica a la venta D. comida especialmente los fines D. semana.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más insumos para su negocio D. comida y venta D. maíz,papa entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Rosa is 55 years old and is married with 9 children.  She alternates her daily activities between her business buying and selling corn and potatoes, which she then sells to the markets where her customers are located, and selling food, especially on the weekends.

She is asking for a loan for the purchase of more consumables for her food business selling corn, potatoes, etc.

She thanks those who are taking part in this dream by funding her loan, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: For the purchase of more consumables for her food business selling corn, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, ella es casada; y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta D. artesanía, ella elabora artesanía y la venD. D. manera independiente, la socia trabajo en la municipalidad y como resultado D. sus trabajo y sus ahorros pudo apertura su negocio D. artesanías, la socia desea aumentar su mercadería y abastecerse para la época D. navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” ["The Diamonds"] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Maria, and she is 50 years old. She is married with 3 children. Her work is buying and selling handicrafts. She also makes handicrafts and sells them independently. She works for the municipality, and as a result of her work and her savings, she was able to open her handicraft business. She would like to increase her supply of merchandise and stock up for the Christmas season. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying merchandise. 

The borrower values and appreciates the loan granted to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: El Sr. Luciano N. es un hombre muy trabajador el es empleado de una maquiladora de la localidad, tiene un pequeño el cual siempre ah  querido darle lo mejor y esta al pendiente de su seguridad y la de su esposa solicita el credito para la colacacion de protecciones en sus ventanas, su casa se la acaban de entregar y quiere empezar a ponerla bonita y comoda para su familia y sobre todo segura para beneficio de la misma.
texts.en: Luciano N. is a very hard-working man. He is an employee of a factory in his town. He has a little son, for whom he has always wanted to provide as best he can. He is concerned about the security of his child and his wife. He is requesting the loan to install protection on his windows. His house was recently completed, and he would like to start making it attractive and comfortable, and above all safe, for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: Installing protection on his windows

loans.name: Shirley Eneida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Shirley; ella tiene 21 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa ella viaja hasta Desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia) y compra ahí la mercadería que necesita como pantalones,chompas,casacas,blusas entre otros.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Shirley is 21 years old, has a live-in partner, and has 1 son.  She is a member of the Communal Bank "Vamos Juntos."  The bank is located in the District of Cusco, Province and Department of Cusco.

Shirley alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling clothes.  She travels to Desaguadero (border of Bolivia) and then purchases the goods that she needs such as pants, sweaters, jackets, blouses and more.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She thanks those who are taking part in her dream by funding this loan and promises to complete her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; La socia tiene 37 años de edad, ella es casada; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de joyería y artesanía, la socia se dedica a fabricación de aretes, collares en alambre y con mostacillas; también elabora parte de la artesanía y también compra al por mayor de sus proveedores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” ["The Diamonds"] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Justina, and she is 37 years old. She is married and has 1 child. Her work is selling jewelry and handicrafts. She works making earrings and necklaces using wire and beads. She also makes some of the handicrafts she sells, and she buys some on a wholesale basis from her suppliers. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying supplies for her business.
 
The borrower values and appreciates the loan provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in supplies for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inicio  la señora Idolvina S., quien vive en  C.D.E., ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, está constituido  por 15  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Todas se encuentran  trabajando en sus actividades y esperan mejorar sus negocios con los créditos que recibieron.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Idolvina quien se dedica a la cría y venta de gallinas.
La forma de trabajo de la señora Idolvina es la de comprar pollitos y criarlos hasta un tiempo determinado y luego los vende en el mercado, esta venta lo realiza aproximadamente dos veces al mes ya que no cuenta con mucha cantidad de animales para vender con mayor frecuencia.
Comenta que desea adquirir mayor número de pollitos y que estos acarrearían un mayor gasto por la cantidad de alimentos que consumen.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de pollitos y balanceados para crecimientos.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Idolvina S., who lives in Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in the area.
The group is called "Mujeres Trabajadoras" ("Hardworking Women").  It consists of 15 very active women who support each other, all from the same area.
They are working at their businesses and hope to improve them with the loans that they have received.
Idolvina raises and sells chickens.
Her business is buying chicks and raising them until a certain time, when she sells them in the market.  This sale happens approximately twice a year, since she doesn't have enough animals to sell more often.
She says she would like to have more chicks, and that this would result in more expense due to the amount of feed they consume.
She is asking for a loan for the purchase of chicks and balanced feed suitable for their growth.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks

loans.name: Las Dificiles De Tenjay Group

texts.es: El grupo decidió ponerse el nombre de Las Dificiles de Tenjay ya que todas ellas están de acuerdo en que todas las mujeres son dificiles de comprender.Todas las integrantes radican en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes.  La señora Marta Guadalupe H. tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; una mujer y 3 varones, 3 de ellos estudian el más pequeño solo tiene 2 años.   Ella vende comida y dulces en la escuela de la localidad, solicita el prestamo para invertir en dulces ya que es lo que más se vende en la escuela, con la ganancia que espera sacar de esto  piensa seguir  pagando los estudios de sus hijos; ya que su hija la mayor está estudiando la universidad, la señora está muy emocionada por que sabe que con los estudios que le está dando a su hija tendrá una vida mas cómoda.
texts.en: The group decided to give themselves the name "Las Dificiles de Tenjay" since all of them are in agreement that women are difficult to understand. All the group members are located in the Mexico state. The group is formed by nine members. Marta Guadalupe H. is 36 years old, is married, and has four children: a girl and three boys. Three of her children go to school and the youngest is only 2 years old. She sells food and sweets in the local school. She seeks this loan to invest in sweets as that is what she sells the most in the school. With the earnings she hopes to garner from this, she wants to continue to pay for her children's education, as her eldest daughter is attending university. Marta is very excited because she knows that with an education, she can give her daughter a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for their business

loans.name: Mujeres Generosas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora María Gladys Núñez es de  Monday_Minga Guazú quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Mujeres Generosas, están en el Cuarto Ciclo, con 18  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades para recaudar fondos  y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. 
Así como la señora Maria todas solicitaron el préstamo para invertir en sus emprendimientos.
La señora  Maria se dedica a la venta de ropas, esta actividad le conviene mucho por que las mercaderías son muy baratas que ella trae de la frontera por lo tanto tiene buena ganancia con la misma.
Ella vende sus mercaderías en su casa, y lo hace al contado y a crédito, dependiendo de los clientes.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, blusas, vestidos, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
For the formation of this committee, it was María Gladys Núñez, from Monday, Minga Guazú, who contacted her neighbors and friends to create a committee in her area.

The committee is called "Mujeres Generosas" ["Generous Women"], and they are in their fourth loan cycle, with 18 members. It is a group that is noteworthy in their neighborhood for being very united and responsible, with a strong sense of solidarity. The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit; they are up-tp-date with their payments; they carry out activities to raise funds; and they intend to finish this phase with outstanding fulfillment of their responsibilities to the institution. 
 
Like Maria, all of them are requesting the loan to invest in their enterprises. 

Maria's work is selling clothing. She enjoys this activity very much, since the merchandise she brings from the border is very cheap, and thus she obtains a good profit from it. She sells her merchandise from her home, and she does it both for cash and credit, depending on the customers. 

She is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shorts, and other items.

loans.use: Buying clothing such as dresses, blouses, t-shirts, shorts and others

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a widow. She has survived two tragedies in her life -- she lost both her husband and her son. However, Anastasia didn’t give up on life and the opportunities it offers. She had a daughter to provide for. She started her own small business 8 years ago. Today she is still running it in one of the local marketplaces of her home town of Drogobych called ‘Malyi’ (‘Small’).  Anastasia is selling women’s lingerie. Presently, she has already invested 20,000 Grivnyas in her enterprise.  

Anastasia is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase merchandise for her vending kiosk. Assorted selection of lingerie items will help her attract more potential buyers and thus stay competitive with other market vendors selling the same type of inventory. The profit generated will provide funds sufficient to meet Anastasia’s basic needs. One day, Anastasia hopes to move her business from the marketplace to a small welcoming store somewhere in the town of Drogobych.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie merchandise for resale

loans.name: De Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama De Esmeralda. Está ubicado en  el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  9  integrantes.
La señora Maria Araceli Castañeda es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 30 años, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos; 1 mujer y 1 varón.  Ella se dedica a  la venta de Chamarras y Abrigos que inició hace 9 años con un pequeño puesto de kocteles de fruta fuera de la escuela de su comunidad pidiendo ayuda a los niños para cobrar porque no sabía sumar ni restar y como sus ventas eran buenas fue ahorrando y compró ropa y como es buena vendedora sus vecinas le han solicitado que les traiga sabanas y colchas las cuales las vende en tandas o pagos semanales, su esposo que trabaja en un fabrica tambien le ayuda a vender con sus compañeros de trabajo, ya que la señora Araceli es muy entusiasta y jamas se rinde aunque en algunas ocaciones sus ventas han caido demasiado, puesto que siempre le dice a su esposo que “mas vale un peso en la mano bien gando y no millones bien robados”. Solicita el préstamo para la inversion de chamarras y abrigos que son los que se venden más en esta temporada y  asi acrecentar más sus ventas y negocio para que en un futuro pueda darle a sus hijos una muy buena calidad en su educación ya que desea que sean buenos profesionistas y no se queden como ella que con mucha dificultad aprendió a hacer cuentas.
texts.en:
This group is called De Esmeralda. It is located in Mexico state. The group is formed by 9 members. Maria Araceli Castañeda is the president of the group. She is 30 years old, is a businesswoman, and has two children: a boy and a girl. She sells coats and jackets, an activity she began 9 years ago with a small fruit cocktail stand outside of the community's school, asking the children for help when charging because she did not know how to add or subtract. Since her sales were good, she continued saving and bought clothes and because she is a good saleswoman, her neighbors had her bring them sheets and bedspreads, which she sold in batches or monthly payments.

Her husband works in a factory and also helps her sell along with her coworkers. Ms. Araceli is very enthusiastic and never gives up although on occasion her sales have dropped very much. She always tells her husband "a peso earned is worth more than one thousand robbed." She is seeking this loan to invest in jackets and coats which she sells a lot of in this season and grow her sales and her business so that in the future she can give her children a high quality education who she hopes to be good professionals and not be like her, who learned arithmetic with much difficulty.

loans.use: To invest in the business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Betzaida Rosaly

texts.es:
la señora Betzaida Rosaly C. B. es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Nacaome, Betzaida tiene una tienda donde vende ropa nueva, carteras, perfumes, ropa para niño, zapatos, vestidos, entre otros articulos.
su negocio tiene 8 años, mismo tiempo que tiene de vivir en dicho lugar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir a cabalidad su negocio. desea que para la epoca de navidad tener su negocio bien surtido ya que esta es la epoca en la cual hay mayores ventas de ropa.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hijos.
texts.en:
Betzaida Rosaly C. B. is single and has 2 children, she lives in the city of Nacaome. Betzaida has a shop where she sells new clothes, bags, perfumes, clothes for children, shoes, dresses, and other items.
Her business is 8 years old, the same time that she has been living in this place.
The loan will be used to buy goods to fully stock her business. She wants to have her business fully stocked for the Christmas period as this is the time when there are the greatest clothes sales.
The profits will be used to help her children get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, T shirts, blouses, bags, underwear, hats, trousers, jeans, dresses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a widow. She has a grown son (Volodymyr) and a teenage daughter (Oksana). Olga lives in western part of Ukraine, in the town of Drogobych. She is an entrepreneur selling children’s toys. 

She owns a little store called ‘Knopka’ located right in downtown Drogobych. Olga started this business 12 years ago. Currently, she has about 160,000 in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 32,000 Grivnyas. 

Olga is seeking a loan of 9,700 Grivnyas to purchase additional inventory this holiday season. She knows her sales go up during Christmas and New Year’s which is why she wants to re-stock her merchandise to be able to meet the growing demand. 

Olga is one of those entrepreneurs who are business savvy and very determined to achieve their goals. The current loan will benefit this stable business promoting its further development and growth.

loans.use: To stock additional inventory for holiday season

loans.name: Sonia Janet

texts.es:
Sonia de 52 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive sola en una casa de caña en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Hace 7 años para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes ya que antes ella conseguía dinero lavando ropa a mano. Vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 35.00 c/u, cremas, perfumes, bisutería.  Aunque ya hace 5 meses atrás murió su esposo ella sigue trabajando para poder asegurar su vejez vendiéndole a sus conocidos y vecinos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa de cemento ya que era uno de los sueños del esposo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old. She sells Yambal products (a business that allows for enterprising women to make independent sales). She lives alone in cane house in the outskirts of Guayaquil along the Perimetral highway. The area provides all the basic services and is located near a marsh.

Seven years ago, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, Sonia started selling Yambal products. Little by little, she increased list of customers. Before that, she earned money by washing clothes by hand. She sells perfumes from $ 20.00 to $ 35.00 c/u, creams and costume jewelry. Although her husband died 5 months ago, she has continued working. This way, she can have a secure retirement by selling to acquaintances and neighbors.

With this loan, she wants to buy Yambal products like perfumes, creams, and clothing. In the future, she wants to finish building her cement house. It was one her husband’s dreams.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and deodorants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: materials for building a pigsty

loans.name: Belky Yolany

texts.es:
la señora Belky Yolany F. M. es soltera y vive en la aldea Rio Grande de la ciudad de Nacaome, Belky se dedica al comercio desde hace 3 años, tiene una bodega de abarroteria y granos basicos en el interior del mercado de Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria y granos basicos para surtir su negocio ya que desea mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
la señora Belky necesita comprar arroz, maiz, frijoles, refrescos, aceites, manteca, margarina, papel higienico entre otros productos de mayor venta en su negocio.
 
su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Belky Yolany F. M. is single and lives in the village, Rio Grande, located near the city of Nacaome. Belky has had a store for three years. She has a grocery store inside the Nacaome market. The loan will be used to buy groceries and staple grains to supply her business. She wants to improve her sales and income. Belky needs to buy rice, corn, beans, soft drinks, oils, butter, margarine, toilet paper along with other products that sell well.

Her big dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, beans, corn, sugar, coffee, toilet paper, soups, butter, oil, margarine, pasta, cereal, oats, soap

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories, shoes, etc

loans.name: Yaneth Isabel

texts.es: Yaneth Isabel Morelos C.  de 47 años tiene dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 26 años y es la propietaria de  un negocio  llamado “tienda La Mona”. Yaneth  es beneficiaria del programa de vivienda y su negocio está ubicado en el Macroproyecto  “Ciudad Bicentenario” en Cartagena;  todo esto ocurrió porque resultó damnificada por la erosion y reubicada en este gran proyecto de vivienda sostenible.  Su experiencia de negocio la adquirió en el sitio donde antes vivía, que hoy trasladó a ciudad bicentenario donde ha logrado a esta nueva clientela,  venderle ranchos, víveres, licores, carnes, enlatados y bienes de la canasta familiar y ya goza de muchos compradores . En la actualidad está solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y aplica a un credikiva,  porque requiere comprar víveres y abarrotes para surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias que en la actualidad están en un 15%; su inversión será exitosa en la medida en que han ingresado mas familias al megaproyecto y requieren los víveres básicos para su sostenimiento y con ello logrará posicionarse en su punto por encontrarse sin competencia alguna. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y algún día convertirlo en un autoservicio bien elegante y con todo lo que su clientela requiera;   a mediano plazo sueña con que su hija se convierta en una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Yaneth Isabel Morelos C. (47) has two children, aged 10 and 26; she owns a little store called "tienda La Mona".

Yaneth is a beneficiary of the public housing program and her business is located in the "Ciudad Bicententario" macroproject in Cartagena. She was assigned housing in this major sustainable housing project after her own home was swept away by floods.

She acquired her business experience in her previous location and she has built up a clientele in her new home. She sells precooked food, groceries, liquor, meat, canned goods and other staples, and she has many customers.
 
This is her first loan application to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo/Kiva. The money is to buy stock for the store and increase her margins (currently 15%). Her investment should be successful as more families have moved into the neighborhood and there are currently no competing grocery stores in the area.
 
Her dream is to expand the business and turn it into an elegant self-service store with everything a customer could want. In the medium term, she would like her daughter to have a profession.

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her business

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Las Inseparables” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha reunido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.    La banca comunal está compuesta por once integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son: tienda surtida y tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de frutas, hilado de lana de vicuña, venta de verduras, tiendas de barrio.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Jeanete,  está casada, es madre de 3 hijos. La señora Jeanete se enteró de los servicios de Pro Mujer a través de los volantes que se entregaron en su zona, tiene como negocio una tienda de barrio en su domicilio. Esta tienda es atendida desde las siete y media de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche, debido al horario de atención recibe la colaboración de su hija. Este negocio le permite estar en la casa para la atención del hogar y atención de sus niños.
El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de mercadería para la tienda.
texts.en:
The "Las Inseparables" community bank is a new group created to obtain credit, training and healthcare as part of the Cascada Focus Group under Pro Mujer. This is their first loan.

The community bank has eleven members. They are involved in the following businesses: general store, stores selling blankets, clothing, fruit, vegetables, groceries, and spinning vicuña wool into thread.

Jeanete, the president of the group, is married and has three children. Jeanete became aware of the services offered by Pro Mujer via the flyers distributed in the area; she has a small grocery store.  The store is open from 7.30 am to 8.00 pm, and her daughter helps out with these long opening hours. The business enables her to be at home and look after the house and the children.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Narcisa Monserrate

texts.es:
Narcisa vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive con su esposo en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para mantener a su hijo con los gastos escolares ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos recorriendo las calles, vende perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 55.00 c/u, cremas muy económicas. En la actualidad tiene la idea de surtir su mercadería con ropa para que lo clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas y ropa para iniciar con las ventas. En el futuro quiere vender otra clase de productos y dirigir sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Narcisa sells products produced by Yanbal, a company that offers women entrepreneurs a means of making a living independently. She lives with her husband in Primavera de Duran, a degraded area on the outskirts of Guayaquil.
 
She started selling Yanbal products to pay for her son's schooling. She has steadily expanded her customer base as she gets out early in the morning to sell her wares, which include very affordable personal care products. She would like to acquire a stock of clothes in order to offer a greater range of products to her customers.
 
With the loan, she will buy Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams and clothing. In the future, she would like to sell other types of products and expand sales to other areas.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and clothing for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Herminia C. del km 6 monday _C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Alegres “iniciando el primer  Ciclo   con 15  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas, todas ellas con diferentes actividades, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para la comunidad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Lorenzo, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas. A ella le gusta esta actividad, porque puede realizarla en sus ratos libres, y lo hace ofreciendo a muchas personas en los negocios o en lugares de trabajos en las diferentes empresas.
Así ella puede manejar su tiempo y no descuidar a su familia, y quiere continuar con este negocio, pero quiere contar siempre contar productos nuevos para sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas de oro y plata y oro, cadenas, pulseras, gargantillas, anillos y otros.
texts.en:
The formation of this group was started by Ms. Herminia C. of 6km monday, Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her friends and neighbors to form this group in their area.

The group, called "Mujeres Alegres" ["Joyful Women"], is starting its first loan cycle with 15 members.  They are a group of women known in their neighborhood for being very united, group-minded, and responsible.  Each woman does a different type of work, but they all have a great entrepreneurial spirit and they are doing work to raise funds for the community.

One of the members is Ms. Lorenza, who sells jewelry.  She likes this work because she can do it in her free time.  She goes around offering her merchandise to many people in businesses, or at the workplaces of different companies.  In this way, she is able to manage her own time and not neglect her family.  She would like to continue her business but she wants to be able to always have new products for her customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy jewelry made of gold or gold and silver, such as chains, bracelets, chokers, rings, and other pieces.

loans.use: Compra de joyas, como cadenas, anillos, aros, y otros.

loans.name: Dulce Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Dulce, porque varias D. sus integrantes vendían dulces. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes.
L. señora Rocio Montaño es L. presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta L. Primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos: 2 mujeres y 2 varones.  ElL. se dedica a L. Venta D. Artesanias (Servilletas Bordadas) y Cortinas para carros, negocio que inició hace 6 años, con unicamente  3 metros D. teL. y 10 varillas, no sabía coser ni bordar pero era tanta L. necesidad D. iniciar algún negocio para poder mantener a su familia, ya que su esposo se había quedado sin trabajo, D. modo que le pidio a una vecina que le enseñara a bordar y coser a máquina, para lo cual tenía que pagarle con trabajo en su casa lavando su ropa y ayudandole a su quehacer y sólo le enseñaba 45 minutos ya que el esposo D. su vecina se molestaba si L. encontraba en su casa y apesar D. los malos tratos que recibió por aprender , alfin D. algunas semanas aprendió lo que elL. necesitaba para poder emprender su negocio y ya no son tres metros D. teL. ni diez varillas ahora son Rollos D. TeL. y más D. Cien kilos D. varillas. Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más máquinas D. coser y poder  emplear a vecinos D. su comunidad para que ya no salgan a otros Estados y se queden en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Dulce' (Sweet) because several of its members sell sweet treats.  The group is located in the State of Mexico.  It has 12 members.

Rocio Montaño is the group's president.  She is 26 years old and studied at elementary level.  She is a saleswoman and has 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys.  Rocio sells handicrafts (embroidered napkins) and curtains for cars.  She started this business 6 years ago with only 3 meters of cloth and 10 rods.  She didn't know how to sew or embroider but she really needed to start a business which could support her family since her husband didn't have a job so she asked a neighbor to teach her to embroider and use a sewing machine.  She paid for these lessons by doing work in the neighbor's house such as washing her clothes and helping her with her housework.  She only received 45 minutes worth of instruction at a time though as her neighbor's husband got annoyed if he found her in his house.

However, in spite of the bad treatment which she received in learning her traD., after a couple of weeks she had learned all she needed to in order to set up her business and now she no longer has just 3 meters of fabric and 10 rods but rolls of fabric and more than 100 kg of rods.  She is requesting this loan to be able to buy more sewing machines and employ neighbors from her community so that they don't have to go to other states and can stay in their community.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 36 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el poblado de Santa Rosa (ubicado en el interior de la selva Ayacuchana), se encuentran los cultivos de Rebeca, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que sus frutos como: el cacao, café y hojas de coca son muy bien cotizados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha en forma ambulatoria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, puesto que es recompensado todo el esfuerzo y empeño que puso en sus siembras. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que perjudican el desarrollo de sus plantas. Con el tiempo espera adquirir más tierras para que pueda ampliar la siembra. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café para sembrar, asimismo comprará sacos de abono para mejorar su productividad.
texts.en:
Rebeca, age 32, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Raúl, age 36, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better life. In the village of Santa Rosa (located in the interior of the Ayacucho jungle) Rebeca grows crops. Her products are of good quality and include cacao, coffee, and coca leaves that command good prices in the city of San Francisco, which is where she sells her entire harvest as a street vendor. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her crops since she is rewarded for all the effort and care she invests in her fields. Rebeca has been farming for 15 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from plagues of insects that can harm their development. Over time she hopes to acquire more land in order to increase her harvest.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Rebeca is always prompt with her payments and willing to continue in the same manner. In her Communal Bank she is one of the most cheerful members who is always joking around with the others in her group. With this loan of 2000 PEN that she requested, Rebeca will buy cacao and coffee seeds to plant as well as sacks of compost to improve her productivity.

loans.use: Purchase cacao seeds, coffee seeds, and compost

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: La señora Albina nacida en  Chuquisaca con 5 hijos que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella viene trabajando hace 4 años con Emprender, por que es la única entidad que le abrió las puertas es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra  maíz, yuca, maní y también se dedica a la ganadería. Tiene 10 hectáreas de tierras, sus productos va a vender en el mercado de la zona, sus hijos le ayudan en la siembra y cosecha, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una Motosierra y también para la compra de semillas, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Albina was born in Chuquisaca and has five children who are of school age. She has worked with Emprender for the past four years because it was the only entity that opened its doors to her. Albina is a hardworking woman who engages in agriculture. She grows corn, cassava, and peanuts and also raises livestock. Albina owns ten hectares of land and sells her products at the local market. Her children help with the planting and harvesting.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase a chainsaw as well as seeds. Albina is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase a chainsaw & seeds

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
El  Sr Maximiliano  está casado con la señora María, quien se dedica a la venta comida, él se dedica a la reparación de autos,  cuyo trabajo  le genera  un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  e hijos  están  saliendo adelante con esmero y dedicación.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas como gatos para diferentes tipos de vehículos, y otros.
texts.en:
Sr. Maximiliano is married to Sra. María, who sells food. He repairs automobiles and is able to generate a good income from this type of work.

With the help of his wife and children, Maximiliano is able to move forward with great care and dedication. Today he is a successful businessman with many customers because he provides good service.

Maximiliano is requesting this loan to buy equipment, such as automobile jacks for different types of vehicles, and other supplies.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his work

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La   Sra. Graciela   es casada  tiene   2  hijos, los  dos  en edad escolar.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, en su domicilio, la misma le genera un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como remeras, vestidos, blusas, shorts.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is married and has two school age children. She sells clothing from her home and is able to generate a good income. With the help of her husband, she and her family are able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication.

Today she is a successful businesswoman with many customers because she provides good service. Graciela is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing such as shirts, dresses, blouses, and shorts.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, dresses, blouses, and shorts

loans.name: Jardin De Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Jardin de Sueños. Está ubicado en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes.
La señora Felipa M. es integrante del grupo. Es comerciante y tiene en total 7 hijos: 3 mujeres y 4 varones.  Ella vende Ropa y tiene una Papelería  que inició hace 10 años con un poco de ropa la cual empezó a vender en abonos y fue el producto de una caja de ahorros  realizada con sus vecinas, pero a la señora Felipa le fue bien con sus ventas, fue organizando sus gastos una parte para invertir y la otra principalmente para su comida, y gracias a esa buena organización pudo hacer crecer un poco más su negocio y como era una mujer muy responsable sus vecinas la invitaron a formar parte de su grupo.  Para ella fue dificil salir adelante pues su esposo estaba enfermo, pero ella salió a trabajar dejandole a él el cuidado de los hijos. Actual mente la señora felipa cuenta con un puesto de ropa en los dias de tiaguis y una papelería en su comunidad. Solicita el prestamo para poder acrecentar más su papeleria y poner un negocio fijo de ropa , para continuar dandole estudios a sus demás hijos y en un futuro abrir más  locales de ropa y papelerías para emplear a personas que lo necesiten no importando si tiene alguna enfermedad.
texts.en:
This 12-person group is called Jardin de Sueños (Garden of Dreams) and is from Mexico state.

Señora Felipa M. is a member of the group. She is a merchant and has seven children, three girls and four boys. She sells clothing and also runs a stationery store. She started ten years ago with a small amount of clothing; her customers paid in installments. The business was funded through a neighbourhood savings bank. Sales were good, and Felipa invested part of her income in the business, and part for food. Thanks to her business skills and responsible attitude, she was able to expand the business, and her neighbours invited her to form part of their group.

It was difficult for Felipa to make progress as her husband was sick; however, she left her husband in the care of her children and went to work. Nowadays she has a stall selling clothing in Los Dias de Tiaguis and a stationery store in her community. 

She is seeking a loan so she can expand the stationery store and move her clothing business into a permanent location. She also wants to provide the rest of her children with a good education. In the future she would like to open other clothing and stationery businesses to provide employment to people who need it. Even illness will not deter her.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Simenis

texts.en:
Simenis is the mother of 3 children. She used to be a member of 'Nueva Esperanza' (New Hope), a group of borrowers that have appeared on Kiva.org more than once and have always successfully repaid their loans. Simenis is now asking for a loan as an individual because she requires a larger amount than is usually offered to borrowers that are members of a group. 

Simenis lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Simenis' community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. As well as Dominicans, Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Simenis' community.
  
Simenis requires her loan to invest in stock for her clothing business. As well as clothes, Simenis sells a variety of footwear - shoes, trainers and slippers. Simenis started this business 12 years ago and actually lists her favourite pastime as trading with customers! Simenis is very excited about taking out another loan so that she can continue to grow her business. She hopes to finish off the construction of her house with the profits that she makes, something which she also says is her biggest current challenge.

loans.use: To invest in her clothes business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 08 hijos (05 dependientes y 03 independientes), tiene estudios de educación secundaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 años, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de abarrotes, verduras y jugos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará comprando abarrotes, verduras y jugos al por mayor para abastecer su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y generar mayores ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad de los préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Azangarinas Valientes”, which is located in the District and Province of Azángaro, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, married, and has eight children (of whom five are dependents while the other three live independently). Juana has a high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN and was used to increase her business capital for selling groceries, vegetables, and juices.

Sra. Juana is requesting a new loan for 2000 PEN to invest in the purchase of groceries, vegetables, and juices in bulk to restock her business. Her dreams for the future are to improve her business and generate more income. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the convenience of the loans and the punctuality.

loans.use: Purchase groceries, vegetables, and juices

loans.name: El Juramento Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Juramento esta formado por tres personas dos mujeres y un hombre, los cuales viven en la colonia Buena Vista de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, todos tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse y son muy unidos, a continuacion  se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Reyna E. G. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella y de su esposo, Reyna se dedica a la venta de golosinas, tambien vende productos AVON (cosmeticos), le hacen pedidos de lociones, carteras, talcos, cremas, utencilios para la cocina, para baño y niños.
doña Reyna es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseo de salir adelante, se transporta en su bicicleta para dejar los pedidos a sus clientes y antes de la hora de almuerzo se dedica a la venta de comida a personas que estan trabajando por esa zona. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos y alimentos para la fabricacion de sus golosinas.

Doña Brenda Marisela R. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y su esposo se dedica a la albañileria y le apoya economicamente, tienen casa propia.
Brenda se dedica al negocio de la venta de charamuscas, hielo y refrescos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas, agua, azucar y refrescos.

don Ismael N. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Juana Corina Valle, de ellos dependen 4 hijos. Ismael se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de ladrillos y tejas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de tierra y leña para fabricar los ladrillos y las tejas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Juramento” (The Oath) consists of three individuals, two women and one man, who live in the Buena Vista subdivision of the city of San Lorenzo. They all have known one another for a long time and are very close. The details of their various business activities are described below:

Sra. Reyna E. G. is 42 years old and married. She and her husband have three dependent children. Reyna sells sweets as well as Avon products (cosmetics). She receives orders for lotions, wallets, talcum powders, crèmes, cooking utensils, bathroom products, and children’s products. Doña Reyna is a hardworking woman who has great desire to succeed. Traveling by bicycle, she delivers the orders to her customers and sells food to people working in the area prior to lunchtime. Her loan will be used to buy cosmetics and ingredients for making her sweets.

Doña Brenda Marisela R. is 24 years old and the mother of one child. Her husband works as a mason and provides financial support. They have their own home. Brenda sells popsicles, ice, and soft drinks. Her loan will be used to buy fruit, water, sugar, and sodas.

Don Ismael N. is 43 years old and married to Sra. Juana Corina Valle. They have four dependent children. Ismael manufactures and sells bricks and tiles. His loan will be used to buy clay and firewood for making bricks and tiles.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 32 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Maida de 9 y Jaurelio de 4 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los cultivos de Rebeca, son de los mejores cuidados del poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana), los frutos que más siembra son: el cacao, café y hojas de coca, son de muy buena calidad, ahora se encarga de aplicar abono a sus tierras, de esa manera asegura la productividad de sus frutos. En la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde vende sus productos, los clientes solicitan mucho de sus cultivos, a cambio recibe un buen precio por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, por que recibe la recompensa luego de varios meses de arduo trabajo. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, planea comprar nuevas tierras para que pueda extender la siembra e incrementar la cantidad de productos que normalmente cosecha. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus tierras, asimismo desea comprar fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Rebeca, age 28, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with husband Raúl, age 32, and their two beloved children, Maida (age 9) and Jaurelio (age 4), who are the reason behind all of her efforts. The crops Rebeca grows are the best kept in the village of Santa Rosa (which is in the Ayacucho jungle). These include cacao, coffee, and coca leaves that are of high quality. Now she is in charge of applying fertilizers on her land to ensure the productivity of her crops. She sells her products in the city of San Francisco. Her customers frequently request her crops, so she receives a good price for her products. What enjoys most about her job is the harvesting season because she is rewarded after many months of hard work. Rebeca has been farming for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from plagues of insects. Over time she plans to buy additional farmland so that she can increase the quantity of products that she normally harvests.

This is her first loan with MFP. Rebeca promises to be prompt with her payments since she has made a commitment with the Institution. In her Communal Bank she is one of the members who is most committed to the development of her group. With this loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, Rebeca will buy compost for her land as well as fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost & fertilizer

loans.name: Férmina

texts.es:
La Sra. Fémina    tiene 4 hijos   en edad escolar.
Ella   tiene una pequeña despensa en el km 7 Ciudad Nueva, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposo  y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.

Hoy día el es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa como: harina, fideos, arroz, carne, panificados, enlatados.
texts.en:
Sra. Férmina has four school age children. She has a small food pantry along Km. 7 in Ciudad Nueva. Her sales continue to increase, allowing her to generate a good income. With the help of her husband and her entire family, she has been able to move forward with great sacrifice and effort.

Today she is a successful businesswoman with many loyal customers because of her kindness. Férmina has demonstrated that she is a responsible and honest person with her commitments, so she has been provided with the necessary support.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise for her food pantry such as flour, noodles, rice, meat, baked goods, and canned goods.

loans.use: Purchase  flour, noodles, rice, meat, baked goods, and canned goods

loans.name: Juana Yolanda

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad,  es viuda y tiene cinco hijos. Solo estudió primaria, pero no la concluyó.
Juana está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.500. 00 nuevo soles, lo utilizó para incrementar  el capital  de su negocio.  Ella se dedica al  engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino. 
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le permitirá comprar más ganado vacuno. 
Su sueño  es seguir adelante y  crecer en su negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Bartolina Sisa”, which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has five children. Juana had started elementary school but was not able to finish.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. The first loan she requested was for 500 PEN, which she used to increase her business capital. Sra. Juana raises cattle and sheep.

She is requesting a new loan for 1500 PEN so that she can buy more cattle. Her dream is continue forward and grow in her business. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the training she receives.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Gladys Petronila

texts.es: Gladys Petronila tiene 38 años su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 10 años, que tiene este medio de vida. Su clientela está compuesta por vecinos, familiares, hombre y mujeres, Gladys gradualmente ha ido incrementando sus ventas, por eso sueña con tener un local independiente, que le de mayor organización y estén mejor exhibidos la mercancía y productos que ella vende. Con sus financiamiento ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar cada día las condiciones de su familia, así podrá comprar camisetas, faldas, trajes, vestidos entre otras cosas. Con todo el empeño y entusiasmo que deposita ha logrado mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Gladys Petronila is 38 years old and has been selling clothes for more than ten years as a means of supporting herself. Her customers consist of neighbors and relatives, both men and women. Gladys has been gradually increasing her sales, but her dream is to have her own store where she can be more organized and be able to display better the merchandise and products she offers. With the help of the loans, she has managed to increase her earnings and improve each day the conditions for her family.

She will be able to buy shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and other items. With all the effort and enthusiasm she invests, Gladys will be able to improve every day.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and other items

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo de 32 años y sus 4  queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de cacao, café y coca es la actividad que realiza diariamente Rebeca; con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus productos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde los comercializa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para que pueda ampliar su siembra. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, asimismo comprará sacos de fertilizantes, ya que desea mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a 31 year-old mother who is loving and hard working. She lives in her own house, together with her husband, Alfredo, 32, and her four beloved children, to whom she hopes to offer a better quality of life. Each day, she works cultivating cocoa, coffee, and coca. Through her great efforts, she has achieved good productivity on her lands.  Her products are of a very good quality and are highly valued in the city of San Francisco, where she sells them.  Her favorite thing about her job is caring for her planting. She has been doing this work for 11 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products, as the sacks are very heavy and tire her our.

In the future, she hopes to buy new land so that she can plant more. This is her sixth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she intends to be very punctual with her repayments, as she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, which she is very satisfied with. With the requested three thousand nuevos soles, Rebeca will buy cocoa and coffee seeds, as well as sacks of fertilizer, because she hopes to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds, coffee seeds, and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rios De Babilonia Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Rios de Babilonia esta integrado por tres compañeras todas residentes en la colonia Obrera de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Leonicia C. Z. tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, pero solo uno depende de ella, la hija vive en USA.
doña Leonicia se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion en donde vende productos de consumo popular.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir mas su negocio.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio.

la sra. Gloria Marina A. A. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Luis Alexander Canales quien vive en USA y le manda dinero para la manutencion de sus dos hijos. doña Gloria se dedica a la venta de mariscos y refrescos, esta actividad la ejerce desde hace unos 4 años.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos y refrescos.
 
la sra. Sandra Yamileth C. tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Leopoldo Palma quien se dedica al negocio de tomar fotografias,  tienen dos hijos que dependen de ambos.
la señora Sandra utilizara el credito para la compra de maiz, leña y refrescos. 
Sandra se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace unos 4 años.
texts.en:
The group Rios de Babilonia (“Rivers of Babylon”) is comprised of three friends that all reside in the Obrera section of the city of San Lorenzo.  They are hard-working and dedicated women, and following is a summary detailing the different activities they carry out:

Ms. Leonicia C. Z. is 54 years old and a single mother with two children, but only one of them still depends on her.  Her daughter lives in the USA  Leonicia dedicates herself to commerce, and has a small general store in her home where she sells popular products for general use.
