She will use the loan to buy groceries with which to supply her store.  Her goal is to make her business grow.

Ms. Gloria Marina A. A. is 42 years old and married to Mr. Luis Alexander Canales.  He lives in the USA and sends her money to help support their two children.  Gloria dedicates herself to selling seafood and refreshments, an activity she has been carrying out for 4 years.  She will use the loan for the purchase of seafood and refreshments.

Ms. Sandra Yamileth C. is 32 years old and married to Mr. Leopoldo Palma, who is a photographer.  They have two children that depend on both of them.  Sandra will use the loan to buy corn, wood, and beverages.  Sandra has dedicated herself to preparing and selling tortillas for 4 years.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, lard, rice, corn, sugar, beans, shrimp, tortillas, toilet paper, oil, margarine, soap, pastas, cereal, oats, eggs, bread, coffee, wood.

loans.name: Gladys Natividad

texts.es:
Gladys vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para mantener a sus hijas ya que es madre soltera empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes ofreciendo los productos a sus conocidos. Vende perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 55.00 c/u, cremas muy económicas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas y ropa para iniciar con las ventas. En el futuro quiere vender otra clase de productos y dirigir sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Gladys sells Yambal products (a company that offers entrepreneurial women the chance to become independent sales reps for their products).  She lives in Primavera de Duran (a peri-urban zone outside of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecology).

She started selling Yambal products to support her daughters, because she is a single mother.  Little by little, she increased her customer base, offering the products to her acquaintances.

She sells perfumes from $15.00 to $55.00 c/u, very affordable creams.  She would like to use the loan to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, creams, and clothing to sell.  In the future, she would like to sell other product lines and expand her sales efforts to other areas.

loans.use: Perfumes, cosmetics.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Memuna S..  She is single and has 1 child, aged 20. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her because of schooling, they help her in business and one of them is her mother.  In 1995, Memuna S. established her business selling plastic footwear, blouses, cosmetics, perfumes, etc. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,500,000SLL. Memuna S. has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add business stock in order to increase her profit margin. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 700,000SLL.  In the future, Memuna

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento UNION  integrado por  9 integrantes de los cuales 6 viven en la zona de San Jose y los restantes viven en el barrio  San Jorge, Su actividad es la venta De bisutería, venta. De frutas, venta de comida, servicio.                                                                                          La Presidenta es la Sra.  Mariela, comerciante en la venta de cerveza hace 1 año, alquila un local cerca de su domicilio y cuenta con un hijo menor que se encuentra estudiando, la Sra. lleva muchos años con esta actividad también vende papas fritas y bocaditos, es un apersona muy responsable y con el dinero del crédito comprara refrescos y cerveza por caja. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            La Secretaria es la Sra. Cristina es  ayudante de cocina en el mercado de la zona, concubina con el sr. Gilberto Condori el cual es motosierrista y tienen dos hijos en su poder, la Sra. Trabaja en un restaurante conocido de la localidad del Torno, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería.                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Todas las Socias son personas responsables y puntuales y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico y la motivación de superación en sus negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Bank UNION is comprised of 9 members; 6 reside in the San Jose zone, and the rest live in the San Jorge neighborhood.  Their activity is the sale of costume jewelry, fruits, food, and services.  The President is Mariela, who has been selling beer for 1 year.  She rents a locale close to her house, and has a young son who is in school.  She has many years of experience, also sells French fries and snacks, and is a very responsible person.  She will use the loan to buy beverages and cases of beer.  

The Secretary, Cristina, is an assistant in the kitchen of one of the area’s markets.  She is married to Gilberto, who provides transportation services, and they have two children in their care.  She works in a well-known restaurant in the locality of Torno, and will use her loan money to purchase merchandise.

All the members are responsible and punctual, and are thankful to the institution for its financial support and the motivation to make their businesses and activities improve.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: G.s. Santa Isabel Group

texts.es: Celia Cruz tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. Celia es una persona luchadora que disfruta de su actividad de interactuar con sus clientes a pesar de ser una actividad humilde obtiene lo necesario para mantener a su familia como es su hijo. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio es las afueras de su vivienda. Otra integrante del grupo es Sabina que se dedica a la venta de comida, ambas saben cocinar muy bien, ya que venden tajaditas de plátanos, gallo pinto, maduro y enchiladas entre otras cosas. Por lo que juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Celia Cruz is 31 years old, and her activity is selling food.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  Celia is a fighter, who enjoys the aspect of her business involving interaction with customers.  Despite it being a humble activity, she obtains what is necessary to support her family and son.  She has situated her business just outside of her home.  

Another member of the group is Sabina, who dedicates herself to selling food.  Both are good cooks, and sell fried sweet plantains, gallo pinto (rice and beans), ripe plantains, enchiladas, and other items.  Together, they have decided to take out this loan in order to buy ingredients for their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Claritza es una D. L. miembros del Grupo Plan D. Lucha 2 & 3, localizado en La ciudad D. Hato Mayor, cuya economia depenD. D. la agricultura y es una D. las ciudades mas rurales D. República Dominicana, en donD. como muchas hay escasez D. agua potable y D. energía electrica y con una poblacion D. dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Sus actividades principales son las ventas D. ropas interiores. 

Claritza es madre D. 2 hijos, y viven junto a ella y su padre. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido trabajar para que ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante y su actividad favorita es trabajar para atender su negocio.

Claritza está muy emocionada D. recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después D. haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento D. su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 2 años, el cual inició con un pequeño ahorro que tenia y por su iniciativa D. generar ingresos y ser util. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. diferentes modeL. D. ropa interior. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para comprar un abanico y ahorrar para su negocio. Su sueño es poder tener su negocio establecido.
texts.en:
Claritza is one of the members of the Plan D. Lucha ("Battle Plan") 2 & 3 Group, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region.  It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic, where there are often drinking water and electricity shortages.  The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants.  Her primary activity is selling undergarments.

Claritza is the mother of 2 children, who live with her and her father.  She tells us that her biggest challenge has been working to help her children get ahead.  Her favorite activity is tending to her business.

Claritza is very excited to receive her second loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan.  This was a step toward making her business grow.  She has had her business for about 2 years, which she started with a small amount of savings she had, and with her initiative to generate income and be useful.  She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing various types of undergarments.  She plans to use her earnings to buy a fan, and to save for investment in her business.  Her dream is to have a well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase undergarments

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Emma B..  She is married and has 3 children aged 2, 4, and 9 years. In 2000, Emma B. established her business selling local food items: palm oil, benni, beans, and pepper, etc.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 4,500,000SLL. 

Emma B. has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add business stock to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600,000SLL.  Emma thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil

loans.name: Julia Angelica

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, realizó estudios de educación superior.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de quesos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo  invertirá para comprar quesos al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar su negocio y así generarse más ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y la organización.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 43 years old and lives with her partner.  She has one child.  She completed her higher education.

Julia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used that money to increase the working capital of her business selling cheese.

She is requesting a new loan for 700 nuevos soles which she will use to buy cheese wholesale.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business and thereby make more profits.

What she likes most about her community bank is the punctuality and the organization.

loans.use: To buy cheese wholesale

loans.name: Confiando En Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Confiando en Dios esta formado por dos mujeres y un hombre, se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y juntos han logrado salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Asuncion Agustina F. tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, recibe ayuda economica de su esposo, Asuncion se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas. gracias  a este negocio a podido salir adelante con su familia, ademas de hacer golosinas, vende pan, tamales. Estos productos los vende en su casa de habitacion y tambien por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes para ocaciones especiales.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio.
 
el sr. Carlos Agusto M. H. tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene personas que dependan de el, actualmente vive en casa de su mama junto con sus hermanos, Carlos tiene un molino para moler maiz, atiende a los vecinos y clientes de la zona, tambien sale a vender agua en su coche en los barrios y caserios aledaños a su comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en la mejora de su molino y comprarse unas nuevas porras para
el acarreo del agua.
 
la sra. Santos Francisca F. H. tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella y de su esposo el cual vive en los estados unidos y le ayuda economicamente para la alimentacion de sus dos hijos, doña Santos Francisca se dedica a vender refrescos, charamuscas y frescos naturales, de esta manera saca adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios y la alimentacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos ya que se aproxima la navidad y las ventas se mejoran.
texts.en:
The 'Confiando en Dios' (Trusting in God) communal bank is made up of two women and one man.  They have known each other for a long time and together they have managed to get ahead with their businesses and their families.  Below we will detail the different business activities that they carry out:

Mrs Asunción Agustina F. is 38 years old.  She has three dependent children.  She receives financial help from her husband.  Asunción makes and sells candies.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to get her family ahead.  As well as making candies, she also sells bread and tamales.  She sells these products from her home and also fills orders that her customers make with her for special occasions.  She will use her loan to invest in her business.

Mr Carlos Agusto M. H. is 32 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any dependents.  He currently lives in his mother's house together with his siblings.  Carlos has a mill for grinding corn.  He serves his neighbors and customers in the district.  He also goes out and sells water in his car through the neighborhoods and villages surrounding his community.  He will use his loan to invest in improving his mill and buying some new containers for carrying the water.

Mrs Santos Francisca F. H. is 33 years old.  She has two dependent children.  Her husband lives in the United States and helps her financially so that she can feed their two children. Doña Santos Francisco sells soft drinks, 'charamuscas' candy twists and natural drinks.  In this way she helps get her children ahead with their studies and helps to feed them.  She will use her loan to buy soft drinks as Christmas is approaching and this is a time when sales improve.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, soft drinks, meat, sugar, firewood, colorings, containers, spare parts for a mill, fruit, flavorings

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria de 52 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar esta ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  
 
Hace dos años atrás empezó con su tienda porque siempre quiso tener un negocio que le produjera dinero para ayudar a su esposo y que pueda pasar en su casa ya que la tienda la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco la surtió con mercadería y comenzó a trabajar desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Ahora su tienda se llama “La voluntad de Dios” porque confía mucho que Dios que le ayudara en lo que ella realice. Una de las dificultades al atender el negocio es que tuvo un derrame facial en su rostro (se puede observa en la foto).

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento porque actualmente es de caña y madera.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old.  She has a small store in the front of her house.  She lives in a peri-urban area which has all basic services.  It is located in La Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area which is surrounded by a salt marsh.

Two years ago she started her store because she always wanted to have a business that would make her money to help her husband.  She also wanted a business that she could have in her home and the store is located in the front part of her home.  Little by little she stocked her store with merchandise and started working from 6.00am to 11.00pm every day.  Now her store is called “La voluntad de Dios” (God's Will) because she trusts that God will help her in everything she does.  One of the difficulties she has in serving in her business is that she suffered a facial paralysis (as you can see in the photo).

She will use her loan to buy rice, drinks and canned food for her store.  In the future she would like to have her house made from cement because it is currently made from cane and wood.

loans.use: Rice, drinks and sugar

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida, para ello esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. El negocio de Tony se encuentra en el poblado de Santa Rosa (ubicado en el interior de la selva Ayacuchana), el se dedica en la administración de una estación de radio, por lo que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, además por ser la principal radio del poblado, ha logrado que este trabajo sea el más rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es programar música y monitorear los programas que se transmiten y que tengan un contenido adecuado, han transcurrido 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer dentro de la radio por casi 18 horas diarias, lo cual fatiga mucho. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de su radio, para brindar una mejor comodidad a los visitantes de la radio. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos equipos para radio, ya que los que tiene actualmente están fallando debido al tiempo que ya tienen de uso.
texts.en:
Tony is 21 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working young man who lives on his own in his own house.  What he wants more than anything is to get ahead in life.  He is prepared to work very hard to achieve this.  Tony's business is in the town of Santa Rosa (which is located in the Ayacuchana jungle).  He runs a radio station which has become his main source of income.  It is the main radio station in the town and he has managed to make his work profitable.

What Tony most likes about his work is programming music, monitoring the programs which are transmitted and making sure that the programs have appropriate content.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  He considers that the most difficult thing about his work is having to remain inside the radio station for almost 18 hours a day which leaves him very tired.  Over time, he would like to improve his installations to make the visitors to his radio station more comfortable.

This is Tony's fourth loan with MFP and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to the development of his work.  He is a very happy member of his community bank and he always brings order to their meetings.  He will use his loan for 3,000 nuevos soles to buy new equipment for his radio station since his existing equipment is breaking down as it has been used for a long time.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his radio station

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita. Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal Dinastía Espoir, vive en la ciudadela  los Eucaliptos en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, es muy rica en su cultura y tradiciones y su gente es amable y cordial.

La Señorita Rosa es una socia muy joven, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive independiente arrendando un departamento. Nuestra socia es comerciante de juguetes y mas variedades, esta actividad  la realiza hace 4 años y labora de miércoles a domingo sin un horario fijo, como no tiene un puesto propio vende su mercadería de manera ambulantemente.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y una amiga le ha invitado a formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras quienes con su trabajo sacan adelante a sus familias.El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia como juguetes para la temporada navideña que se aproxima. Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería y así no tener que recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is a member of the community bank Dinastía Espoir.  She lives in the Los Eucaliptos neighborhood in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its historic center.  It has a lot of varieties of food, it is rich is culture and traditions, and the people are kind and friendly.

Rosa is 19 years old, single, and lives independently in a rented apartment.  She sells toys and other merchandise four days a week.  She works from Wednesday to Sunday without fixed hours.  She doesn't have a store, so she sells her merchandise as a street vendor.

This is her second loan with the community bank.  A friend invited her to join this beautiful group of strong and hardworking women who are improving their families with their work.  She is going to use the money from this loan to purchase toys for her business since the Christmas season is approaching.  

Her dream is to have her own store to sell her merchandise so she doesn't have to travel around the city.

loans.use: Purchase toys

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace cinco años cerca a la parada de una línea de minibuses,  siendo este su principal mercado,  los choferes de la misma parada son los que le compran, es muy conocida por la exquisitez de sus platos. No cuenta con dependientes en la actualidad sin embargo se esmera por crecer y ser el ejemplo para sus hijos. Ella vive en la  casa de sus papás, se levanta muy temprano para cocinar e ir a su venta, es muy trabajadora y responsable, con el dinero del credito comprara material de construccion para la remodelacion de su cocina y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Claudia has sold food for more than five years close to a bus stop. This is her principle market. The drivers at the stop buy from her and she is well known for her exquisite dishes.  She doesn't have any dependents right now but she nonetheless strives to grow and be an example for her children. She lives in her parents' house and gets up very early to cook and go sell. She is very hardworking and responsible. With the money from the loan, she will buy construction materials to remodel her kitchen. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to remodel her kitchen and buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shirts, trousers, shoes, T-shirts and perfumes

loans.name: Walter Balmore

texts.es:
Walter, posee una panadería, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad, ellos dependen económicamente de él, Walter tiene 36 años de edad, y reside con su familia en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, este negocio lo comenzó por influencia de un amigo que también tiene panadería y le ofreció trabajo, él decidió trabajar y cuando ya había aprendido quiso poner su propia panadería en su casa, su esposa le ayuda  y no tienen horario de trabajo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para realizar una inversión de materiales al negocio, él planea comprar harina, azúcar y levadura, esta inversión le ayudara a crecer con la producción, ha mejorar su economía y a ofrecer a los clientes mayor cantidad de pan.
Su proyección es fortalecer el negocio, tener una panadería de prestigio, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter has a bread bakery. He lives with his wife and their two children, aged 12 and 10. They depend on him financially. Walter is 36 years old and lives with his family in El Transito, departament of San Miguel. He started this business due to the influence of his friend who also has a bakery and who offered him a job. He decided to take the job and when he learned he decided to open his own bakery in his house. His wife helps him and he has no set work schedule.  

Right now he is asking for a loan in order to invest in some materials for his business. He plans to buy flour, sugar and yeast. This investment will help grow his production and improve his finances, and offer his customers a larger quantity of bread. 

His plan is to fortify his business, have a prestigious bakery, and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 56 años D. edad, casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. carne ella lo compra del mismo ganadero y luego lo distribuye a mas precio a los mercados y algunas vecinas que le solicitan. La socia es una señora muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante. 

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más carne para la distribución a sus clientes. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VAMOS JUNTOS” communal bank, The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.   

The member is Dominga. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling meat. She buys it from the rancher himself and later distributes it at a higher price to the markets and some neighbors who order it from her. This member is a very enterprising woman who is very enthusiastic to get ahead.  

She is asking for the loan to buy more meat to distribute to her customers. 

She is grateful to the people who are a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy more meat to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras”  ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia D. Lampa y departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil  casada y tiene  05 hijos (01 dependiente y 04 independientes),  la señora  no pudo concluir sus estudios D. educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 04 años,  su  primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. venta D. ganados y agricultura.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en productos para su chacra.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una casa en Mala y mejorar su chacra.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, Lampa province, Puno department.  She is 60 years old, married and has 5 children (1 dependent and 4 independent).  She could not finish her primary education.

Julia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used that money to increase the working capital of her business selling livestock and growing crops.

She is requesting a new loan for 300 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying products for her farm.

Her dream for the future is to have a house in Mala and to improve her farm.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: To buy products for her farm

loans.name: Blanca Rosibel

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca Rosibel C. L. esta soltera y es comerciante, tiene una tienda en la cual vende ropa nueva y carteras, no tiene hijos y esta cursando sus estudios universitarios. Blanca viene de una familia luchadora, viaja por las noches a la universidad en donde se esta graduando este año de ingenieria agroindustrial, su meta es crecer como profesional.
gracias a su hermano tiene este negocio, el le dio un puesto para que trabajara y estudiara a la vez logrando sus objetivos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio ya que sus clientes le estan pidiendo pantalones de moda actual.
 
su sueño es tener una familia y seguir luchando con su negocio y al encontrar una oportunidad de trabajo en su carrera trabajar y ahorrar para abrir otro nuevo negocio.
con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio cubre sus gastos personales y sus estudios.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosibel C. L. is single and a saleswoman.  She has a store in which she sells new clothes and purses.  She doesn't have any children and is studying at university.  Blanca is from a determined family.  In the evenings she travels to the university, from which she will be graduating this year in agroindustrial engineering.  Her goal is to grow as a professional.

Blanca has this business thanks to her brother.  He gave her a stall so that she could work and study at the same time, in order to achieve her goals.

She will use her loan to buy merchandise for her business since her customers are asking for fashionable pants.

Her dream is to have a family, to continue working in her business and, when she finds a job in her chosen career, to work and save so that she can open a new business.

Blanca uses the profits which she makes in her business to cover her personal expenses and to pay for her studies.

loans.use: To buy shirts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, swimsuits, dresses and purses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Paceñas Group

texts.es:
“Las Paceñas” es el nombre que adoptaron un grupo de ocho mujeres, que quisieron conformar un banco comunal y formar parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Este grupo está  iniciando su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, ahora les corresponde conocerse no sólo como amigas y vecinas de barrio, sino también como garantes responsables. 

Los negocios que llevan adelante son: macramé de mantas, venta de pollo a la broster, verduras, tejido de chompas, venta de repuestos de minibús, tejido  de chompas, macramé de mantas, venta de golosinas, comida, hilado de lana de vicuña, taller de costura de polleras, macramé de mantas y atención de tienda de barrio.

 La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Silvia  es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, al momento es madre de un solo bebé, ingresó a la Banca Comunal, debido a la invitación de unas amigas.  Su negocio es la venta de repuestos de minibús.  Este negocio fue aprendido gradualmente de unos familiares, hace cuatro años. Las ventas son realizadas en su domicilio, todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 y media de la tarde. Debido a la exigencia del horario de atención, recibe la ayuda de su mamá.
texts.en:
“Las Paceñas” [The Women from La Paz] is the name adopted by a group of eight women who wanted to form a communal bank as part of the Cascada regional hub of Pro Mujer. This group is beginning its first loan cycle. They know each other not just as friends and neighbors, but also as responsible guarantors for the loan.

The businesses being run by the group are: macrame blankets (2), sale of broasted chicken, sale of vegetables, sewing of sweaters (2), minibus parts, sale of chickens, food sales, vicuña milk ice cream, skirt-making workshop, and a general store.

Silvia, president of the group, is a young woman of 24 and the mother of one. Her friends invited her into the group. Her business is the sale of parts for mini buses. She learned this business four years ago from some of her relatives. She operates the business from her home every day from 7:00 in the morning until 6:30 in the afternoon. Because of the long hours required, she gets help from her mother.

loans.use: Purchase mini bus parts for sale.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La Sra. Andrea vive en el barrio D. alto Tacagua, esta casada con el señor Natalio D. profesión maestro que actualmente dicta clases en el área rural en la provincia Pacajes Cuentan con tres hijos dos D. ellos son independientes el menor D. 18 años D. edad esta a su cargo ya que esta estudiando en la universidad. Doña Andrea se dedica a la confección D. mandiles desD. hace cinco años los cuales lo comercializa en la av. Tiahuanaco como vendedora ambulante además D. que cuenta con un puesto en la 16 D. julio en el cual venD. material D. ferretería  los días jueves y domingo el dinero del crédito es para comprar material D. ferretería al por mayor para poder comercializar en su puesto D. venta.
texts.en: Andrea lives in Alto Tacagua neighborhood.  She is married to Natalio who is a teacher.  He currently gives classes in the rural area of Pacajes province.  The couple have three children.  Two of their children are independent and the youngest, who is 18, is still in their care because he is studying at university.  For five years Andrea has been making aprons which she sells in Tiahuanaco Avenue as a street trader.  She also has a stall in the 16 D. Julio market where she sells hardware (ironmongery) on Thursdays and Sundays.  She will use her loan to buy hardware products wholesale so that she can sell them on her stall.

loans.use: To buy fabric and also merchandise for her second business activity

loans.name: Xiomara Deyanira

texts.es: Xiomara Deyanira tiene 30 años, está felizmente casada. El matrimonio tiene 1 hijo, tiene muchas energías para mantener este negocio activo que todos los días es visitado por una gran variedad de clientes ya que su negocio está en su vivienda y de manera ambulante. Se inicio con la venta de mercaderías varias como bolsos, calzado y perfumes. Pues poco a poco fue que invirtió el dinero y sacando mayor utilidad del mismo. 	Xiomara solicita el crédito para comprar de más mercaderías, ya que tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos de ropa por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña. Como sueño personal quiere seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Xiomara Deyanira is 30 years old and is happily married. The couple has one son.  She has a lot of energy for keeping this active business that is visited daily by a variety of clients.  The business is in her home and she also sells on the streets. She began by selling various merchandise such as handbags, shoes and perfumes. Then little by little she invested the money, making better use of it. Xiomara is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, as she has a lot of clothing orders as the holiday season approaches. As a personal dream, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su querido pueblo de Santa Rosa, Victoria ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida aprendiendo la agricultura, actividad que práctica su familia. Hoy siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her two dependent children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  In her beloved town of Santa Rosa, Victoria has spent most of her life learning how to farm, an activity which her family is engaged in.  Today she grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf which has provided her with the income she needs to support her family.  She sells her harvests in the town of San Francisco which is where she obtains the best prices for her products.

What Victoria most likes about her work is sowing her fields and she does this with great care.  She has been in this business for 30 years and considers that the most difficult thing about it is transporting her products since transport is very scarce in her area.  Over time, she would like to buy new land in order to increase her production.

This is Victoria's second loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments up to now and hopes to continue being so.  She is a very active member of her community bank and is very well liked by the rest of the members.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Miriam Janneth

texts.es:
La Señora Miriam M. es socia del banco comunal Dinastía Espoir, vive en la ciudadela  los Eucaliptos en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, es muy rica en su cultura y tradiciones y su gente es amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arendando.

Doña Miriam es comerciante de bisutería, actividad que viene realizando hace 12 años, su mercadería la vende ambulantemente por toda la ciudad, labora casi todos los días ya que solo descansa los días martes, pero ese día se dedica a trabajar como estilista en su propia casa esta, actividad la realiza hace 2 años ya que tiene un titulo de maestra de belleza. Por la temporada navideña ella vende peluches metidos en globos y esto le deja algo mas de ganancias.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza  en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como perfumes,anillos, aretes y peluches.  Su meta es  tener un  local propio para tener ahí  sus dos negocios a la vez.
texts.en:
Miriam M. is a member of the communal bank Dinastía Espoir; she lives in the Eucaliptos neighborhood in the city of Cuenca which is known for the beauty of its historic center, its diverse cuisine, the richness of its cultural traditions, and for its kind and friendly people.  

Miriam is 29 years old; she is married and has two children aged 12 and 6. Her elder son is studying in middle school; her younger daughter is in primary school.  Her husband is a merchant; they do not have a house of their own, so they are renting.

Miriam has been in the business of selling costume jewelry for over twelve years. She works as a street vendor, selling her inventory all around the city almost everyday, with the exception of Tuesday. Miriam is also a licensed beautician, and on Tuesdays she works as a stylist at home -- something that she has been doing for two years. During the Christmas season, she sells stuffed toys which provides her with some additional income.

This is Miriam's second loan with the communal bank, and she plans to invest it into the purchase of additional inventory such as perfume, rings, earrings, and stuffed toys. Her goal is to have her own store so that she could run all her businesses in one place.

loans.use: Purchase of perfume, rings, earrings, and stuffed toys.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es la Sr. Rosendo; el tiene 58 años de edad, soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cereales como lentejas, maíz, entre otros. El socio viaja hasta la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a distribuir su mercadería a sus clientes, el permanece por allá de dos a tres días. 

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio y asi poder distribuir a todos sus clientes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” [Let’s Go Together] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

Rosendo is 58 years old and single. His daily activities alternate between the buying and selling of lentils, corn, and other cereal grains. He travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado to distribute to his clients and may stay there for two to three days.

Rosendo is seeking a loan to purchase more grains to sell to his clients. He is grateful to all those who make this dream possible and promises to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Purchase cereal grains to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Lourdes

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 54 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. Vive en una casa de caña que cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básico ubicada en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra. 

Hace 4 años comenzó a trabajar con algunos ahorros compro papelería y ubico su negocio en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad tiene su negocio con papelería, cuadernos los vende a $ 1.10 c/u, plumas a $ 0.30 c/u etc. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos para surtir más su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa de cemento y hacer más grande su negocio para poder asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 54, has a small stationery shop. She lives in a cane house that has the basic services of water and electricity. Her house is located in the peri-urban zone of El Fortín de Guayaquil, characterized by its dirt streets.

Four years ago, Elizabeth used some savings to buy stationery and set up her store in the back of her house. Today, she also sells notebooks for $1.10 each, pens for $.30 each, etc. She works from 9:00 AM until 11:00PM every day. 

With this loan, Elizabeth will buy stationery, notebooks and “fomix” (foam crafts) to stock the store. In the future, she would like to finish her house in cement and enlarge the business to provide security for her old age.

loans.use: Buy stationary, notebooks, and foam crafts for store.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, es comerciante de cerdos y también posee una tienda, ella vive con su esposo y 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ellos, el negocio se origino por la ayuda de su familia, no tiene un horario fijo para atender a los clientes y tiene experiencia en el negocio, ellos residen en San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel, por el momento ella está pensando en comprar cerdos para el engorde y comercializarlos posteriormente, por eso solicita un préstamo para ayudar a crecer con el negocio y que pueda tener más oportunidades para recibir dinero o ganancias.

Su propósito es administrar bien los fondos del préstamo con la esperanza que hará un buen negocio y recibirá buenas ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos en lo posible para que estos estén satisfechos.
texts.en:
Dinora has a pig business, and she also has a store.  She lives with her husband and their three dependent children.  The business started with help from her family.  She does not have a fixed schedule for waiting on her customers.  She has experience in the business.  They live in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel.

At the moment she is planning to buy pigs to fatten and later sell.  That is why she is requesting a loan to help her business grow.  She also wants to be able to have more income opportunities.

Her intention is to do a good job of managing the funds from the loan .  She will do this with the hope of making a good business and receiving good income.  This is to support her children as much as possible so that their needs are met.

loans.use: To buy pigs to fatten

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Eunice Del Milagro

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eunice; ella tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pinturas como acuarelas,temperas entre otros ella lo vende en forma ambulatoria y la vez ella apoya con los estudios a su hermano.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para los estudios de su hermano.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eunice belongs to the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Eunice is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling paints like water colors and tempura, among others.  She sells them in an itinerant manner.  At the same time she supports her brothers’ education.

She is requesting the loan for her brothers’ education.

She is grateful to those who are helping fulfill this dream, and she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: For her brother's education

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana, de 26 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Keyli de 11 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda de abarrotes de Yobana es una de las más concurridas del poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana), el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrir su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para tener más productos que vender. Este el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas productos para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yobana, age 26, is a very unassuming and happy woman.  She lives in a rented house with her beloved daughter, 11 year old Keyle.  She is the motivation for all of her efforts.

Yobana’s grocery store is one of the most popular in the village of Santa Rosa (in the Ayachuchan jungle).  Her great charisma and the kind way she treats her customers has made her a neighborhood favorite.  Her neighbors do not hesitate to shop, starting very early, at her store.  They know that she is the first to open her business.

What she likes the most about her work is talking with her neighbors.  She has had her store for three years.  The hardest part is having to stay in her store for most of the day without having a lot of time to work her land.

Later on she hopes to expand the premises of her store in order to have more products to sell.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to access another loan with greater ease and without causing problems in her communal bank.  She is well-liked by the other members.

She will use the 500 soles that she requested to buy more products to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Ada Francis

texts.es: Ada Francis tiene 37 años. Su actividad es la elaboración y venta de bloques. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, ya que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda.  Sus Padres eran los que anteriormente se hacían cargo del negocio lo cual ha sido de gran provecho, así lograron enseñarle este medio de vida a su hija, Ada tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. La mayoría de sus productos los vende de contado, la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su negocio por que ofrece sus productos a un precio favorable. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como arena, piedrín, cemento, ladrillos entre otros.
texts.en: Ada Francis is 37 years old.  She has a business making and selling concrete blocks.  She has had this business for more than 10 years.  She has been working with the Fundación for 10 years, and the loans have been a great help to her.  Her parents were previously in charge of this business, which has been a great benefit to her, and so she taught this trade to her daughter.  Ada has 2 dependent children.  She sells most of her products on a cash basis, and most of her customers come to her business because she offers her products at a favorable price.  This loan is to buy raw materials such as sand, stones, cement, bricks, and other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.en:
Honorata has led the borrower group "Mujeres Positivas" for the past three years.  The group chose this name because all 11 female members want to make positive changes in their lives.
 
Honorata is a single mother with two children. The youngest child is 15 and attends high school.  For the past nearly 20 years, Honorata has sold vegetables in the local market.  She chose this work because she saw a need for it and because the market is close to her children's school.  She plans to use this loan to increase the selection and quality of her vegetables as well as to help pay for her son's tuition.  For the future, Honorata dreams that her children will become professionals and that she will finish building her house.

loans.use: To increase the selection and quality of the vegetables she sells

loans.name: Alex Jhon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es la Sr. Alex; el tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuadros, el socio es pintor él se dedica a la pintura ya hace un par de años y a la vez el compra cuadros de otros artistas y lo vende fuera de cusco. 

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como pinceles, pintura de diferentes colores entre otros.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" communal bank, situated in the district of Cuzco, forming part of the province of Cuzco and the department of Cuzco.

The partner, Alex, is 38 years old.  He has a live-in partner and two children.  Work for Alex varies every day with his business selling paintings.  He is a painter and has worked at painting for a few years, and at the same time he purchases paintings by other artists and sells them outside Cuzco.

Alex is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials such as paintbrushes and paints in various colours, among other things.

He thanks all those who take part in his dream by this means, and promises to carry out the repayment of his instalments by the deadline set out.

loans.use: The purchase of materials such as paintbrushes and paint in various colours, among other things.

loans.name: Jacquelin

texts.es: La Sra. Jacquelin  de edad de 24 años oriunda del departamento Cochabamba cercado ,vive en el municipio del torno localidad , Santa Rita . Su actividad es la venta de hamburguesas en la zona Localidad de el  torno  cuenta con su negocio desde hace seis años, Su estado civil soltera y no cuenta con ningún hijo por el momento, el destino del crédito  es para la compra de un horno y aumentar capital de trabajo en su negocio,  la Sra. Jacquelin esta muy agradecida con emprender por haber depositado una confianza hacia su persona  gracias a los créditos que nuestra institución le ha otorgado ahora es una joven comerciante emprendedora con muchas ganas de superación.
texts.en:
Jacquelin, who is 24 years old and a native of Cochabamba department and its capital, lives in the  municipality of Santa Rita.  She sells hamburgers in El Torno.  Jacquelin has been able to count on her business for about 6 years.  She is single and has no children as yet.

The loan is to buy an oven and increase her business's working capital.  Jacquelin is very grateful for the confidence that Emprender has in her.  Thanks to the loans our Institution has made available, Jacquelin is now a young enterprising merchant with a great desire to advance.

loans.use: TO BUY AN OVEN FOR HER HAMBURGER STAND

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio se dedica a la venta de medicina, vive con su padre y un hermano residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, es soltero y el negocio lo inicio hace un año por influencia de amigos, no tiene horario fijo y tiene ya una buena cartera de clientes, pero Sergio aprovechado que tiene buenos clientes quiere invertir en el negocio para siempre tener medicina a disponibilidad y de esta manera retener a los clientes, él solicita un préstamo para la compra de esta medicina ya que quiere incrementar su negocio y visitar a nuevos lugares en busca de nuevo clientes.

El sueña con convertirse en un vendedor mayorista, contar con buenos ingresos,  ayudar a su padre para el sostén de la casa y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Sergio sells medicines. He is single and lives with his father and a brother in San Rafael Oriente, Department of San Miguel. Sergio started his business a year ago after being influenced by his friends. He does not work on a fixed schedule and has a good customer base. Sergio takes advantage of his good customers in order to invest in his business so that he will always have medicine in stock. This allows him to retain his customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy medicines. Sergio wants to expand his business and visit new places in search of new customers. His dreams are to become a wholesale vendor, earn better income, help his father with maintaining their home, and keep progressing.

loans.use: Purchase medicines

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Aurora de 31 años, ella elabora bisutería con materia prima básica. Vive con sus tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Ella aprendió hacer aretes, cadenas, pulseras con utensilios que compra en una distribuidora de artículos y accesorios. Ha tenido una buena acogida con la bisutería que ella hace ya que es muy innovadora y hace nuevos modelos de revistas. Trabaja desde las mañana hasta la tarde recorriendo las cosas de su conocidos y vecinos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cadenas, aretes, accesorios como plásticos, metales para producir a un mayor volumen su bisutería. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender su bisutería y que sus hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Aurora, age 31, sells trinkets made of basic materials. She lives with her three children in an urban area called Suburbio de Guayaquil where most of the residents are merchants.

Aurora learned how to make earrings, necklaces, and bracelets with tools she purchased from a merchandise and accessories distributor. The trinkets she makes have been well-received since she is very innovative and creates new models found in magazines. Aurora works in the mornings and leaves in the afternoons to show her products to acquaintances and neighbors. With his loan she wants to buy chains, earrings, and accessories such as plastics and metals to produce a large volume of trinkets.

In the future, Aurora wants to have a store where she can sell her trinkets and see her children finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: Purchase chains, earrings, and accessories

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: Zacarías, de 49 años, es un hombre muy humilde y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Jhon de 19 y Jonathan de 17, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Zacarías, es la siembra de cacao, café y coca, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos su producción al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará fertilizantes para mejorar su siembra.
texts.en:
Zacarías, age 49, is a humble and hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his two beloved sons, Jhon (age 19) and Jonathan (age 17), for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Zacarías grows cacao, coffee, and coca leaves and sells his harvest in the city of San Francisco where he has several customers. They are aware of the quality of his product and have no hesitation to buy his produce in large quantities. What he enjoys most about his work is sowing the land and making it fertile and productive. He has been farming for 24 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from plagues of insects. To move forward, he hopes to continue selling his products. He also wants to buy additional farmland to improve his earnings.

This is his first loan with MFP. Zacarías knows that he must submit his payments on time if he wants to access additional loans in the future. In his Communal Bank, he is a very responsible member who is concerned about the welfare of his group. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy fertilizers to improve his crop.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, de 60 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 66 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano Cristina comienza con la venta de sus deliciosas frutas, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado principal de la ciudad de San Francisco, ella es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva, motivo por el cual tiene muchos clientes, quienes siempre le compran la mayoría de su mercadería. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras de venta, ya que así hace sus días de trabajo. Lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de ventas, en espera de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar su puesto, para poder vender más frutas. Este es el décimo tercer crédito con MFP, está segura que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más frutas para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Cristina, age 60, is a cheerful hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Benjamin, age 66, and what she wants most is to have a peaceful retirement. Every morning, Cristina begins early selling her delicious fruit from a stand located at the main market in the city of San Francisco. She is a very charismatic and persuasive saleswoman, which explains why she has many customers who always buy her merchandise in bulk. What she enjoys most about her job is conversing with the other merchants during the work day. She has been in business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be spending the entire day at her stand waiting on her customers. Over time she hopes to expand her vending post so that she can sell more fruits.

This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. Cristina is confident that this loan will be a great help in developing her business. In her Communal Bank she is very committed toward the development of the other members. The loan of 1500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more fruits to keep her vending post in business.

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
el señor Luis Enrique P. F. esta casado con la señora Maria Mejia y viven en el barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome, Luis se dedica al comercio cuenta con un negocio de pulperia desde ya hace 3 años,  su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
Luis es una persona muy trabajadora y es muy dedicado a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia e invertirlo en su negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Enrique P. F. is married to Sra. Maria Mejia and they live in the Suyapa neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. Luis has a store that he has managed for three years out of his home. He is a hardworking person who is dedicated to his family.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise and invest in his business so that he can increase his sales and his income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Josue Adan

texts.es: EL Sr Josué, Vive en casa en alquiler junto con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar el es dueño de un microbús y de un derecho de línea, el esta trabajando con esmero para poder darles una casa propia a su familia ya que el dice que son la razón de su existir. El dinero que solicita es para pagar la mano de obra de la  Chapería de su micro para poderlo trabajar tranquilamente, es una persona trabajadora, tranquilo, responsable y dedicado a su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Josué lives in a rental property with his wife and two school age children. He owns a minibus and the rights to a travel route. Josué has been working carefully to provide a home for his family, who are the reason for his existence.

The money he is requesting will be used to pay for body work to his minibus so that it can operate quietly. Josué is a hardworking, peaceful, and responsible person who is dedicated to his family. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Pay for body work to his minibus

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Natividad; ella tiene 28 años de edad, separada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pinturas como acuarelas,temperas entre otros ella lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes. La socia es una mujer muy emprendedora siendo este el único medio para salir adelante.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más pinturas para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Natividad is a member of the Communal Bank “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. Natividad divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling paints, such as watercolors and tempera, as a street vendor. She works every day in the mornings and in the afternoons. Natividad is an enterprising woman since this is her only means of getting ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more paints for her business.

Natividad is grateful to everyone who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase paints to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 45 años, es una mujer muy afectuosa,  vive en un departamento alquilado, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. El negocio al que Ana se dedica, es la venta de zapatos y carteras que son traídas del Trujillo, ciudad que se encuentra al norte del país. Sus clientes son integrantes de su congregación cristiana donde asiste ella, quienes  gustan y conocen de la calidad de calzados y no dudan en comprarle, ya que les deja a crédito. Le gusta su trabajo y más por que el producto que vende tiene garantía y eso le da mayor rentabilidad. Por esta razón deja su mercadería a crédito, de esa manera gana ya que los créditos que recibe recupera la inversión. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad, a pesar de sus dificultades que tiene para viajar a Trujillo, pero no le importa, sabe que con mucho empeño podrá comprase su departamento, y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas. Es su 11avo  crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como de costumbre. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más zapatos y carteras, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, age 45, is a very loving woman who lives in a rented apartment with her husband and two daughters. She has a business selling shoes and purses that are brought in from Trujillo, a city that lies in the northern part of the country. Her customers are members of a Christian church that she attends. They are familiar with and enjoy the quality of the shoes that she sells and do not hesitate buying them on credit. Ana enjoys her work because her products are guaranteed to sell and generate a good profit. Since she extends credit for her merchandise, she needs the loans while she recoups her investment. Ana has been in business for 15 years. Despite the difficulties associated with traveling to Trujillo, she does not mind because she knows that with more effort she will be able to buy her apartment and provide a better quality of life for her daughters.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Ana promises to submit all of her payments on time like she usually does. The loan she requested will be used to buy shoes and purses so that she can fulfill the outstanding orders of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase shoes & purses to fulfill her orders

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es: El Sr Juvenal es dueño de casa que vive por la zona de la villa primero de mayo,  también es dueño de un micro y un derecho en la línea el cual es su fuente de trabajo, con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, actividad a la que se dedica ya hace 10 años, El Sr Juvenal junto con su esposa tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos esta en la universidad y la otra ya es madre de familia, ya formo su propio hogar. El crédito será utilizado para el pintado de su microbús ya que esta un poco raspado y desgastado, es una persona responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Juvenal is a homeowner in the May 1st District. He also owns a minibus and the rights to a travel route, which provide him with a source of work. This activity enables him to support his family and he has been doing this type of work for ten years. Sr. Juvenal and his wife have two children, one of whom is at the university while the other is a mother with her own household.

This loan will be used to paint his minibus since it is a little scratched and worn. Juvenal is a responsible and hardworking person who always thinks about the welfare of his family. He is very grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Paint his minibus

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, tiene 24 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena, departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y un hijo D. 1 año, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos junto a su esposo, este negocio inicia por el apoyo D. sus suegros, no tienen horario D. trabajo, y actualmente no cuentan con fondos para realizar una inversión que tienen planeada, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra D. cerdos que engordara por un tiempo D. 3 meses para luego venderlos; esta inversión le ayudara a crecer con su granja y tener mejores posibilidades D. ganar dinero al momento D. la venta.
Su aspiración es ser una gran comerciante que su negocio le dé estabilidad económica para su familia y poder crecer a su hijo cómodamente.
texts.en:
Claudia is 24 years old and resides in Santa Elena in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and one year old son. Claudia and her husband raise pigs together and started their business with the help of her in-laws. They do not work according to a schedule and currently do not have the funds to invest as planned.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs that they will fatten for three months before selling them. This investment will help grow her farm and proviD. better opportunities to earn money at the time of sale.

Her aspiration is to become a successful businesswoman and proviD. financial stability for her family so that her son can grow up comfortably.

loans.use: Acquire pigs

loans.name: Edison Efren

texts.es:
Edison de 19 años, tiene una tienda en donde vende accesorios de plásticos. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Con motivación de la mama y al verla que trabajaba muy duro para poder mantener la casa el decidió comenzar a vender vasos, cucharas y fundas plásticas a sus conocidos poco a poco y a pesar de su corta edad pudo tener un local con artículos plásticos. En la actualidad le hacen pedidos a Edison empresas para que les envíen los plásticos a un volumen más o menos alto. Vende fundas, vasos, platos, cucharas plásticas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar utensilios plásticos, vasos, platos, cucharas para mejorar las ventas y así sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere comenzar a estudiar en la universidad contabilidad.
texts.en:
Edison, 19 years old, has a store where he sells plastic goods.  He lives in a peri-urban zone with all of the basic services.  This location on the perimeter of Guayaquil is surrounded by a marsh.  

With encouragement from his mother, and having watched her work very hard to keep their house, he decided to begin selling plastic cups, spoons and bowls to his acquaintances. Little by little, and in spite of his young age, he was able to obtain a store with plastic items.  Currently, businesses submit requests to Edison to deliver fairly large volumes of plastic goods.  He sells plastic bowls, cups, plates and spoons.

With the loan he wants to buy plastic utensils, cups, plates and spoons to improve his sales and give his customers more variety.  In the future he would like to begin studying accounting at the university.

loans.use: Plates, Bowls, Cups

loans.name: Las Daliass Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Daliass, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de puebla. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. 

Agustina G.G es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 29 años, estudió hasta 6to de primaria  es comerciante en venta de trastes, tiene en total 5 hijos.  Ella vende trastes que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para compra de trastes .Sus clientes el público en general.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir.   Quiere este crédito para invertir en más trastes como ollas y platos que le solicitan mucho. También espera con este préstamo obtener más clientes y así poder tener a futuro un local bien surtido.
texts.en:
The 9-member Dahlias Group lives in the state of Puebla. Agustina G. G is the president of the group. She is 29 years old, has a 6th grade education, and earns her living selling cooking utensils. She has five children. 

Agustina started her business five years ago. She is seeking a loan to buy more cooking utensils to sell to her customers.

Right now she feels very enthusiastic and eager to get ahead in life. She will use the loan to buy items like saucepans and plates which are much in demand. She hopes that a well-stocked store will attract more customers.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Lidia solo pudo estudiar la primaria.  Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio, lo cual consiste en el engorde de ganado vacuno.
Lidia solicitará un nuevo monto S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar más ganado vacuno.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Village Bank "Brisas de Rio Blanco" which is located in the district of Pilcuyo, El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 34, married and has 4 children. 

Lidia was only able to complete primary school.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevo soles.  She used this money to increase the capital of her business, by fattening up her cattle.  

Lidia is asking for a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevo soles.  This money will allow her to buy more cattle. Her dream is to move forward with her business and to have a grocery store. 

What she likes about the Village Bank is sharing with the other members.

loans.use: Buy Cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Esther; La socia tiene 58 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de desayunos y verduras desde hace 10 años; la socia desea comprar insumos para elaborar desayunos ella vende quinua con leche y manzana en las madrugadas, después de acabar sus desayunos va al mercado y vende sus verduras, la socia desea comprar insumos para elaborar sus desayunos y una parte invertir en la compra de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y en la compra de verduras.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LOS DIAMANTES" communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Ms. Esther is 58 years old, single and has a son.  For ten years she have been active in selling breakfast food and vegetables. She wishes to invest in raw materials to prepare breakfasts.  She sells quinoa with milk and apples in the early mornings, and then goes to the market to buy vegetables.  She plans to use part of the loan to buy the necessary products for her breakfast business and the rest to buy vegetables.

This member appreciates and values the loan given through this network and commits to paying it back in the established time.

loans.use: To buy breakfast products and vegetables.

loans.name: Mayela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Máyela de 34 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la  crianza de cerdos y también administra una tienda, ella vive con sus hijos es madre soltera y tiene 7 hijos de 15, 12, 11, 9, 8, 6 y 5 años de edad, todos dependen de sus ingresos, el negocio inicio con la ayuda de su madre, trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos, no tiene horario para realizar el trabajo pero cuenta con experiencia. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y además mercadería para la tienda, con esta inversión ella quiere mejorar la condición de su negocio y proveer a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar, así también con los cerdos ella quiere alimentarlos bien y que al momento de la venta se los compren a buen precio.
Su principal propósito es realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo para recibir ingresos que le ayuden a solventar las necesidades del hogar y de esta manera darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Máyela is 34 yeas old and resides in San Rafael Orient in the department of San Miguel.  She raises pigs and also runs a store.  She is a single mother living with her seven children ages 15, 12, 11, 9, 8, 6 and 5, who all depend on her income.  The business was set up with her mother's help and her children lend a hand at work too.  She has no specific working hours, but has a lot of experience.

She requests a loan to buy pigs and goods for the store.  With this investment she hopes to improve her business and provide her customers with a range of household items.  She also wants to feed her pigs properly to be able to sell them at the best price.

Her main goal for the loan is to be able to invest in goods that will help pay for household needs so she can provide the best care for her children.

loans.use: To buy pigs and store merchandise

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
