Este proyecto ha sido muy importante porque le ha ayudado a afianzar sus conocimientos con la practica. Le gustaria tener su propio negocio relacionado con la agricultura. Desea culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis, 19, is a second year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Condega.  The reason why he's studying this subject is that his family works in agriculture and he enjoys working in the fields very much.  His family supports him in his career.  His father is a tobacco farmer and during vacation periods he helps him a lot.

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: to grow cabbage.

This project has been very important because it helps him connect theory to practice.  He'd like to have a business of his own related to agriculture.  He wants to finish his studies.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Farming.

loans.name: Jose Marlon

texts.es:
Jose Marlon tiene 36 años de edad , es soltero y no tiene hijos a  su cargo , vive en casa de su hermana en el caserio La Clake una zona rural que cuenta con una población reducida, cuentan con energía eléctrica y el agua la extraen de un pozo tubular. La principal actividad económica de la zona es la agricultura y ganadería. Pertenece al distrito de Reque y se encuentra situado aproximadamente a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo .

José se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el trabaja como obrero en los campos de cultivo ubicados cerca a la zona en donde reside, adicionalmente cuenta con dos vacas de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen diariamente.

José se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de  500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de herramientas agrícolas para realizar de mejor manera su labor y aves de corral , como gallinas ponedoras o patos para engorde , las cuales planea criar para empezar a comercializarlas, para ello cuenta con un ambiente bastante adecuado dentro de su vivienda.

José es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y respetuoso.
texts.en:
José  Marlon is 36, single, with no children. He lives with his sister in the village of La Clake, a rural area with a small population, electricity, and water from an irrigation well.  The main economic activity of the people is farming and cattle raising.  La Clake belongs to Reque district and is located about a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José has worked for more than ten years in farming as a farmhand in the fields near the area where he lives.  He also has two cows that give milk every day that he is able to sell.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 new sols that he plans to use to buy agricultural equipment to help improve his farmwork and to purchase poultry, such as laying hens or ducks to fatten.  He plans to raise and begin to sell them and he needs a good area for them to live inside his homestead.

José is a responsible person with desires to get ahead and he is considered friendly and respectful by the people who know him.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment so that he can work more efficiently as a farmhand

loans.name: Ernesto Eliuth

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 21 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli.
Recibe ayuda economica de un hermano que vive en los Estados Unidos, le gusta mucho la carrera y cree poder tener oportunidades.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 21, is a fourth year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Esteli.

His brother, who lives in the United States, sends him economic help.  He likes his career very much and believes it can offer him opportunities.

He negotiated this loan to invest in supplies for a university project: dairy products production.

He wants to finish his studies, work for a firm for a time and then become independent in his own business.

loans.use: AgroBusiness Student Project: Elaboration of Dairy Products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is thirty-two years old.  He lives in the village of Lagunas in the district of Morrope in northern Peru.  He is married and lives along with his wife and their three minor children.  They own the home in which they live.

The family has two main sources of income: Marcelino works in the fields and as a farm hand, assisting in the planting, weeding, maintenance or harvesting of crops, and his wife raises animals in the yard behind their home.  Marcelino is a well-respected laborer and has good contacts in order to maintain consistent work.  He and his wife are also very knowledgable in the proper raising of animals.  Between these two activities, they are able to maintain a relatively stable income stream.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional animals and feed. The family raises chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, goats, and pigs.  They want to expand their herd and improve the animals' growth rate in order to take advantage of holiday season prices.

This will be Marcelino’s first experience with a financial institution.  He appreciates the opportunity to obtain credit at a lower interest rate from Edpyme Alternativa as a result of the funding from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed.

loans.name: Yasser Ramon

texts.es:
Yasser tiene 24 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en San Rafael del Norte, su familia posee tierras, es por esp que decidio estudiar esta carrera, para poder producir en ellas. Sus padres son Agricultures. Tiene una beca de estudios y de alimentacion. 

Ayuda a sus padres en la venta de ropa y en las actividades Agricolas.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Produccion de Productos Lacteos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Yasser, 24, is a fourth year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in San Rafael del Norte.  His family owns farmlands and that's why he decided to study this career, to farm them.  His parents are farmers.  He has a scholarship for tuition and food.

He helps his parents selling clothes and with the farming chores.

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: to produce dairy products.

He wants to finish his studies, work for a firm for a time and then become independent with his own business.

loans.use: AgroBusiness Student Project: Production of Dairy Products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Jose Q. P., es una persona muy trabajadora, joven que se dedica a la mecanica,
ES trabajo solo como empleado en un taller mecanico donde le percibe ingresos mensuales, esos ingresos no son suficientes para poder sustentarse ni a el ni a su familia, el cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en sus rubro y desea independizarse. superarse y empezar a genre sus propios ingresos para ello necesita capital, pues ya cuenta con clentes propios que confian sus vehiculos solo a Juan Jose,

Por esta razon el Sr. juan Jose desea ser un gran mecanico pero necesita empezar a montar sus propio taller. Es asi que se apersono solicitando un credito que le ayude a surgir y poder dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Jose Q. P. is a very hard-working young man who works as a mechanic.

He works as an employee in a mechanics shop where he makes a monthly income.  His income is not enough to be able to support either himself or his family.  He has 2 years' experience in his line of work and wants to become independent, better himself and begin to make his own income.  For this he needs capital.  He already has customers of his own who will only trust their vehicles to Juan Jose.

Juan Jose would like to be a great mechanic but needs to begin to set up his own mechanics shop.  This is why he has come to request a loan to help him move forward and be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy tools for a mechanics workshop

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo is thirty-eight years old.  He lives in the village of Cruz del Mediano in the district of Morrope.  It is a rural district in northern Peru, which is primarily populated by small farmers and individuals who raise animals.  Segundo owns the home in which his family lives.  He lives along with his wife and their three dependent children.

Segundo and his family raise animals in the yard behind their home.  They raise pigs, chickens, ducks and turkeys.  Once these animals reach the appropriate size, they sell them in the major market of the city of Chiclayo called the Moshoqueque market.  They generally visit the market every fifteen days in order to maintain a consistent level of income and reduce the risk of price fluctuations.  Additionally, Segundo works as a hired hand on local farms.  He completes planting, maintenance and harvesting of various crops.

The loan will be used to purchase additional feed for the animals and to expand the herd.  The family has found that the business has the opportunity for growth and they hope to be able to take advantage of the holiday season price increases for their sales.  They are a proud and dedicated family.  Segundo is well known as a hardworking individual who is very dedicated to the improvement of his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the animals and to expand the herd.

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Ocotal. Su Mamá le ayuda con sus clases, ella es contadora en una empresa, pero lo ayuda con mucho sacrificio. Siempre le ha gustado el trabajo en la Agricultura y Ganaderia.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Produccion de Productos Lacteos. Esto nos ayudara a adquirir experiencia en nuestra carrera, y cuando terminemos sepamos poner en practica nuestros conocimientos y experiencias.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Luis, 25, is a fourth year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Ocotal.  His mother helps him with his classes.  She's an accountant at a firm but she helps him with much sacrifice.  He has always enjoyed working in agriculture and cattle raising.

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: dairy products production. This helps us acquire experience in our careers so that when we finish school we can put what we've learned and experienced into practice. 

He wants to finish his studies, work for a firm for a while and then become independent in his own business.

loans.use: AgroBusiness Student Project: Dairy Products Production.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Axel Rafael

texts.es:
Axel tiene 19 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli, le gusta mucho esta carrera, sus padres tienen una finca, y sobre todo la ganaderia.

Recibe ayuda de sus padres.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Quiere Coronar su carrera y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Axel, 19, is a fourth year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Esteli.  He enjoys this career very much, especially cattle raising.  His parents have a farm.

He gets help from his parents.

He negotiated this loan to invest in supplies for a university project: dairy products production.

He wants to complete his studies and then become independent in a business of his own.

loans.use: AgroBusiness Student Project: Dairy Products Production.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Noe Arnulfo

texts.es:
Noe tiene 20 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli, decidio estudiar esta carrera porque casi nadie estudia este tipo de carrera, y tiene mayor demanda en este pais y sobre todo le gusta mucho. Recibe ayuda de sus padres.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Este credito es muy importante, porque nos enseña a saber invertir y poder administrar su propio negocio.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Noe is 20 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering.  He lives in Esteli.  He decided to study this career because very few people study for this type of career.  There is a great demand for it in his country.  Above all, he likes it a lot.  He gets help from his parents.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.

He wants to finish his career education, work for a time for a company, and then become independent with his own business.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project of making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Medalit

texts.en:
Rosa lives in the village of Trance Fanupe in the district of Morrope.  It is a rural region in northern Peru near the city of Chiclayo.  She is twenty-one years old.  She is a single mother and has one daughter.  She shares her home with her parents and child.

In the rear part of her family’s home, Rosa raises animals.  She has a small herd of pigs, ducks, and turkeys which she raises for meat.  She sells the animals once the reach the appropriate size in the major market of Moshoqueque which is in the city of Chiclayo.  In addition, Rosa will at times works as a farm hard, assisting it the planting, maintenance and harvest of crops on local farms.

This will be Rosa’s second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She has good credit history and good references from the community.  She plans to use the loan in order to purchase additional feed for her animals and expand her herd.  She hopes to be able to increase the household income and provide for the education of her daughter.  She is a dedicated mother and proud entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals and expand her herd.

loans.name: Daybi

texts.es:
Dayvi tiene 21 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Condega, recibe actualmente ayuda de sus padres para costear los estudios. Es tambien Maestro de Musica.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos. Es muy importante este credito, porque uno aprende mas y se puede profesionalizar en su carrera.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego formar su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Dayvi is 21 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Condega.  His parents help him pay for his education.  He is also a music teacher.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.   This loan is very important because one learns more and is able to become a professional in their chosen field.

He wants to finish his career education, work for a time for a company, and then form his own company.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nohemy Cristina

texts.es:
Nohemy tiene 19 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Santa Cruz, decidio estudiar esta carrera con el apoyo de su familia.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa por algún tiempo y luego independizarse en su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Nohemy is 19 years old.  She is in her fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. She lives in Santa Cruz.  She decided to study this career with help from her parents.

She used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.   

She wants to finish her career education, work for a time for a company, and then become independent with her own business.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Srun Prach's Group

texts.en:
These five people make up a group loan located in Prey Ta Pong village in Takeo province. Each of them will use their portion of the loan in a way that can improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Srun P., who is 46 years old, is the group leader selected by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sray Chhorn, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a cow middleman. 

Since her husband’s business is going well at this time, she would like to expand this business, so she is seeking a loan to add more money to buy a cow for resale. 

This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the others are students.

loans.use: To buy a cow to resell

loans.name: María Otilia

texts.en:
Maria is forty-eight years old.  She lives in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa in La Victoria.  La Victoria is one of the poorer sections of the city of Chiclayo.  It is primarily populated by laborers and individuals who participate in small commercial activities.  Maria shares her home with her husband.  They have no dependent children.

Maria sells vegetables in the major market of Moshoqueque in the northern sector of the city of Chiclayo.  She manages a small stand and sells on a daily basis.  She finds that her business has the opportunity to grow and has therefore requested this loan.  She plans to invest the proceeds in expanding her inventory and her selection.  She hopes that the action will improve her income and market share.

Maria has very good references and an excellent credit history.  She is proud of her business and her ability to earn income.  She works arduously on a daily basis to better her lifestyle and that of her family.

loans.use: Expanding her inventory and her selection.

loans.name: Jimmy Reynaldo

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 22 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli. Actualmente recibe ayuda de sus padres para pagar sus estudios

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Este proyecto es muy importante porque nos ayuda a aprender mas y desarrollar habilidades.

Quiere terminar su carrera y comenzar a trabajar.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 22 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Esteli.  His parents help him pay for his studies.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.   

This project is very important because it helps students to learn more and develop skills.

He wants to finish his career education and start working.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma Janet

texts.es:
Irma tiene 26 años de edad y reside en el caserío La Pilca del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayos.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella realiza sus ventas por pedidos, a más pedidos realizados logra obtener mayores ganancias, por ello siempre trata de brindar lo mejor de si y busca nuevos clientes, los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Irma desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo productos por su cuenta para contar con un stock permanente que le permita satisfacer la demanda que posee de mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Irma es una mujer bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Irma is 26 years old.  She lives in the town of La Pilca, in Olmos district, a farming area in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Irma sells beauty products from a catalog.  She makes her sales through orders.  The more orders she receives, the more profits she makes.  For this reason, she always tries her hardest and is always looking for new customers.  The income that she makes from these activities helps her to cover her personal expenses and helps her support her family financially.

Irma would like to expand her business, acquiring products so that she can have a permanent stock which will allow her to better satisfy the demand which she has.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Irma is quite a responsible woman who has a great desire to get ahead.  People who know her consider her to be a calm and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to expand her catalog sales business

loans.name: Jorvin Antonio

texts.es:
Jorvin tiene 21 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Palacaguina, Quiso estudiar esta carrera, porque siempre le atrajo y le llama la atencion concer mas acerca de los clutivos que se cosechan en la Region.

Tambien dice tener mucho interes en mejorar a la sociedad del campo productivo.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar la Alacaldia.
texts.en:
Jorvin is 21 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Palacaguina.  He wanted to study for this career because it has always attracted him.  He wants to know more about the crops that are grown in the region.

He also is very interested in improving the farming community.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.   

He wants to finish his career education and work for the city.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon S., 31, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker, typically making $3 per day, while her husband sells salt and earns about $4 a day. This couple has no children yet and would like to take out a loan of $400 to purchase more salt for resale.

loans.use: Buy salt to resell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 69 años D. edad. Es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el sector La Aviación del distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola D. movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. veinte años a la crianza D. ovejas. Ella los cría a campo abierto, en un terreno que posee, cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona y eventualmente a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito.

Ella desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda con las cuales pueda mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Jesús es una persona activa y bastante responsable. Siempre gusta D. sentirse activa y apoyar a quienes le necesiten.
texts.en:
Jesús is 69 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband in La Aviación sector of Cayaltí district, a farming area with considerable commercial activity, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús has been raising sheep for more than twenty years.  She raises them in the open field on a plot of land which she owns.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to traders in the area and eventually to the neighbors and residents of her district.

She would like to carry out some improvements on her home in order to improve her quality of life.  For this reason she is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Jesús is an active and quite responsible person.  She always likes to feel active and support those who need it.

loans.use: To improve her house

loans.name: Touch Meas' Group

texts.en:
In Trong Phum village in Takeo province there are thirteen people who make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Touch M., who is 55 years old, is the village bank president selected by the other members. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, one which can improve their family. 

She and her husband, Mr. Keang L., are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a pig breeder. In the rice field, it is time to plant, but she does not have enough money. So Mrs. Touch M. is asking for a loan to support their farming this year. 

She has five children who are all students and also help with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To finance this year's farming

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en: Erlyn Y. is a married woman who lives in Bongainvilla, Barangay Vista alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a motor shop and a vulcanizing business. Her husband Rolly, who is 40 years old, works as a motor mechanic to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 6 and 14 years old. Erlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $370, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, with which she intends to buy equipment for the motor shop and stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her businesses. Erlyn Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anner

texts.es:
Anner tiene 25 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli, le encanta esta carrera. 

Actualmente trabaja en el cultivo de Tabaco, tienen el apoyo de sus padres, su Mama es Maestra y su Papa es Contratista.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Este proyecto es muy importante porque le ayudara a tener mayores conocimientos y practica en su carrera

Quiere terminar su carrera, y seguir trabajando con el cultivo de Tabaco.
texts.en:
Anner is 25 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Esteli.  He really likes this career.

He is currently working with tobacco crops.  His parents help him.  His mother is a teacher, and his father is a contractor.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.  This project is very important because it will help him have more knowledge and practice in his career.

He wants to finish his career education and continue working with tobacco crops.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is sixty-five years old.  He lives in the village of Barrio Libre in the district of Tambogrande.  He shares his home with his wife and their two children.  They have the good fortune to own their home and to have resided there for some time.

Emilio primarily works in agriculture.  He has a small herd of sheep which he raises on property around his home.  He has a small field which is currently planted with rice and vegetables.  Emilio also drives a taxi in the district.  He transports his neighbors and their products to locations as they request.

This will be Emilio’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase supplies for his animals and his crops.  He hopes to be able to improve their production in order to take advantage of the increase in prices during the upcoming holiday season.  Emilio is a proud father.  He hopes to be able to provide his children with good opportunities and education.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his animals and his crops.

loans.name: Leonel Jacob

texts.es:
Leonel tiene 21 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive Esteli, le gusto estudiar esta carrera porque el se crio en el campo y tiene mucha afinidad con el ramo de la agroindustria. Estudia con la ayuda de sus padres, su Mama es Ama de Casa y su Papa es Agricultor.

Actualmente tiene una Beca de la Universidad y en las vacaciones trabaja en la agricultura.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos. Este proyecto ayudara a lleva a cabo los conocimientos adquiridos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, y crear su propio negocio y ser autosostenible.
texts.en:
Leonel is 21 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Esteli.  He likes studying for this career because he was raised in the fields, and he has a great affinity for this branch of the agricultural industry.  His parents help with his education.  His mother is a housewife, and his father is a farmer.

He currently has a grant from the university, and he does farm work during the vacations.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.  This project will help him put his knowledge into practice.

He wants to finish his career education, create his own business, and become self-supporting.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K., 30, lives in the Takeo province and works in a garment factory.  She is married and has two young children living at home to support.  Living in Takeo province, she is able to make about US$ 3 per day, while her husband works in construction, typically making US$ 4 every day.  

Keo K. aims to take out a loan of US$ 1000 for her husband to make a new investment. Since the construction work is not permanent, she wants her husband to have an extra business selling meat balls in front of the garment factory.

loans.use: To start a additional business selling meat balls.

loans.name: Nakilt Ottoniel

texts.es:
Naxilt tiene 24 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive Jalapa. Decidio estudiar esto debido a la expansion agricola y por las necesidades del pais. 

Su hermana vive en los Estados Unidos y le ayuda con los gastos. Posee una beca de la Universidad.

Se dedica a la crianza de Gallinas

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos. Este credito le ayudara ampliar sus conocimientos en la materia de credito y adquisicion de responsabilidades.

Quiere terminar su carrera, y crear su propio negocio para ayudar a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Naxilt is 24 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Jalapa.  He decided to study this career because of the agricultural expansion and the needs of his country.

His sister lives in the United States, and she helps him with the expenses.  He has a grant from the university.

He raises chickens.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.  This loan will increase his knowledge of loans and acquisition responsibilities.  

He wants to finish his career education and create his own business in order to help the community.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en:
Juan is sixty-four years old.  He resides in the village of Santa Elena in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  It is a tropical area with many small fruit plantations and a significant number of individuals who raise cattle or other animals.  Juan maintains a stable home and lives with his wife and their youngest child.

Juan has a number of small businesses.  He owns a small herd of goats, a property which is planted in rice, and he owns a mototaxi (motorized rickshaw) which he rents out.  These three activities provide a relatively stable income and protection against fluctuations in the markets.

This will be Juan’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to maintain his mototaxi and provide feed for his animals.  He hopes to be able to reduce the ongoing expenses of the mototaxi by making significant repairs currently and then ensure that it stays on the road.  He is thankful for the opportunity to access credit at a reduced interest rate as a result of the funding from Kiva.

loans.use: To maintain his mototaxi and provide feed for his animals.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
To make a living, Salma is engaged in fish selling.  She has been in her business for 4 years and earns a monthly net income of 2,500.  Salma G. is 42 years old and is married with 3 adult-aged children.  She is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga.

In 2010, Salma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Salma is requesting her 1st loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish sales business.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 20 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en El Jicaro.

Escogio esta carrear porque tiene la influencia de sus padres, quienes se dedican al cultivo de Frijoles.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos. Es importante para compartir experiencia, ideas, conocimientos... etc.

Quiere terminar su carrera y tambien independizarse.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 20 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Jicaro.  He chose to study this career because of his parents' influence.  They grow beans.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.  It is important to share experiences, ideas, and knowledge…etc.  

He wants to finish his career education and become independent.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena S. is from the village of Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Lucena is the leader of a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Lucena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from thier rice field. Lucena has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Lucena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 140000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and fertilizer for their farm. This will be the third loan taken out by Lucena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice field

loans.name: Mrs. Khoem Sophal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people make up this village bank loan located in Tuol Sang Kha village in Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Khoem S. as the village bank president. She is 31 years old. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Khoem S. owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to provide for her family. Her husband, Mr. TaR. Kung, is a teacher who gets a low salary to help support his family. Since her business is going well at this time, she wants to expand. She is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to resell. 

She is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Danny Isabel

texts.en:
Danny Isabel A. A. is 36 years old. She lives in the village of Bello Horizonte Tejedores in the district of Tambogrande. It is a relatively tropical region with a significant number of small farms. Danny owns her own home and shares it with her husband and their three children. Her husband works as a farm hand for local property owners.

Danny manages a small business selling foods and juices. She sells her products in the nearby town of Tejedores, which is approximately five minutes away. She sells her products on a daily basis to local workers during meal and snack hours. 

This is Danny’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan in order to expand her inventory and improve the service she provides to her customers. She hopes to be able to increase her clientele and increase her income. She is proud to provide for her family and to work independently.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia V. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bagroy, Brgy. Delicioso, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a piggery and a clothing sales business. 

Her husband, Rolando, who is 48 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  

They have four children who are between 13 and 20 years old. 

Lydia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lydia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to buy pig feed and clothes to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for home repairs. Lydia V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To by pig feed and clothes for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis J. M. is 63 years old. He lives in the village of Luchadores Sociales in the district of Tambogrande. It is a tropical area that has many small fruit plantations. Luis owns his home and shares it with his wife and their two children.

Luis has a medium-sized fruit plantation on which he grows mangoes and limes. He tends to his trees on a regular basis and harvests his fruit weekly. He also has a herd of cattle, which he maintains on property near his home.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other supplies to support the growth of his fruit. He hopes to be able to increase production slightly in the near term in order to increase his income and be able to make additional investments.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other supplies to support the growth of his fruit

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn R. is from the village of Bagakay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Bebelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Bebelyn owns and operates a grocery store. Bebelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Bebelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Bebelyn has successfully repaid a loan of 8000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional grocery stocks. This will be the third loan taken by Bebelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma R., a married woman who lives in Sitio Enclaro, Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating two business ventures: a buying and selling (nipa) and a fish-vending business. Her husband Josie, 36, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 1 and 13 years old.

Lerma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to use as additional capital for her nipa and fish businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lerma R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her nipa and fish businesses

loans.name: Floripes

texts.en:
Floripes M., from the village of Guisokan, is 44 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Floripes owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Floripes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting her sixth loan for 14900 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Floripes plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martin, a 53-year-old single man with no children, lives in his own home in the town of Tambogrande in northern Peru. The region is relatively tropical and primarily populated by individuals who grow fruit and raise animals.

For over ten years now, Martin has sold newspapers and magazines. He sells the newspapers in the streets of the cities, providing the populace with easy access to their news and events of the world. He is proud of his work and glad to be able to play a role in the ongoing education of his people. He has a good number of loyal and consistent clients.

This will be Martin’s first credit with our institution. He plans to use the funds to purchase additional merchandise for his shop, since demand has been increasing for magazines and other items. He needs the loan in order to expand his inventory of those items and to meet his clients' requests.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Perla Joy

texts.en:
Perla Joy A., a married woman who lives in Prk. Santol, Brgy. Tugawe, Dauin, Negros Oriental, earns her living by operating two ventures: computer games and general store businesses. Her 44-year-old husband, Benjamin A., works as a security guard to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 5 and 11 years old.

Perla Joy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Perla Joy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 in order to buy stocks for the general store and new gaming machines so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Perla Joy A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase new gaming machines

loans.name: Mong

texts.en: Mong R., 53, is married and resides with his wife and five children in the province of Batambong, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. R. is a construction worker, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of about 3 USD per day. R. has to spend 30 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 5 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R.'s wife appears in the photograph because R. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the province of Takeo. She is a farmer who works for less than one dollar a day. She has one little child. Her husband, pictured here, is a mechanic who fixes motorbikes. On average, he earns $3 per day to help support the family. Since farming is not stable, she would like to take out a loan of $300 to purchase a sewing machine to have a new job as a professional tailor.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena A. is a widow who lives in Prk. Guava, Brgy. Lipayo, Dauin, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a house rental business. Magdalena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired after something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Magdalena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use for maintenance of an additional home to rent so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Magdalena A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: To purchase raw materials for an additional home to rent

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en: Chreng K., 35, is married and resides with his wife and child in the province of Batambong, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. K. and his wife are construction workers, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. K. has to spend 60 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 5 USD on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao N., 36, is married and lives with her husband in the province of Takeo. She and her husband sell fruit at the local market and are able to make about $3 of profit a day. This couple has six children; three are in school and one is working in construction. Mao N. plans to take out a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport fruit and sell around the village. So, after taking out this loan, she will sell fruit at the market and her husband will ride the moto and sell around the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma R. is from the village of Bago. She is 37 years old, married with four school-aged children. Delma owns and operates a food stall and her main source of income is from selling a variety of food products in her local community. Delma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Delma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Delma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Phem S., 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. and her husband sell fish, earning an income of about $US9 per day. S. has to spend $US70 on food, $US10 on electricity and water supplies, and $US44 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of $US1000 to purchase more fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie N. is 48 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, farming, and a ready-to-wear clothes business. She lives in Lumbay, Brgy, Cayhagan, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, farming and her ready-to-wear clothes business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Rosalie is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosalie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You S. is 28 years old and works as a local teacher at Takeo province. He is able to make about US$2 each day, while his wife (shown in the photo), works in the field, growing rice. This couple has two children living at home to support.

Because You S. spends a lot on transportation, he is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth B., 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. B. sells traditional cakes, earning an income of about US$5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about US$2.80 per day. B. has to spend US$50 on food, US$5 on electricity and water supplies, and US$11 on other necessary expenses every month.

B. is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase two cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. B. appears in the photograph while she is preparing sweet potato cakes.

loans.use: To buy two cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Keav Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum K., who is 51 years old, was selected by the fourteen members of this village bank loan to be their president. They are located in Kaev Chamraeun village in Takeo province. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Prum K. is a silk weaver who can earn some money to help support her family. During the wedding season her business goes well, so she wants to expand, but she doesn't have enough money to support the improvements. So for this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. 

Her husband, Mr. Hoeun Kam, is a village chief and he is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Through this activity, they support five children, two of whom are weavers while the others are studying in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma T. is a married woman who lives in Gilside, Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a vegetable-selling business, a rice-selling business, and a general store. Her husband, Erwin T., who is 42 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 12 and 13 years old.

Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 18 prior loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, thereby improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP ($425), which she intends to use to buy vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and her children's education. Elma T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon -- a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to assist the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join the team.

loans.use: To further expand one of her businesses by purchasing additional vegetables

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline D. is a 36-year-old woman from the village of Pangalalan. Madeline is married and has three school-age children. To earn a living, Madeline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she runs a general store, where her primary source of income is derived from selling a variety of different products in her local community. Madeline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Madeline joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she was better able to engage in business activities and to help improve her family's standard of living. Madeline recently and successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC in the amount of 3,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to expand her product lines. Madeline is now requesting a new loan, again in the amount of 3,000 PHP ($75), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Madeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen micro-finance model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi K., pictured with her husband, is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and their three children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products.

To earn a living, Chi sells groceries. On average, she earns an income of approximately $5 per day. Her husband raises pigs at home. Chi has to spend approximately $80 on food, $10 on electricity and water supplies, and $125 on other necessary living expenses every month. Chi is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase more groceries for re-sale purposes. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits generated from her business to repair her family's house. This would be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Nhagn

texts.en:
Nhagn P. is a 47-year-old village chief. He lives with his wife in the Takeo province of Cambodia. He and his wife have four children, one of whom is employed in the construction industry.

He explains that, on average, he earns $2 per day. His wife is a farmer (she grows rice and vegetables), and she typically earns $3 per day. Nhagn is now seeking a loan in the amount of $1,125 to raise pigs.

loans.use: To start a pig-raising business

loans.name: Godie

texts.en:
Godie D. is a 40-year-old woman from the village of Pangalalan. Godie is married and has 3 school-age children. To earn a living, Godie owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector. Specifically, her primary source of income is derived from raising pigs for sale. Godie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Godie joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she expects to be better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Godie is requesting her first loan through PMPC in the amount of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of the loan to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen micro-finance model.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea M., 30, is married and lives with her husband and three young children in the Takeo province. She grows rice and sells grocery items with her husband, typically making $3 of profit a day. Chea M. needs a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som M. is 49 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She sells groceries and makes $2 each day. Her husband has been a soldier since 1970 and makes $3 per day. This couple has two school-aged children. 

Som M. wants to raise pigs so she decided to take out a loan of $800 to start this business.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Phorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of ten people, is located in Kaev Chamraeun village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes in order to improve their family's living. Mrs. Sao P., who was born in 1966, is the village bank president who was selected by the other members.

She is a silk weaver at home where she is able to earn some money to support her family. She is also a farmer and owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. It is the wedding season now, so there is an increased demand for silk clothing. So Mrs. Sao P. is requesting a loan to buy more silk to make silk cloth. 

She is a widow with a child who is also weaver.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Hourt H., 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. H. and her husband sell groceries, earning an income of about $4 each per day. H. has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity and water supplies, and $60 on other necessary expenses every month.  

H. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina T. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Maricalum, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  vegetable vending and farming. Her husband, Fausto Tabo-tabo, who is 58 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 23 and 36 years old. 

Florentina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florentina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for a new business so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Florentina T. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the farm

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita M. is 53 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in Purok Ipil-ipil, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Teresita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could purchase materials for fishing. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. loans.name: Mr. Sea Paen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who live in Ta Mung village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Sea P., who was born in 1949, was selected by the other members to be the village bank president.  Each of the members will use their portion of the loan in a way that can improve their family's standard of living. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Srieng Sou, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a vice chief in their village and receives a low salary to help support his family. 

In the rice field, he has some problems because his field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mr. Sea P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. 

He is the father of three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena T. is 38 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a business of selling salted eggs. She lives in Brgy. Cambaog, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her salted egg business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Elena is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could continue to purchase more stock of salted eggs to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila P. is 34 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rolly P., a laborer. Together they have a child who is currently in college. By the grace of God, Precila has managed to support her child's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continue to provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Precila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy a sachet of shampoo, a bit of cooking oil or an egg. She earns revenue by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling them at retail price.  Her store is located next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales everyday.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a  loan of 13, 000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her store's inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Precila dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.name: Tseveenkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Tseveenkhuu S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a small house, except for his daughter, Otgonzul, who is 15 and lives separately.  Their son, Lkhavgabayar, is 9 and is a local secondary school student.  

He has been operating a taxi business in the city with his own car for three years. He enjoys transporting people. Tseveenkhuu is a very hardworking person, and in the future he is planning to build a wooden house for his beloved daughter.

His wife, Oyunchimeg, recently opened a butcher shop in “Denjiin 1000” food market, and she took out a loan from KIVA. She used it appropriately and paid it back in full on time.  The loan he is requesting is for his wife’s business expansion.

She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day. Feliza also manages their own pineapple farm.

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Chorng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Ta Mung village in Takeo province, fourteen people are in the group that is taking out a village bank loan.  Mrs. LE. C., who is the village bank president, is 44-years-old and has been selected by all the members in this village bank loan group.  

They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in to improve their family living.  Mrs. LE. C. and her husband, Mr. Norn Nut, are farmers who own more than two-hectares of land where they grow rice to sell some to support her family.  This is the growing season now and she does not have enough money to support her farming.  So to solve this problem, Mrs. LE. C. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticides. 

She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are studying and helping their parents’ business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticides.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia M., 58, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo M., a farmer. Together they work hard to be able to provide their family with finances for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a fruit and vegetable stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells green and ripe mangoes, melons, watermelons, and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her product inventory are garlic and onions, tomatoes, and other staples for simple cooking recipes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Virginia hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.
